description:
Overview

We are seeking a motivated and hands-on CMT Field Technician to join our team and support engineering, environmental services, materials testing, and inspection projects. In this role, you will conduct on-site inspections, materials testing, and environmental sampling to ensure construction, infrastructure, and environmental projects meet industry standards and regulatory requirements.

As a CMT Field Technician, you will work alongside experienced professionals, gaining practical field experience, developing technical skills, and contributing to critical projects that impact communities. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, safety-conscious, and thrives in outdoor work environments, solving challenges in real time and collaborating with a team. This position requires frequent travel to job sites and offers excellent opportunities for growth, technical training, and career advancement in a dynamic industry.

Responsibilities
• Conduct field and laboratory testing of soil, concrete, asphalt, aggregate, and other construction materials to verify compliance with project specifications, industry standards, and regulatory requirements.
• Properly collect, label, and transport samples from job sites to laboratories for further testing and analysis.
• Ensure that project testing requirements are met and compliant with project specifications, requirements, and company policies or procedures.
• Complete detailed reports, logs, and documentation of test results, ensuring accuracy and timely submission to project managers and stakeholders.
• Ensure all testing equipment is properly maintained, and functioning correctly, following company and manufacturer guidelines.
• Accurately document test results, observations, and site conditions, preparing and submitting timely and detailed reports, logs, and presentations in accordance with company standards.
• Communicate effectively with dispatch, field supervisors, contractors, and project managers, providing real-time updates on job status, site conditions, and any issues encountered.
• Adhere to project timelines and schedules, reporting to job sites on time and completing assignments within established deadlines.
• Adapt to changing project requirements, schedules, and weather conditions, maintaining flexibility to support business needs.
• Participate in ongoing training and certification programs, as required, to maintain technical proficiency and industry compliance.
• Follow strict safety protocols and OSHA regulations to maintain a safe work environment, including proper use of personal protective equipment (PPE) and adherence to company and client safety guidelines.
• Operate and maintain an assigned company vehicle, including scheduling routine maintenance (oil changes, tire checks, fluid levels) and ensuring general cleanliness inside and out.
• Perform other duties as assigned to support project goals and company initiatives.

Qualifications
• High school diploma or equivalent required; vocational training or coursework in construction, engineering, geology, or a related field is a plus.
• 0-3 years of experience in a field-based, outdoor, or physically demanding role preferred (construction, materials testing, geotechnical, or related industry experience is a plus).
• Valid driver’s license with an acceptable driving record; ability to operate company-assigned vehicles safely.
• Industry certifications such as ACI Level 1 Concrete Testing, or ability to obtain within a specified time period.
• Commitment to workplace safety, following OSHA standards and company safety policies, including the proper use of personal protective equipment (PPE).
• Basic computer proficiency, including experience with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook) and Field Data Collection (FDC) software or similar industry tools.
• Mathematical skills sufficient to add, subtract, multiply, and divide into all units of measure using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals.
• Ability to read, write, and interpret blueprints, procedures, manuals, technical documents, and reports related to drilling, safety, and project requirements.
• Ability to perform physical tasks, including lifting and carrying equipment weighing up to 50 lbs., standing for extended periods, and working in various weather and environmental conditions.
• Efficient time management, organizational, and problem-solving skills, with the ability to complete tasks efficiently and accurately.
• Attention to detail to ensure accurate sample collection, testing procedures, and documentation.
• Ability to work independently and collaboratively, demonstrating a strong work ethic and commitment to producing high-quality results.
• Flexibility to work varying schedules, including early mornings, weekends, overtime, and potential overnight travel as project demands require.

Physical Demands & Work Environment

This position primarily works in an outdoor work environment, regularly exposed to varying field conditions, including:
• Sites that may not be accessible by vehicle, requiring travel on foot through wetlands, swamps, grasslands, fields, and other uneven or rugged terrain with natural and man-made obstacles such as sand, brush, and debris.
• Moderate to loud noise levels, common in active construction and industrial environments.
• Exposure to environmental elements including dirt, dust, sun, heat, humidity, and adverse weather conditions.

The physical requirements for this position may include and are not limited to:
• Ability to lift and/or carry 35 to 75 lbs. up to 75 feet, involving regular repetitive motion.
• Ability to stand, walk, drive, and operate equipment for extended periods.
• Frequent use of hands and arms for typing, handling tools, and operating equipment.
• Ability to bend, twist, reach, stoop, pull, kneel, climb, balance, lift, carry, and push as required for fieldwork and inspections.
• Ability to speak and hear effectively to communicate in noisy environments and with project teams.
• Ability to use your senses to see (including close, distant, and peripheral vison, depth vision, and ability to focus) smell, hear, touch (use hands to reach climb or balance, crouch, stoop, crawl, kneel and sit).

Who We Are

UES is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is proud to recruit the most qualified candidates. Please see our full EEO Statement here

ID 2025-1427

Position Type Full-Time

Location US-TX-Fort Worth

medida utilizando números enteros, fracciones comunes y decimales, Capacidad para leer, escribir e interpretar planos, procedimientos, manuales, documentos técnicos e informes relacionados con la description_final: Descripción general estamos buscando un técnico de campo CMT motivado y práctico para unirse a nuestro equipo y apoyar a los proyectos de ingeniería, servicios ambientales, pruebas de materiales y inspección. En este rol, realizará inspecciones en el sitio, pruebas de materiales y muestreo ambiental para garantizar que la construcción, la infraestructura y los proyectos ambientales cumplan con los estándares de la industria y los requisitos reglamentarios. Como técnico de campo CMT, trabajará junto con profesionales experimentados, obteniendo experiencia práctica en el campo, desarrollar habilidades técnicas y contribuir a proyectos críticos que afecten a las comunidades. El candidato ideal está orientado a los detalles, consciente de la seguridad y prospera en entornos de trabajo al aire libre, resolviendo desafíos en tiempo real y colaborando con un equipo. Este puesto requiere viajes frecuentes a sitios de trabajo y ofrece excelentes oportunidades para el crecimiento, la capacitación técnica y el avance profesional en una industria dinámica. Las responsabilidades realizan pruebas de campo y laboratorio de suelo, concreto, asfalto, agregado y otros materiales de construcción para verificar el cumplimiento de las especificaciones del proyecto, los estándares de la industria y los requisitos reglamentarios. Recopilar, etiquetar y transportar adecuadamente las muestras de sitios de trabajo a laboratorios para más pruebas y análisis. Asegúrese de que los requisitos de prueba del proyecto se cumplan y cumplan con las especificaciones del proyecto, los requisitos y las políticas o procedimientos de la empresa. Completas informes detallados, registros y documentación de los resultados de las pruebas, asegurando la precisión y la presentación oportuna a los gerentes y partes interesadas del proyecto. Asegúrese de que todos los equipos de prueba se mantengan correctamente y funcionen correctamente, siguiendo las pautas de la compañía y el fabricante. Documente con precisión los resultados de las pruebas, observaciones y condiciones del sitio, preparando y enviando informes, registros y presentaciones oportunos y detallados de acuerdo con los estándares de la empresa. Comuníquese de manera efectiva con el despacho, los supervisores de campo, los contratistas y los gerentes de proyectos, proporcionando actualizaciones en tiempo real sobre el estado del trabajo, las condiciones del sitio y cualquier problema encontrado. Adhiera los plazos y los horarios del proyecto, informando a los sitios de trabajo a tiempo y completar las tareas dentro de los plazos establecidos. Adapte a los requisitos cambiantes del proyecto, los horarios y las condiciones climáticas, manteniendo la flexibilidad para apoyar las necesidades comerciales. Participe en programas continuos de capacitación y certificación, según sea necesario, para mantener el dominio técnico y el cumplimiento de la industria. Siga los estrictos protocolos de seguridad y las regulaciones de OSHA para mantener un entorno de trabajo seguro, incluido el uso adecuado de equipos de protección personal (PPE) y el cumplimiento de las pautas de seguridad de la empresa y el cliente. Opere y mantenga un vehículo de la empresa asignado, incluida la programación de mantenimiento de rutina (cambios de aceite, controles de neumáticos, niveles de líquido) y garantizar la limpieza general por dentro y por fuera. Realice otras tareas asignadas para apoyar los objetivos del proyecto y las iniciativas de la empresa. Se requieren calificaciones Diploma de escuela secundaria o equivalente; La capacitación vocacional o los cursos en construcción, ingeniería, geología o un campo relacionado es una ventaja. 0-3 años de experiencia en un rol preferido a base de campo, al aire libre o físicamente exigente (construcción, pruebas de materiales, experiencia geotécnica o de la industria relacionada es una ventaja). Licencia de conducir válida con un registro de conducción aceptable; Capacidad para operar vehículos asignados a la compañía de manera segura. Certificaciones de la industria, como las pruebas de concreto ACI Nivel 1, o la capacidad de obtener dentro de un período de tiempo específico. Compromiso con la seguridad en el lugar de trabajo, siguiendo los estándares de OSHA y las políticas de seguridad de la empresa, incluido el uso adecuado de equipos de protección personal (PPE). Competencia básica en la computadora, incluida la experiencia con el software de Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook) y Field Data Recolection (FDC) o herramientas de la industria similares. Habilidades matemáticas suficientes para sumar, restar, multiplicar y dividir en todas las unidades de medida utilizando números enteros, fracciones comunes y decimales. Capacidad para leer, escribir e interpretar planos, procedimientos, manuales, documentos técnicos e informes relacionados con la perforación, la seguridad y los requisitos del proyecto. Capacidad para realizar tareas físicas, incluidos equipos de levantamiento y transporte que pesan hasta 50 libras, que se mantienen durante períodos prolongados y trabajando en diversas condiciones climáticas y ambientales. Habilidades eficientes de gestión del tiempo, organización y resolución de problemas, con la capacidad de completar las tareas de manera eficiente y precisa. Atención al detalle para garantizar una recopilación precisa de muestra, procedimientos de prueba y documentación. Capacidad para trabajar de forma independiente y colaborativa, demostrando una fuerte ética de trabajo y un compromiso de producir resultados de alta calidad. Flexibilidad para trabajar en variables horarios, incluidas temprano en las mañanas, fines de semana, horas extras y potenciales viajes nocturnos según lo requieran las demandas del proyecto. Demandas físicas y ambiente de trabajo Esta posición funciona principalmente en un entorno de trabajo al aire libre, expuesto regularmente a diferentes condiciones de campo, que incluyen: sitios a los que puede no ser accesible por vehículo, que requiere viajar a pie a través de humedales, pantanos, praderas, campos y otros terrenos desagradables o resistentes con obstáculos naturales y hechos al hombre como arena, cepillo y caso. Niveles de ruido moderados a fuertes, comunes en la construcción activa y entornos industriales. Exposición a elementos ambientales que incluyen suciedad, polvo, sol, calor, humedad y condiciones climáticas adversas. Los requisitos físicos para esta posición pueden incluir y no se limitan a: capacidad de levantar y/o transportar 35 a 75 libras. Hasta 75 pies, que involucra un movimiento repetitivo regular. Capacidad para pararse, caminar, conducir y operar equipos durante períodos prolongados. Uso frecuente de manos y brazos para escribir, manejo de herramientas y equipos de operación. Capacidad para doblar, torcer, alcanzar, agacharse, tirar, arrodillarse, escalar, equilibrar, levantar, transportar y empujar según sea necesario para el trabajo de campo e inspecciones. Capacidad para hablar y escuchar de manera efectiva para comunicarse en entornos ruidosos y con equipos de proyectos. Capacidad para usar sus sentidos para ver (incluyendo visón cercano, distante y periférico, visión de profundidad y capacidad de enfocar) olor, escuchar, tocar (use las manos para alcanzar la escalada o el equilibrio, agacharse, agacharse, arrastrarse, arrodillarse y sentarse). Quien somos UES es un empleador de igualdad de oportunidades y se enorgullece de reclutar a los candidatos más calificados. Consulte nuestra instrucción EEO completa aquí ID 2025-1427 Tipo de posición Ubicación a tiempo completo US-TX-Fort Worth
EURACE_skills: Gestión, Comunicación efectiva, Trabajo en equipo, Ética profesional
initial_skills: planificación, presentaciones, trabajo en equipo, cumplimiento

description:
Description

At American Packaging Corporation (APC), you’ll find the packaging career you’ve been looking for. With competitive salaries, excellent benefits, 401(k) plans and tuition reimbursement programs, we nurture our employees while advancing and promoting diversity and inclusion. As the leading flexible packaging converter in North America for over a century, APC’s longstanding success is fueled from the inside out. We’re constantly seeking to improve our internal operations and were named a “Best of the Best” in the Best workplaces in the America’s awards for 12 years in a row. It’s how and why we engage the best and brightest talent to continue propelling our shared success into the future.

LOCATION: COE

SUMMARY: Loading and unloading inbound and outbound trucks, staging material, inventory of raw materials, supplying machinery with raw materials and in-process rolls for production. Label and warehouse finished goods.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
• Participate in training, embrace concepts of and actively practice the SPOT Safety Program fundamentals to aid American Packaging Corporation’s efforts to achieve a zero-accident rate.
• Safely operate all fork trucks (ride-on, scissor lift, and walk behind).
• Service manufacturing machines with proper raw materials (film, boxes, adhesives, glue, paper, etc.)
• Remove (from the production floor) wrap and store all finished goods utilizing pallet location information.
• Stage outbound shipments in an organized manner utilizing release information.
• Communicate regularly with fellow S/R employees.
• Load and unload freight as it arrives & leaves the facility.
• Recharge and maintain all electric batteries on fork trucks.
• Accurately complete all monthly cycle counts.
• Receive material using AS400 system and make labels when requested.
• Organize and stack all unused pallets.
• Maintain a neat and orderly S/R work area.
• Adhere to all company safety guidelines.
• Able to work all scheduled shifts and assigned overtime.
• Attend and participate in all company mandated meetings.
• Business travel may be required.
• Any other assigned duties.

Requirements

QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE

High school diploma or GED, previous manufacturing experience preferred, but not necessary, and acceptable prior work history.

LANGUAGE SKILLS

Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of the organization.

MATHEMATICAL SKILLS

Ability to add, subtract, multiply and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions and decimals. Ability to compute percentages and interpret bar graphs.

REASONING ABILITY

Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram or schedule form.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, sit, reach with hands and arms, stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl, climb and balance. The employee is frequently required to use hands to finger, handle or feel objects, tools or controls. The employee is regularly required to talk or hear and taste or smell.

The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 35 pounds. Anything needing to be lifted that exceeds this poundage should be moved with the help of another individual or by using a mechanical aid. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, distance and the ability to adjust focus.

WORK ENVIRONMENT

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee works near moving mechanical parts and is exposed to fumes or airborne particles (works in an environment where solvent based inks are used). The employee frequently works in high, precarious places, and is exposed to electrical shock (only authorized maintenance personnel are allowed access to electrical cabinets). The noise level in the work environment is usually loud. Hearing protection is mandated. Safety glasses and steel toed shoes with anti-static discharge soles are required.

American Packaging Corporation is committed to equal opportunity for all, without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, veteran status, disability, genetic information, or any other protected characteristic. American Packaging Corporation will make reasonable accommodations for known physical or mental limitations of otherwise qualified employees and applicants with disabilities unless the accommodation would impose an undue hardship on the operation of our business. EOE/AA Disability/Veteran.

If you are interested in applying for an employment opportunity and need special assistance or an accommodation to apply for a posted position, please contact our Human Resources department at:

talentacquisition@americanpackaging.com.

description_final: Descripción en American Packaging Corporation (APC), encontrará la carrera de empaque que ha estado buscando. Con salarios competitivos, excelentes beneficios, planes 401 (k) y programas de reembolso de matrícula, fomentamos a nuestros empleados mientras avanzamos y promueven la diversidad y la inclusión. Como el convertidor de empaque flexible líder en América del Norte durante más de un siglo, el largo éxito de APC se alimenta de adentro hacia afuera. Estamos constantemente buscando mejorar nuestras operaciones internas y fuimos nombrados "mejores de lo mejor" en los mejores lugares de trabajo de los Premios de los Estados Unidos durante 12 años seguidos. Es cómo y por qué involucramos el mejor y más brillante talento para continuar impulsando nuestro éxito compartido en el futuro. Ubicación: Resumen de COE: Carga y descarga de camiones entrantes y salientes, material de preparación, inventario de materias primas, suministrando maquinaria con materias primas y rollos en proceso para la producción. Etiqueta y artículos terminados. Los deberes y responsabilidades esenciales incluyen lo siguiente. Se pueden asignar otras tareas. Participe en la capacitación, adopte los conceptos y practique activamente los fundamentos del programa de seguridad para ayudar para ayudar a los esfuerzos de American Packaging Corporation para lograr una tasa de accidente cero. Opere de forma segura todos los camiones de horquilla (Ride-On, Scissor Lift y Wink Behind). Servicio de máquinas de fabricación con materias primas adecuadas (película, cajas, adhesivos, pegamento, papel, etc. ) Elimine (del piso de producción) envuelva y almacene todos los productos terminados que utilizan información de ubicación de paletas. Envíos salientes de etapa de manera organizada utilizando información de liberación. Comunicarse regularmente con otros empleados S/R. Cargue y descargue la carga a medida que llega y sale de la instalación. Recarga y mantenga todas las baterías eléctricas en camiones de horquilla. Complete con precisión todos los recuentos de ciclos mensuales. Reciba material usando el sistema AS400 y haga etiquetas cuando se solicite. Organizar y apilar todas las paletas no utilizadas. Mantenga un área de trabajo S/R ordenada y ordenada. Adherirse a todas las pautas de seguridad de la empresa. Capaz de trabajar todos los turnos programados y horas extras asignadas. Asistir y participar en todas las reuniones obligatorias de la compañía. Se puede requerir viajes de negocios. Cualquier otra tarea asignada. Requisitos Requisitos de calificación: para realizar este trabajo con éxito, un individuo debe poder cumplir con cada deber esencial satisfactoriamente. Los requisitos que se enumeran a continuación son representativos del conocimiento, habilidad y/o habilidad requeridos. Se pueden hacer adaptaciones razonables para permitir que las personas con discapacidades realicen las funciones esenciales. Educación y/o experiencia Diploma de escuela secundaria o GED, preferida la experiencia de fabricación previa, pero no necesaria, y el historial de trabajo previo aceptable. Habilidades lingüísticas Capacidad para leer e interpretar documentos como reglas de seguridad, instrucciones de operación y mantenimiento manuales de procedimientos. Capacidad para escribir informes de rutina y correspondencia. Capacidad para hablar de manera efectiva ante grupos de clientes o empleados de la organización. Capacidad de habilidades matemáticas para sumar, restar, multiplicar y dividir en todas las unidades de medida, utilizando números enteros, fracciones comunes y decimales. Capacidad para calcular porcentajes e interpretar gráficos de barras. Capacidad de razonamiento Capacidad para resolver problemas prácticos y tratar una variedad de variables en situaciones donde solo existe una estandarización limitada. Capacidad para interpretar una variedad de instrucciones proporcionadas en forma escrita, oral, diagrama o horario. Demandas físicas Las demandas físicas descritas aquí son representativas de aquellos que un empleado debe satisfacer con éxito las funciones esenciales de este trabajo. Se pueden hacer adaptaciones razonables para permitir que las personas con discapacidades realicen las funciones esenciales. Mientras realiza las tareas de este trabajo, ocasionalmente se requiere que el empleado se pare, camine, se siente, alcance con las manos y los brazos, se agote, se arrodille, se agacha o se arrastra, suba y equilibre. Con frecuencia se requiere que el empleado use las manos para dedicar o sentir objetos, herramientas o controles. Se requiere regularmente al empleado para hablar, escuchar, probar u oler. El empleado ocasionalmente debe levantar y/o moverse hasta 35 libras. Cualquier cosa que necesite levantarse que exceda este peso debe moverse con la ayuda de otro individuo o mediante la ayuda mecánica. Las habilidades de visión específicas requeridas por este trabajo incluyen visión cercana, visión periférica, percepción de profundidad, distancia y la capacidad de ajustar el enfoque. Entorno de trabajo Las características del entorno de trabajo descritas aquí son representativas de aquellos que un empleado encuentra mientras realiza las funciones esenciales de este trabajo. Se pueden hacer adaptaciones razonables para permitir que las personas con discapacidades realicen las funciones esenciales. Mientras realiza las tareas de este trabajo, el empleado trabaja cerca de las piezas mecánicas en movimiento y está expuesto a humos o partículas en el aire (trabaja en un entorno donde se utilizan tintas a base de solventes). El empleado con frecuencia trabaja en lugares altos y precarios, y está expuesto a la descarga eléctrica (solo el personal de mantenimiento autorizado tiene acceso a gabinetes eléctricos). El nivel de ruido en el entorno de trabajo suele ser ruidoso. La protección auditiva es obligatoria. Se requieren gafas de seguridad y zapatos de acero con suelas de descarga antiestáticas. American Packaging Corporation está comprometido con la igualdad de oportunidades para todos, sin tener en cuenta la raza, la religión, el color, el origen nacional, la ciudadanía, el sexo, la orientación sexual, la identidad de género, la edad, el estado veterano, la discapacidad, la información genética o cualquier otra característica protegida. American Packaging Corporation hará adaptaciones razonables para las limitaciones físicas o mentales conocidas de los empleados y solicitantes calificados con discapacidades con discapacidades a menos que el alojamiento imponga una dificultad indebida en la operación de nuestro negocio. EOE/AA Discapacidad/Veterano. Si está interesado en solicitar una oportunidad de empleo y necesita asistencia especial o un alojamiento para solicitar un puesto publicado, comuníquese con nuestro departamento de recursos humanos en:.

description:
Come start a new career at a brand new manufacturing facility in Forney Texas. The site is just getting underway with being set up and we need material handlers to start right away! The Material Handler will be responsible for the safe and efficient movement of materials within the manufacturing facility, primarily using a sit-down forklift. The Material Handler will ensure timely delivery of materials to production lines and proper storage of finished goods and raw materials to help maintain an effective and efficient flow of production lines.

salary: $18 - $18.5 per hour
shift: First
work hours: 7 AM - 4 PM
education: No Degree Required

Responsibilities

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
• Operate forklifts (sit-down, stand-up, reach truck, etc., as applicable) to move, load, unload, and stack materials throughout the facility.
• Perform daily pre-shift forklift inspections and report any maintenance issues.
• Adhere to all safety protocols and traffic regulations while operating forklifts.
• Receive and verify incoming shipments against packing slips and purchase orders.
• Store materials in designated warehouse locations, ensuring proper labeling and organization.
• Transport raw materials and components to production areas as needed.
• Move finished goods from production lines to storage or shipping areas.
• Load and unload trucks for incoming and outgoing shipments.
• Maintain accurate inventory records through proper documentation and scanning (if applicable).
• Wrap, and band pallets as needed.
• Maintain a clean and organized warehouse environment.
• Assist with general warehouse duties, such as sweeping, organizing, and removing debris.
• Identify and report any safety hazards or maintenance issues.
• Adhere to all company safety policies and procedures.
• Wear appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE).
• Participate in safety training and meetings.
• Perform other duties as assigned.

Skills
• Product Handling
• Material Handling
• Fork Lift
• Packaging
• Inventory - Physical
• Moving Material
Qualifications
• Years of experience: 2 years
• Experience level: Experienced

description:

description:
A growing hardwood flooring company in Orange is looking for a Material Handler who wants to grow with the company. The company specializes in installing and repairing hardwood floors. You’ll be working in a fast-paced environment and will be cross-trained in every department. The position starts material handler on the line however, for the right candidate, they will be trained as a line supervisor to manage the finishing production line. This could take 4-6 months and will require learning how to mix colors, and use testing equipment to ensure finish has been applied correctly.
This is a temp-to-hire position and the hours are Monday through Friday, 5:00AM to 1:30PM, with possible overtime. The starting pay is $20 an hour. Should you be hired by the company, an excellent package of employee benefits is available.

Qualifications:
• Bilingual (Spanish/English) is a Big Plus!
• Previous experience in a warehouse/material handling environment
• Experience working with wood is a plus
• Able to work with little supervision
• Excellent verbal and communication skills
• Reliable & available to work overtime when necessary
• High school graduate or GED
• Willing to submit to drug screen and background check

Benefits:
• Company-paid employee healthcare and group rates for family members
• Generous profit-sharing plan
• Up to 3 weeks’ vacation after five years of employment
• Team building events throughout the year
• Opportunities for promotion

Compensation / Pay Rate (Up to): $20.00 - $20.00

description:
A Material Handler needs to be able to operate powered industrial machinery. They may need to use scanners to keep track of the items they are moving. They may also need to prepare those items to be moved, by placing them on pallets, wrapping them, etc. **this position will start through our staffing agency then hired directly if/when eligible. Currently seeking 2nd shift position 4:30pm-4:00am.

Other Duties Include
• Efficiently and safely operating hi-low and control movement of lifting equipment.
• Position forks or clamps under, over, or around loaded pallets, skids, boxes, or materials and transport load to designated area.
• Load and unload materials onto or off trailers.
• Unload and stack material by raising and lowering lifting device.
• Assist in tracking inventory of materials on work floor and supply production workers with materials as needed. Clear production area of finished goods and relocate to appropriate area.
• Lubricate truck, recharge batteries, fill fuel tank.
• Complete a daily checklist of the industrial truck and communicate needed maintenance/repair issue is discovered.
• Operate industrial truck in safe manner and adhere to all safety rules, guidelines, and practices.
• Complete all other duties the Supervisor deems necessary.

Job Details
• 2nd shift 4:30pm-4:00am.
• Overtime paid after 40 hours.
• $17.00/hr. (2nd shift receives $1.00 premium).
• Paid weekly.
• Full time.
• Paid training.

Qualifications
• Great coordination.
• Good vision and depth perception.
• Ideal reaction time.
• Ability to coordinate your own actions with those of others on a work team.
• Must be well-versed in technical specifications of the specific vehicles driven.
• Capable of performing routine maintenance on the industrial trucks driven.
• Six months or more of directly related experience preferred.
• Be able to perform all physical components of the position.

description:
POSITION SUMMARY
U.S. AutoForce, a division of U.S. Venture, Inc., brings together more than 100 years of experience as an industry leader in the distribution of tires, undercar parts, and lubricants to independent tire retailers, auto repair shops, and automotive dealerships.

The schedule for this position is Sunday thru Thursday 3:00 PM to 11:30 PM. Schedules are subject to change based on business needs and may require overtime.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
• Load, unload, stock tires and auto parts in a fast-paced warehouse environment using industrial vehicles such as a forklift or picker equipment
• Use scanners to find and put away tires and assist with inventory control
• You can expect to lift 50 pounds consistently throughout your shift and occasionally lift up to 80 pounds. When lifting commercial tires you will do team lifts or use mechanical equipment.
• When working with barrels or industrial/agricultural tires you will need to be able to exert a pushing force of up to 40 pounds
• Some of our stock racks are 25 feet tall, so you must be comfortable working at those heights safely while operating equipment.
• Be on the move. You should be willing and able to work on your feet for extended periods of time and work overtime as needed
• Contribute to our culture of safety, ensuring adherence to all safety policies and operating procedures.
• May assist other departments, such as ecomm, inventory, and will call depending on business needs
• The duties listed in this job description are not exhaustive. Team members may be asked to perform other job-related tasks and follow any job-related instructions given by their supervisor, subject to reasonable accommodations

OUR BENEFITS
• Highly competitive wages starting at [$20.50/hr]!
• Weekly pay
• Work boot reimbursement program
• Healthcare benefits, available your first day on the job
• 401(k) with Generous Employer Contribution AND Match
• Paid Vacation, Sick time and Holidays
• On-the-job training and skill development
• Tuition Reimbursement
• Employee Discount Programs

Physical Demands and Work Environment

Physical demands: While performing the duties of this job, the employee must be qualified as to visual, auditory, physical, and mental ability to operate equipment safely with or without reasonable accommodation. The employee must frequently lift products weighing up to approximately 50 pounds, and occasionally up to 80 pounds. Occasionally exert a pushing force up to 40 pounds. Handling of commercial tires (e.g., rolling, destacking, team lifting) conduct team lifts or use mechanical equipment.
Protective equipment required: steel or composite toe boots, safety vest, safety harness , seatbelt, SRL (self-retracting lifeline). All equipment is provided by U.S. AutoForce except for steel / composite toe boots. All team members must be able to adhere with safety and manufacture guidelines for compliant use of all protective equipment.
Work environment: While performing the duties of this job, the employee may be exposed to weather conditions prevalent at the time. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. Fumes associated with tires and occasionally car parts and lubricants prevalent.

QUALIFICATIONS
• Must be 18 years or older to operate equipment
• 1 year of warehouse/logistics or relevant experience
• Ability to safely lift 50 pounds consistently and occasionally lift up to 80 pounds
• Ability to exert a pushing force of up to 40 pounds - working with barrels and industrial/agricultural tires
• Ability to work at heights of 25 feet while operating equipment and maintaining safety standards
• Abide by all Company safety policies and state and federal transportation regulations and manufacturing guidelines
• Ability to pass forklift certification
• Willing to work overtime as needed
• Ability to follow instructions and safe operating procedures
• Ability to work in a team environment
• Successfully pass a pre-employment drug test (do not test for THC / marijuana)

DIVISION:
U.S. AutoForce

U.S. Venture requires that a team member have and maintain authorization to work in the country in which the role is based. In general, U.S. Venture does not sponsor candidates for nonimmigrant visas or permanent residency unless based on business need.

U.S. Venture will not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of an executed recruitment Master Service Agreement, there will be no obligation to any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without an agreement, U.S. Venture shall reserve the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. description:
Description

Working hard for something we love is called PASSION.

Pleasurecraft Engine Group proudly manufactures marine engines in Little Mountain, SC. With the overall mission of “Building Engines to the Glory of God”, Pleasurecraft strives to be recognized as the employer of choice by building an environment focused on making life better for our employees, our industry, and our community.

The Material Handler will assist our warehouse team with the following tasks:
• Pack and construct boxes as assigned
• Warehouse support - locate and move materials, supplies, and finished goods through the facility
• Inspect and examine materials and finished goods for quality concerns
• Follow proper recording and tracking procedures
• Stack skids or pallets in designated area
• Collect and dispose of scrap, cardboard, and strapping to placing in proper containers or designated areas
• Support pulling of product from warehouse racks to supply order fulfillment
• Performs cleaning duties
• Meet daily production goals
• Will work on a variety of tasks and assignments as required
• Follow all safety rules and use required (PPE) Personal Protective Equipment
• Work and communicate cooperatively and productively with other Team Members in order to complete tasks with a high level of accuracy
• Perform other duties as assigned

Requirements

Required Qualifications:
• Must be able to push, pull, bend, stoop, reach and lift 35lbs on a regular basis
• Must be authorized to work in the United States

Preferred Qualifications:
• Experience in production, packing or manufacturing setting
• Experience operating an electric pallet jack

Employment Statement

Be a part of an innovative, world class leader in the marine engine industry working with a company that has brand name recognition and a reputation for quality and success. Pleasurecraft values people, performance and philanthropy and is passionate about making a difference in the world.

This job posting reflects the general details considered necessary to describe the core functions of the job and shall not necessarily be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be inherent in the job. Job postings do not constitute an employment agreement or contract of employment, expressed or implied. Unless designated in writing and signed by the President, all Pleasurecraft Engine Group employees are considered to be “EMPLOYED AT WILL.” Pleasurecraft Engine Group reserves the right to change, alter and amend job postings to serve the needs of the Company.

Pleasurecraft is an Equal Opportunity Employer including Disability/Vets.

Offers of employment are contingent upon successful completion of a pre-employment background and drug screen.

Calificaciones preferidas de los Estados Unidos: la experiencia en producción, empaque o configuración de fabricación experiencia en operar una declaración de empleo de Pallet Jack de electricidad es parte de un innovador líder de clase mundial en la industria de los motores marinos que trabaja con una empresa que tiene reconocimiento de marca y una reputación de calidad y éxito. Pleasurecraft valora a las personas, el rendimiento y la filantropía y le apasiona marcar la diferencia en el mundo. Esta publicación de trabajo refleja los detalles generales considerados necesarios para describir las funciones centrales del trabajo y no necesariamente se interpretará como una descripción detallada de todos los requisitos de trabajo que pueden ser inherentes al trabajo. Pleasurecraft Engine Group se reserva el derecho de cambiar, alterar y modificar las publicaciones de trabajo para satisfacer las necesidades de la empresa. description:
Material Handler II – Rochester, NY (onsite)

Arxada is a global specialty chemicals business that’s committed to solving the world’s toughest preservation challenges through better science. [With a proud history of innovation dating back more than a century], we aim to help our customers develop more sustainable solutions that protect and maintain the health and wellbeing of people and extend the life of vital infrastructure while working to reduce our and our customers’ ecological footprint.

Sustainable preservation is one of our top priorities. We are making significant strategic investments that will not only decrease our own environmental footprint, but also help customers adapt to long-term environmental a

and social change through the development of cleaner, greener solutions.

Verify and maintain records on incoming and outgoing shipments. Prepare items for shipment. Duties include assembling, addressing, stamping, and shipping merchandise or material; receiving, unpacking, verifying, and recording incoming merchandise or material; and arranging for the transportation of products.

Essential Job Functions:
• Examine shipment contents and compare with records, such as manifests, invoices, or orders, to verify accuracy.
• Requisition and store shipping materials and supplies to maintain inventory of stock.
• Prepare documents, such as work orders, bills of lading, or shipping orders, to route materials.
• Pack, seal, label, or affix postage to prepare materials for shipping, using hand tools, power tools, or postage meter.
• Record shipment data, such as weight, charges, space availability, damages, or discrepancies, for reporting, accounting, or recordkeeping purposes.
• Use of bar code technology, systems, and hardware.
• Prepares and loads shipments of hazardous waste and manages hazardous waste in areas where they are accumulated.

Qualifications & Experience:
• HS Diploma.
• Mechanical aptitude.
• Technology and tools.
• SAP, forklift experience required, Microsoft.

The expected salary range for this role is $21.20hr – $25.91hr; specific employee compensation may vary depending on factors including experience, education, training, licensure, certification, location and other job-related, non-discriminatory factors permitted by law.

This role is also eligible to earn a short-term incentive bonus and the following benefits: 401(k) plan, medical, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance, paid time off, paid holidays and paid sick leave.

Arxada has world class offering in two distinct areas:

Microbial Control Solutions (MCS) focuses on threats posed by microorganisms to people and planet through five distinct business lines including Professional Hygiene, Home & Personal Care, Wood Protection, Paints & Coatings and Material Protection.

Nutrition, Care & Environmental (NCE), meanwhile, provides materials used to manufacture composites for electronics, aerospace, and other markets, as well as vitamins and nutritional ingredients, chemicals and performance intermediates, and raw materials for a wide range of high-performance applications.

Arxada is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a qualified individual with disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

skills: Diploma HS, Aptitud mecánica, Tecnología y herramientas, SAP, requerido experiencia en la carretilla elevadora, Microsoft, y cambio social a través del desarrollo de soluciones más limpias y verdes, Verificar y mantener registros sobre envíos entrantes y salientes, Preparar artículos para el envío, Las tareas incluyen ensamblar, dirigir, estampar y enviar mercancías o material; recibir, desempaquetar, verificar y grabar mercancía o material entrante; y organizar el transporte de productos, Examine el contenido del envío y compare con registros, como manifestaciones, facturas u órdenes, para verificar la precisión, Solicitar y almacenar materiales y suministros de envío para mantener el inventario de existencias, Prepare documentos, como órdenes de trabajo, facturas de embarque o pedidos de envío, para enrutar materiales, Pack, sellar, etiquetar o colocar franqueo para preparar materiales para el envío, usar herramientas manuales, herramientas eléctricas o medidores de franqueo, Registrar datos de envío, como peso, cargos, disponibilidad de espacio, daños o discrepancias, para informes, contabilidad o fines de mantenimiento de registros, Uso de tecnología de código de barras, sistemas y hardware, Prepara y carga envíos de desechos peligrosos y administra los desechos peligrosos en áreas donde se acumulan
description_final: Material Handler II Rochester, NY (en el sitio) Arxada es un negocio mundial de productos químicos especializados que se compromete a resolver los desafíos de preservación más difíciles del mundo a través de una mejor ciencia. [Con una orgullosa historia de innovación que data de más de un siglo], nuestro objetivo es ayudar a nuestros clientes a desarrollar soluciones más sostenibles que protejan y mantengan la salud y el bienestar de las personas y extiendan la vida de la infraestructura vital mientras trabajan para reducir nuestra huella ecológica y nuestros clientes. La preservación sostenible es una de nuestras principales prioridades. Estamos haciendo inversiones estratégicas significativas que no solo disminuirán nuestra propia huella ambiental, sino que también ayudan a los clientes a adaptarse al cambio ambiental a largo plazo y al cambio social a través del desarrollo de soluciones más limpias y verdes. Verifique y mantenga registros sobre envíos entrantes y salientes. Prepare artículos para el envío. Las tareas incluyen ensamblar, dirigir, estampar y enviar mercancías o material; recibir, desempaquetar, verificar y grabar mercancía o material entrante; y organizar el transporte de productos. Funciones de trabajo esenciales: examine el contenido del envío y compare con registros, como manifiestas, facturas u órdenes, para verificar la precisión. Solicitar y almacenar materiales y suministros de envío para mantener el inventario de existencias. Prepare documentos, como órdenes de trabajo, facturas de embarque o pedidos de envío, para enrutar los materiales. Empaque, sellar, etiquetar o colocar franqueo para preparar materiales para el envío, usar herramientas manuales, herramientas eléctricas o medidores de franqueo. Registre los datos de envío, como peso, cargos, disponibilidad de espacio, daños o discrepancias, para informes, contabilidad o fines de mantenimiento de registros. Uso de tecnología de código de barras, sistemas y hardware. Prepara y carga los envíos de desechos peligrosos y gestiona los desechos peligrosos en áreas donde se acumulan. Calificaciones y experiencia: Diploma HS. Aptitud mecánica. Tecnología y herramientas. SAP, se requiere experiencia de montacargas, Microsoft. El rango salarial esperado para este rol es de $ 21. 20 horas $ 25. 91 horas; La compensación específica de los empleados puede variar según factores que incluyen experiencia, educación, capacitación, licencia, certificación, ubicación y otros factores no discriminatorios relacionados con el trabajo permitidos por la ley. Este rol también es elegible para ganar un bono de incentivo a corto plazo y los siguientes beneficios: 401 (k) Plan, seguro médico, dental, de visión, vida y discapacidad, tiempo libre pagado, vacaciones pagas y licencia por enfermedad pagada. Arxada tiene una oferta de clase mundial en dos áreas distintas: las soluciones de control microbiano (MCS) se centran en las amenazas planteadas por los microorganismos para las personas y el planeta a través de cinco líneas comerciales distintas que incluyen higiene profesional, cuidado del hogar y personal, protección de la madera, pinturas y recubrimientos y protección de materiales. Mientras tanto, la nutrición, el cuidado y el medio ambiente (NCE) proporciona materiales utilizados para fabricar compuestos para electrónica, aeroespacial y otros mercados, así como vitaminas e ingredientes nutricionales, productos químicos e intermedios de rendimiento, y materias primas para una amplia gama de aplicaciones de alto rendimiento. Arxada es un empleador de igualdad de oportunidades. Todos los solicitantes calificados recibirán una consideración para el empleo sin tener en cuenta la raza, la religión, el color, el origen nacional, el sexo, la orientación sexual, la identidad de género, la edad, el estatus como un individuo calificado con discapacidad, estatus veterano protegido o cualquier otra característica protegida por la ley. description:
General Overview: Responsible for directing and managing down hole commodities and logistics supply. Proactively ensures on-site inventory levels are continually maintained. Position requires continuous understanding of on-site operations and completion times with a focus on safety and accurate forecasting. Position involves supply management, accurate communications, delivery guidance and quality service assurance.

Responsibilities
• Responsible for exercising discretion and making independent judgments concerning down hole commodities and logistics purchasing activities.
• Compile and submit a series of inventory and forecasting reports on a daily, weekly, or monthly basis as specified by the Materials Manager.
• Responsible for providing accurate details of on-hand inventory, inventory in-transit and forecast with budgeted sales.
• Continually works with sales and operations to forecast demands.
• Must continually evaluate supplier/vendor performance and make recommendations for process improvements.
• Will assist Material Manager with procurement operations and other related projects as assigned.
• Disseminates company goals and objectives and ensures they are adhered to.
• Responsible for comparing vendor price variance on a quarterly basis.
• Represents company with highest level of professionalism.
• Provide updates for material status and open purchase orders.
• Coordinates scheduling for orders based in material lead times and arrival dates.
• Maintains integrity and accuracy of the physical inventory by location.
• Maintains records/spreadsheets for repairs and plan for future requirements based on orders, production schedules and forecasts.
• Works closely with supply chain Buyers & operations personnel to prepare, execute and follow material orders and deliveries.
• Helps to maintain inventory traceability and accuracy.
• Microsoft NAV experience will be a helpful.
• Conducts audit related activities including obtaining and analyzing data, reviewing records and supporting documentation, completing audit work papers, completing audit findings worksheets, and submitting audit findings for review, discussion, update, and approval.
• Ensures company policies and procedures are adhered to at all times.
• Perform other related duties as required.

Other Requirements
• Bachelor's degree preferred, or equivalent work experience required.
• Minimum of two (2) years' experience with personnel and inventory management.
• Background in gas/oil field fracturing operations or pneumatic trucking preferred.
• Must be proficient with MS Office suite with an emphasis on Excel.
• Must be able to communicate effectively through oral and written skills.
• Essential identification skills, identifying and recognizing changes in circumstances, proactively develops alternative options.
• Knowledge of safety policies, procedures and regulations associated with bulk pneumatic trucks.
• Must be computer proficient.
• Knowledge of business and management principles including strategic planning, resource allocation, leadership technique, production methods, and coordination of people and resources.
• Proven communication and organizational skills to coordinate, communicate, and implement company goals.
• Sensitive to confidential information.
• Must work independently and as a member of team.

Mental and Physical Requirements
• Able to read, speak and write English.
• Able to work under stressful conditions at times.
• Employees are regularly required to sit, walk and stand; climb up and down stairs; talk or hear, both in person and by telephone; use hands repetitively to finger, handle, feel or operate standard office equipment; bending or stooping; squatting or crouching; kneeling; pushing or pulling; reach with hands and arms; and lift up to 25 pounds.
• Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision and the ability to adjust focus.
• Minimal safety hazards; general office working conditions.
• Able to wear common protective or safety equipment such as safety shoes, glasses, gloves, hearing protection and hard hats when needed.
• Able to work under stressful conditions at all times.
• Position will require a minimum of 40 hours per week unless otherwise directed by supervisor.
• Strong work ethics of integrity and honesty striving for excellence in all activities employing accompanying communication.
• Dependability, reliability, fulfilling responsibilities.

This job description should not be interpreted as an exhaustive list of responsibilities or as an employment agreement between the employer and employee. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this classification and is subject to change as the needs of the employer and requirements of the job change. Any essential functions of this position will be evaluated as necessary should an employee/applicant be unable to perform the functions or requirements due to a disability as defined by the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA). Reasonable accommodation for the specific disability will be made for the employee/applicant when possible.

description_final: Descripción general general: responsable de dirigir y administrar productos de los agujeros y el suministro de logística. Asegura de manera proactiva que los niveles de inventario en el sitio se mantengan continuamente. La posición requiere una comprensión continua de las operaciones en el sitio y los tiempos de finalización con un enfoque en la seguridad y el pronóstico preciso. El puesto implica la gestión de suministro, las comunicaciones precisas, la orientación de entrega y la garantía de servicios de calidad. Responsabilidades responsables de ejercer discreción y hacer juicios independientes con respecto a las actividades de compra de productos básicos y logística de agujeros. Compile y envíe una serie de informes de inventario y pronóstico de forma diaria, semanal o mensual según lo especificado por el gerente de materiales. Responsable de proporcionar detalles precisos del inventario a mano, inventario en tránsito y pronosticar con ventas presupuestadas. Continuamente trabaja con ventas y operaciones para pronosticar demandas. Debe evaluar continuamente el rendimiento del proveedor/proveedor y hacer recomendaciones para las mejoras de procesos. Ayudará al gerente de material con operaciones de adquisición y otros proyectos relacionados asignados. Difunde las metas y objetivos de la empresa y garantiza que se adhieran. Responsable de comparar la varianza del precio del proveedor trimestralmente. Representa a la compañía con el más alto nivel de profesionalismo. Proporcione actualizaciones para el estado del material y las órdenes de compra abiertas. Coordina la programación de pedidos basados ​​en tiempos de entrega de materiales y fechas de llegada. Mantiene la integridad y precisión del inventario físico por ubicación. Mantiene registros/hojas de cálculo para reparaciones y planifica requisitos futuros basados ​​en pedidos, horarios de producción y pronósticos. Trabaja en estrecha colaboración con el personal de compradores y operaciones de la cadena de suministro para preparar, ejecutar y seguir órdenes y entregas de materiales. Ayuda a mantener la trazabilidad y precisión del inventario. La experiencia de Microsoft NAV será útil. Realiza actividades relacionadas con la auditoría que incluyen obtener y análisis de datos, revisar registros y respaldar documentación, completar documentos de trabajo de auditoría, completar hojas de trabajo de hallazgos de auditoría y enviar hallazgos de auditoría para revisión, discusión, actualización y aprobación. Asegura que las políticas y procedimientos de la compañía se cumplan en todo momento. Realizar otras tareas relacionadas según sea necesario. Se requieren otros requisitos de licenciatura preferidos, o se requiere experiencia laboral equivalente. Mínimo de dos (2) años de experiencia con personal y gestión de inventario. Antecedentes en operaciones de fracturación de gas/petróleo o transporte neumático preferido. Debe ser competente con MS Office Suite con énfasis en Excel. Debe poder comunicarse de manera efectiva a través de habilidades orales y escritas. Habilidades de identificación esenciales, identificación y reconocimiento de cambios en las circunstancias, desarrolla de manera proactiva opciones alternativas. Conocimiento de políticas de seguridad, procedimientos y regulaciones asociadas con camiones neumáticos a granel. Debe ser competente en la computadora. Conocimiento de los principios comerciales y de gestión, incluida la planificación estratégica, la asignación de recursos, la técnica de liderazgo, los métodos de producción y la coordinación de las personas y los recursos. Habilidades de comunicación y organización comprobadas para coordinar, comunicar e implementar los objetivos de la empresa. Sensible a la información confidencial. Debe trabajar de forma independiente y como miembro del equipo. Requisitos mentales y físicos capaces de leer, hablar y escribir inglés. Capaz de trabajar en condiciones estresantes a veces. Se requiere regularmente a los empleados para sentarse, caminar y pararse; sube y baja las escaleras; hablar o escuchar, tanto en persona como por teléfono; Use las manos repetidamente para dedicar, manejar, sentir u operar equipos de oficina estándar; doblar o agacharse; ponerse en cuclillas o agacharse; arrodillado; empujando o tirando; alcanzar con manos y brazos; y levante hasta 25 libras. Las habilidades de visión específicas requeridas por este trabajo incluyen visión cercana, visión de distancia y la capacidad de ajustar el enfoque. Peligros de seguridad mínimos; Condiciones de trabajo generales de la oficina. Capaz de usar equipos de protección o seguridad comunes, como zapatos de seguridad, vasos, guantes, protección auditiva y sombreros duros cuando sea necesario. Capaz de trabajar en condiciones estresantes en todo momento. La posición requerirá un mínimo de 40 horas por semana a menos que el supervisor indique lo contrario. Fuerte ética de trabajo de integridad y honestidad luchando por la excelencia en todas las actividades que emplean la comunicación que lo acompaña. Confiabilidad, confiabilidad, responsabilidades satisfactorias. Esta descripción del trabajo no debe interpretarse como una lista exhaustiva de responsabilidades o como un acuerdo de empleo entre el empleador y el empleado. Las declaraciones anteriores están destinadas a describir la naturaleza general y el nivel de trabajo que realiza los empleados asignados a esta clasificación y está sujeto a cambios como las necesidades del empleador y los requisitos del cambio de trabajo. Cualquier función esencial de este puesto se evaluará según sea necesario si un empleado/solicitante no puede realizar las funciones o requisitos debido a una discapacidad según lo definido por la Ley de Americanos con Discapacidades (ADA). Se realizará un alojamiento razonable para la discapacidad específica para el empleado/solicitante cuando sea posible.

job_title: Material Sorter- Refuse and Recycling (Clasificador de Materiales - basura y reciclaje)
description:
Rite Rug Flooring has been one of the top privately owned flooring companies for 90 years. We are looking for a Material Sorter to join our team!

$18 an hour plus weekly bonus.

Responsibilities:

Sort Materials – Hand-sort recyclable materials and be able to sort accurately organize recycled materials. Clean area in and around dumpsters.

Critical Thinking – sorting the recycling can be very fast paced and you need to be able to think how to get your tasks done in the most efficient yet safe way

Operate Equipment – it is a plus to know how to operate a forklift.

Other – Pick up and empty trash containers.

Requirements:

Must be able to stand, bend, stoop, and reach for an eight-hour shift.

Must be able to lift and carry up to 50 pounds at times

Must follow Health and Safety procures.

Must be able to pass a background check and drug test.

Be a self-started and be able to work independently.

Responsabilidades:

Clasificar materiales: clasificar a mano los materiales reciclables y poder clasificarlos con precisión y organizarlos. Limpiar el área dentro y alrededor de los contenedores de basura.

Pensamiento crítico: clasificar el material reciclable puede ser una tarea muy rápida y debe poder pensar cómo realizar sus tareas de la manera más eficiente y segura.

Operar equipos: es una ventaja saber cómo operar una carretilla elevadora.

Otros: recoger y vaciar los contenedores de basura.

Requisitos:

Debe poder pararse, agacharse, inclinarse y alcanzar un turno de ocho horas.

Debe poder levantar y transportar hasta 50 libras a veces.

Debe seguir las normas de salud y seguridad.

Debe poder pasar una verificación de antecedentes y una prueba de drogas.

Ser autodidacta y poder trabajar de forma independiente.

#ZR

description:
Material Handler
Pay: $20-$22/HR
Shift: Monday–Friday, 7:00 AM – 3:30 PM (X1 Opening)
Work Location: Roseville
Benefits: Health, Medical, Dental, Vision, PTO, 401k, 5 hours of OT each week

Job Description

This role focuses on supporting warehouse operations by filling totes, operating a scrubber machine, and handling materials. The ideal candidate will be self-directed, safety-conscious, and experienced in warehouse environments.

Responsibilities
• Fill totes for the warehouse team efficiently.
• Operate a scrubber machine to clean and maintain a safe warehouse environment.
• Work independently and manage tasks without supervision.
• Operate a forklift as required.
• Utilize RF scanners for inventory management.
• Pick and pack orders accurately.
• Load and unload trucks safely.
Essential Skills
• Minimum 6 months of forklift experience (sit-down preferred).
• At least 1 year of experience in a manufacturing or warehouse environment.
• 1+ year of experience using RF scanners.
• Basic computer literacy.
• Ability to lift up to 50 lbs repeatedly throughout the shift.
Additional Skills & Qualifications
• Steel-toe boots required.
Why Work Here?

Join a company with a great culture and benefits. We are well-known, reputable, and locally owned. Enjoy a 401K match as part of our comprehensive benefits package.

Work Environment

The role is based in a clean, well-lit warehouse setting. There will be exposure to cold temperatures during winter months due to open dock doors. Expect approximately 5 hours of overtime per week in a fast-paced, physically intensive work environment requiring frequent lifting, bending, and standing.
Pay and Benefits

The pay range for this position is $20.00 - $22.00/hr.

Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job
classification and length of employment. Benefits are subject to change and may be
subject to specific elections, plan, or program terms. If eligible, the benefits
available for this temporary role may include the following:

• Medical, dental & vision
• Critical Illness, Accident, and Hospital
• 401(k) Retirement Plan – Pre-tax and Roth post-tax contributions available
• Life Insurance (Voluntary Life & AD&D for the employee and dependents)
• Short and long-term disability
• Health Spending Account (HSA)
• Transportation benefits
• Employee Assistance Program
• Time Off/Leave (PTO, Vacation or Sick Leave)

Workplace Type

This is a fully onsite position in Roseville,MN.

Application Deadline

This position is anticipated to close on Jun 17, 2025.

About Aerotek:

We know that finding work is hard, and finding meaningful work is harder. Aerotek connects 180,000+ light industrial and skilled trades workers with 14,000+ employers each year, helping our workers navigate an evolving labor market and find jobs that meets their goals, skills and interests. Since 1983, we have provided a variety of career opportunities across North American industry – from short-term assignments at Fortune 500 companies where you can build your skills, to long-term opportunities where you can play a vital role solving for companies’ construction, manufacturing and maintenance challenges. Our 1,500+ experienced recruiters across 250+ offices work relentlessly to put our workforce in a position to thrive. Let us rise to meet your challenges and put our people-are everything spirit to the test as your career continues to grow.

Aerotek offers weekly pay, employee benefits including medical, dental & vision, life insurance, health advocacy and employee assistance programs, a 401(k) plan, and employee discounts.

The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

description:
Description

Summary

Responsible for timely and safe handling of ethanol and ethanol products. Assists in the movement of trucks and rails cars on the plant site to enable the plant to operate at maximum capacity. Ensure all tasks are completed in a safe and efficient manner according to approved training procedures and practices.

Essential Responsibilities and Duties
• Wear personal protective equipment as assigned in all areas of the plant.
• Complete all Rail Safety and Grains specific training requirements.
• Safely operates the receiving and loading systems.
• Unloads corn from trucks and rail cars, including weighing, sampling, and testing.
• Loads ethanol and ethanol products into trucks and rail cars, including weighing, sampling, and testing, as required.
• Safely moves rail cars on the plant site as necessary to facilitate effective receiving and shipping.
• Assists with maintenance and repair of receiving and shipping equipment.
• Maintains area of work according to supplied Housekeeping Lists.
• Participates and complies in safety, health and environmental policies and procedures.
• Trained and follows all city, county, state, and federal regulations relating to the shipping department.
• Coordinates activities with-in and outside department.
• Follows all guidance from the company’s laboratory to ensure all ethanol products are Certified with COA prior to loading.

Requirements

Qualifications
• Competent written and verbal skills
• Ability to perform basic computer tasks using email and spreadsheets
• Ability to handle multiple tasks
• Ability to work well with others and independently
• Exemplify the high standards necessary to accomplish the goals of the Company
• Valid driver’s license required

Education and Experience
• High school diploma or equivalent GED required.
• Experience working with machinery in an industrial environment or grain elevator preferred.
• Experience with the operation of front-end loaders, forklift trucks, and related material handling equipment preferred.

Physical Demands
• Ability to lift and/or move up to 50lbs.
• Ability to climb stairs and ladders.
• Ability to work in outside conditions and adverse weather.
• Walking, Standing, Sweeping

Working Environment
• While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly exposed to work near moving mechanical parts.
• The employee is regularly exposed to dusty conditions.
• The employee is regularly exposed to high noise environments.
• The employee is regularly exposed to outside weather in all conditions.
• The employee will regularly be exposed to chemicals used in the process.

Benefits
• Medical Insurance: SIRE covers 100% of the premium for employee-only coverage on two plans.
• Dental Insurance: SIRE covers the full premium for employee-only coverage.
• Vision Insurance: Comprehensive vision coverage available.
• Disability Coverage: Short- and long-term disability premiums fully paid by SIRE.
• Life Insurance: Employer-paid group term life insurance, with voluntary additional coverage available.
• 401(k) Retirement Plan: Employer matches 100% up to 6% of your contributions.
• Gym Membership Reimbursement: $40/month reimbursement for fitness memberships.
• Bonus Incentive Program: Quarterly and annual bonuses with a generous payout structure.
• Paid Parental Leave: Supporting employees during life's important moments.
• Supplemental Insurance Options: Accident, critical illness, and hospital indemnity plans available.
• Paid Time Off: Accruals totaling 3 weeks annually.

description_final: Descripción Resumen responsable del manejo oportuno y seguro de los productos de etanol y etanol. Ayuda en el movimiento de camiones y vagones de rieles en el sitio de la planta para permitir que la planta funcione a la máxima capacidad. Asegúrese de que todas las tareas se completen de manera segura y eficiente de acuerdo con los procedimientos y prácticas de capacitación aprobados. Las responsabilidades y deberes esenciales usan equipos de protección personal asignados en todas las áreas de la planta. Complete todos los requisitos de capacitación específicos de seguridad ferroviaria y granos. Opera de forma segura los sistemas de recepción y carga. Descarga el maíz de los camiones y los ferroviarios, incluyendo pesaje, muestreo y pruebas. Carga productos de etanol y etanol en camiones y vagones, incluyendo pesaje, muestreo y pruebas, según sea necesario. Se mueve de forma segura los vagones en el sitio de la planta según sea necesario para facilitar la recepción y el envío efectivos. Asiste con el mantenimiento y la reparación de los equipos de recepción y envío. Mantiene el área de trabajo de acuerdo con las listas de limpieza suministradas. Participa y cumple en políticas y procedimientos de seguridad, salud y medio ambiente. Capacitado y sigue a todas las regulaciones de ciudades, condados, estatales y federales relacionadas con el departamento de envío. Coordina actividades entre el departamento y fuera del departamento. Sigue toda la orientación del laboratorio de la Compañía para garantizar que todos los productos de etanol estén certificados con COA antes de la carga. Requisitos Calificaciones Competentes Escritos y habilidades verbales Capacidad para realizar tareas informáticas básicas utilizando correo electrónico y hojas de cálculo Capacidad para manejar múltiples tareas Capacidad para trabajar bien con otros y ejemplificar de forma independiente los altos estándares necesarios para lograr los objetivos de la compañía Válida Licencia de conductores Requerido Educación y experimentar Diploma de Escuela Secundaria o GED equivalente requerido. Se prefiere la experiencia de trabajar con maquinaria en un entorno industrial o ascensor de granos. Experiencia con la operación de cargadores frontales, camiones de montacargas y equipos relacionados de manejo de materiales preferidos. La capacidad de exigencia física para levantar y/o moverse hasta 50 libras. Capacidad para subir escaleras y escaleras. Capacidad para trabajar en condiciones externas y clima adverso. Caminando, de pie, ambiente de trabajo barrido mientras realiza las tareas de este trabajo, el empleado se expone regularmente al trabajo cerca de las piezas mecánicas en movimiento. El empleado está expuesto regularmente a condiciones polvorientas. El empleado está expuesto regularmente a entornos de alto ruido. El empleado está expuesto regularmente al clima externo en todas las condiciones. El empleado estará expuesto regularmente a productos químicos utilizados en el proceso. Beneficios Seguro médico: el padre cubre el 100% de la prima de la cobertura solo para empleados en dos planes. Seguro dental: el padre cubre la prima completa para la cobertura solo para empleados. Seguro de visión: cobertura de visión integral disponible. Cobertura de discapacidad: primas de discapacidad a corto y largo plazo totalmente pagados por el padre. Seguro de vida: seguro de vida a término grupal pagado por el empleador, con cobertura adicional voluntaria disponible. 401 (k) Plan de jubilación: el empleador coincide al 100% hasta el 6% de sus contribuciones. Reembolso de la membresía del gimnasio: reembolso de $ 40/mes para membresías de fitness. Programa de incentivos de bonificación: bonos trimestrales y anuales con una generosa estructura de pago. Licencia parental remunerada: apoyar a los empleados durante los momentos importantes de la vida. Opciones de seguro suplementario: accidente, enfermedad crítica y planes de indemnización del hospital disponibles. Tiempo libre pagado: acumulaciones por un total de 3 semanas anuales.

description:
Material Handler Arxada is a pioneering leader with a powerful legacy: Over 120 years of creating specialty chemicals and solutions that potentiate the performance of our customers and their products. Our solutions, our expertise and our support help them to perform better - to be more efficient, more effective and more sustainable. We are passionate about empowering high performance and enabling our employees, partners and customers to realize their full potential. Together we make daily life safer, cleaner, healthier and greener. If you like making a difference, we are the company for you! Arxada is looking for an Material Handler located in our Conley, GA office. This position is responsible for operating and maintaining equipment according to Standard Operating Procedures. This position will safely control, store and load chemicals used in the processing of wood treatment chemicals. Equipment used includes agitators, storage tanks, mixing tanks, elevators, conveyer system, drum washer, pumps, hoist and forklifts. Supports Arsenic Acid Plant in supplying Arsenic Trioxide to the process. Key Responsibilities Monitors and reviews information from materials, events, or the environment, to detect or assess problems. Patrol work areas to detect leaks or equipment malfunctions or to monitor operating conditions. Monitor gauges, recording instruments, flowmeters, or products to ensure specified conditions are maintained. Using either control mechanisms or direct physical activity to operate machines or processes. Adjust controls to regulate temperature, pressure, feed, or flow of liquids or gases, according to knowledge of equipment and processes. Observe safety precautions and display leadership by taking responsibility for his/her safety and that of others. Analyzes information and evaluate results to choose the best solution and solve problems. Use knowledge of working area to make accurate and timely decisions. Agile and supportive of a culture of process improvement and problem solving. Demonstrate an openness to trying new approaches. Observes, receives, and obtains information from all relevant sources. Enters material into SAP from shipments received or material processed for use in the Arsenic Plant. Record operational data, such as temperatures, pressures, ingredients used, processing times, or test results. Obtains samples of product for analysis by QC laboratory for testing. Inspects equipment, structures, or materials to identify the cause of errors or other problems or defects. Drive results by demonstrating persistence and motivation to overcome obstacles and challenges. Provides information to supervisors and coworkers by telephone, in written form, e-mail, or in person. Maintain customer focus and understands what internal and/or external customers need. Collaborate and generously share information and knowledge with others.
Key requirements: HS grad or GED required. Previous manufacturing experience preferred. Preferred: Prior experience in an Industrial Operations Environment or Naval Engineering. Preferred: Knowledge of raw materials, production processes, quality control, costs, and other techniques for maximizing the effective manufacture and distribution of goods. Knowledge of controlling operations of equipment or systems; ability to safely operate industrial forklift to load and unload raw materials and other equipment.
Arxada - Potentiating Performance Arxada is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a qualified individual with disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
