description_final: El manejador de materiales Arxada es un líder pionero con un poderoso legado: más de 120 años de crear productos químicos y soluciones especiales que potencian el rendimiento de nuestros clientes y sus productos. Nuestras soluciones, nuestra experiencia y nuestro apoyo los ayudan a funcionar mejor, a ser más eficientes, más efectivos y más sostenibles. Nos apasiona empoderar al alto rendimiento y permitir que nuestros empleados, socios y clientes se den cuenta de todo su potencial. Juntos hacemos la vida diaria más segura, más limpia, más saludable y más verde. Si te gusta marcar la diferencia, ¡somos la empresa para ti! Arxada está buscando un manejador de materiales ubicado en nuestra oficina de Conley, GA. Este puesto es responsable de operar y mantener el equipo de acuerdo con los procedimientos operativos estándar. Esta posición controlará, almacenará y cargará los productos químicos de forma segura en el procesamiento de productos químicos para el tratamiento de madera. El equipo utilizado incluye agitadores, tanques de almacenamiento, tanques de mezcla, ascensores, sistema de transporte, lavadora de tambor, bombas, polipolturas y carretillas elevadoras. Apoya la planta de ácido arsénico en el suministro de trióxido de arsénico al proceso. Las responsabilidades clave monitorea y revisan información de materiales, eventos o el medio ambiente, para detectar o evaluar problemas. Patrulla de áreas de trabajo para detectar fugas o mal funcionamiento del equipo o para monitorear las condiciones de funcionamiento. Monitorear los medidores, los instrumentos de grabación, los medidores de flujo o los productos para garantizar que se mantengan las condiciones especificadas. Utilizando mecanismos de control o actividad física directa para operar máquinas o procesos. Ajuste los controles para regular la temperatura, la presión, la alimentación o el flujo de líquidos o gases, de acuerdo con el conocimiento de equipos y procesos. Observe las precauciones de seguridad y muestre el liderazgo asumiendo la responsabilidad de su seguridad y la de los demás. Analiza la información y evalúa los resultados para elegir la mejor solución y resolver problemas. Use el conocimiento del área de trabajo para tomar decisiones precisas y oportunas. Ágil y apoyo de una cultura de mejora de procesos y resolución de problemas. Demuestre una apertura para probar nuevos enfoques. Observa, recibe y obtiene información de todas las fuentes relevantes. Ingresa material a SAP a partir de envíos recibidos o material procesado para su uso en la planta de arsénico. Registre los datos operativos, como temperaturas, presiones, ingredientes utilizados, tiempos de procesamiento o resultados de pruebas. Obtiene muestras de productos para el análisis de Laboratorio de CC para las pruebas. Inspecciona equipos, estructuras o materiales para identificar la causa de errores u otros problemas o defectos. Impulsar los resultados demostrando persistencia y motivación para superar los obstáculos y los desafíos. Proporciona información a los supervisores y compañeros de trabajo por teléfono, en forma escrita, correo electrónico o en persona. Mantener el enfoque del cliente y comprende lo que necesitan los clientes internos y/o externos. Colaborar y compartir generosamente información y conocimiento con los demás. Requisitos clave: HS Grad o GED requerido. Experiencia de fabricación previa preferida. Preferido: experiencia previa en un entorno de operaciones industriales o ingeniería naval. Preferido: Conocimiento de materias primas, procesos de producción, control de calidad, costos y otras técnicas para maximizar la fabricación y distribución efectiva de bienes. Conocimiento de operaciones de control de equipos o sistemas; Capacidad para operar con seguridad la carretilla elevadora industrial para cargar y descargar materias primas y otros equipos. Arxada: el rendimiento potenciador Arxada es un empleador de igualdad de oportunidades. Todos los solicitantes calificados recibirán una consideración para el empleo sin tener en cuenta la raza, la religión, el color, el origen nacional, el sexo, la orientación sexual, la identidad de género, la edad, el estatus como un individuo calificado con discapacidad, estatus veterano protegido o cualquier otra característica protegida por la ley. description:
FORCE America, Inc., is look to fill a Material Handling Position. Our material handlers must be able to efficiently pull parts for orders, ship and receive product, assist in inventory counts, move stock throughout the system, and maintain a clean and orderly warehouse.

Essential Responsibilities:
• Ship product per FORCE America defined expectations for carriers.
• Receive product per FORCE America best practice.
• Safely operate Forklift.
• Move throughout the warehouse to pull and pick orders.
• Climb ladder to store and pull product.
• Push product on cart throughout warehouse (while picking and/or shipping product)
• Stock inventory.
• Optimize shelving capacity.
• Communicate with external providers.
• Maintain a clean and orderly work environment.
• Maintain system accuracy and record transactions in ERP operating system.
• Assist in customer service or counter sales.
• Other duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications:
• High School Diploma or GED.
• 1 year of work experience.
• Strong comprehension of verbal and written work expectations.
• Able to work independently and within a team environment.
• Strong sense of urgency and ability to prioritize in order to meet the expectations of the customer.
• Detail oriented; motivated to provide the highest level of quality.

Work Environment: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential job functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
• The majority of the time will be inside conditions with protection from weather conditions, but not necessarily from temperature changes. Some work is achieved near open bays with no control over weather conditions. Work will be in a warehouse setting with frequent movement throughout the facility.

Physical Requirements: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by and employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
• Must be able to exert up to 70 lbs. of force occasionally (5 times per day) and/or up to 50 lbs. of force frequently (50 times per day) and up to 25 lbs. of force on a regular basis through the day, depending on work related circumstances.
• Must be able to lift objects from floor to above shoulder level. Must be able to move objects/parts/tools and equipment from one area to another and one level to another level.
• Strong hand-eye coordination
• Standing or Sitting for up to 4 hours at a time.
• Ability to push a cart throughout the warehouse while pulling orders or preparing shipping.
• Ability to use a ladder safely to store and/or pull product for orders.
• Reaching – extending and pulling the hand(s) and arm(s) in any direction while working with various tools as mentioned above.

EEO Policy: FORCE America, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Nuestros manejadores de materiales deben poder lograr piezas de manera eficiente para pedidos, enviar y recibir productos, ayudar en los recuentos de inventario, mover stock por todo el sistema y mantener un almacén limpio y ordenado. Fuerte sentido de urgencia y capacidad para priorizar para cumplir con las expectativas del cliente. Detalle orientado; Motivado para proporcionar el más alto nivel de calidad. description:
Description

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
• Responsible for moving and proper storage of all materials in warehouse areas.
• Required to pull materials on pick lists for operating lines.
• Assist Receiving by examining incoming material, verifying quantities and part numbers, checking for discrepancies such as damaged or unmarked parts.
• Assist in performing computer entries dealing with materials.
• Perform cycle counts on designated schedule and research/correct discrepancies in a timely manner.
• Maintain orderly, neat and clean storage areas.
• Properly maintain and complete checklist after examination forklifts as well as material handling tools.
• Verify all security measures are maintained with regards to building locks, doors, gates, secure keys, fire extinguishers, and other security efforts in place.
• Perform other duties as requested, directed, or assigned.

Requirements

Education and Experience:
• High school diploma or equivalency required.

Job Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
• Must have a valid driver’s license with no restrictions.
• Must be experienced in MS Office with an emphasis in Excel.
• Ability to properly operate equipment to safety and productivity requirements, including but not limited to forklifts, pallet jacks, and hand dollies.
• Ability to work and follow instructions with minimum supervision and foster a safe working environment.
• Must be able to work flexible hours and overtime when necessary.
• Must be able to communicate and work with others.

Training Requirements:
• Amenable to additional training and/or instruction.

Physical Job Demands:
• Moderate physical effort required. Lifting will be required.
• Pulling and pushing material on pallets with manual pallet jacks.
• Job may require standing for extended periods of time and/or working outdoors.
• Subject to random drug and alcohol testing under DOD regulations.

description:
We are seeking a highly motivated individual at our Sparks branch. As a Construction Material Stocker, you will assist in the safe and timely delivery of materials to local job sites.

Essential Functions:
• Safe loading and unloading of materials
• Job site stocking
• Ability to lift, stand and move throughout the shift

Responsibilities:
• Physically handling construction materials as used in steel stud and drywall industries
• Cleaning up all debris created by the delivery process before leaving each job site
• Preparing and staging materials for future deliveries
• Continuously abiding by all safety guidelines and procedures
• Inventory control
• Various yard duties between deliveries including but not limited to, shipping, receiving and filling customer orders

Qualifications:
• Ability to stand, climb, reach, bend and twist throughout complete shifts
• Must be comfortable working inside buildings taller than 3 stories
• Valid driver's license

What We Offer:
• Competitive Wages start at $21.00 per hour plus an annual discretionary bonus!
• Advancement Opportunities!
• Company Paid Growth Opportunities for Qualified Employees: Obtain your CDL license and NCCCO- ABL certification.
• Great Benefits: medical, dental and vision insurance, paid time off, paid holidays and many more!
• Excellent Ways to Prepare for Your Future: 401K, profit sharing, short-term and long-term disability insurance and life insurance!

Who We Are:

Our mission is to equip building professionals with the materials, service, solutions, and engineering support they need to complete their projects efficiently, safely and on time. As a preferred distributor of SCAFCO Steel Stud Company, a leading-edge name in the steel framing industry for over 25 years, we are able to maintain large inventories to limit lead time and eliminate lost productivity. Our customers have direct access to SCAFCO’s team of engineers and are able to leverage their skills to save on labor costs and improve installation efficiency.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $21.00 per hour

Benefits:
• Dental insurance
• Health insurance
• Life insurance
• Paid time off
• Vision insurance

Schedule:
• Day shift
• Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

Oportunidades de crecimiento pagadas de la compañía para empleados calificados: obtenga su licencia CDL y la certificación NCCCO-ABL. Grandes beneficios: seguro médico, dental y de visión, tiempo libre pagado, vacaciones pagas y muchos más. Excelentes formas de prepararse para su futuro: 401k, participación en las ganancias, seguro de discapacidad y seguro de vida a corto y largo plazo. Quiénes somos: nuestra misión es equipar a los profesionales de la construcción con los materiales, el servicio, las soluciones y el soporte de ingeniería que necesitan para completar sus proyectos de manera eficiente, segura y a tiempo. Como distribuidor preferido de SCAFCO Steel Stud Company, un nombre de vanguardia en la industria de encuadre de acero durante más de 25 años, podemos mantener grandes inventarios para limitar el tiempo de entrega y eliminar la pérdida de productividad. Nuestros clientes tienen acceso directo al equipo de ingenieros de SCAFCO y pueden aprovechar sus habilidades para ahorrar en los costos laborales y mejorar la eficiencia de la instalación. description:
Build Your Career with Curtis Lumber!

Founded in 1890, Curtis Lumber is a family owned and operated building materials retailer, one of 100 largest and fastest-growing in the nation. Our employees enjoy competitive pay and excellent benefits coupled with ideal business hours allowing for a healthy work life balance. We recognize our employees hard work and dedication are the driving force of our success, and we continually look for ways to reward them.

Yard Material Handlers provide exceptional customer service in our outdoor yard environment with the use of proper material handling practices and PPE to load, unload, and store material.

Starting rate $18 hourly! Annual Performance based raises!
• Inventory management and merchandising of product
• Safe and proper use of equipment and materials
• Work outside year-round in a variety of seasonal weather conditions
• Customer service skills to service our customers
• Full time 40+ hours per week – Consistent schedule – Ideal retail hours!
• Paid weekly on Fridays
• Discretionary profit share after one year of employment
• Six paid holidays and PTO Immediately
• Must be able to lift 50-80lbs regularly and able to operate a propane forklift safely
• Must wear PPE
• Building material product knowledge a plus

At Curtis Lumber we embrace a culture of accountability and safety. Join us, and you’ll quickly see everything that sets us apart is also what brings us together.

If you are ready to Build your Career, apply now to connect with our Recruitment team today!

PERKS FOR OUR PEOPLE!

Comprehensive Benefit Package - Medical, Dental, Vision • Competitive Wages • 401k with Company Match • Ideal Retail Hours • Paid Holidays & PTO • Bereavement Pay • Profit Sharing • 529 College Savings • Employee Assistance Program • Tuition Reimbursement • Boot Reimbursement • Employee Discount • Community Events • Employee Referral Program

Email us: employment@curtislumber.com

Facebook: @curtislumbercareers

YouTube: @curtislumbercareers

https://www.curtislumber.com/employment/

description:
Position Summary and Location

The Material Handler is responsible for the efficient handling and movement of materials. This role involves loading, unloading, storing, and distributing materials within the warehouse. Key responsibilities include maintaining accurate inventory records, preparing orders for shipment, and operating material handling equipment such as forklifts. The Material Handler must adhere to safety protocols and collaborate with team members to ensure smooth warehouse operations. This position requires strong attention to detail, organizational skills, and the ability to work both independently and as part of a team.

This role is located at the Warehouse in Morgan City, LA, and requires a daily on-site work schedule. Rotational on-call support for nights, weekends, and holidays is a requirement of the position.

Normal work schedule is M-F 8-5 with potential need to work overtime. Also, may be required to be on-call. Don't work on *** holidays unless on-call and called out.

Duties and Responsibilities

Safely and efficiently load, unload, move, and store material with the warehouse.

Assist in maintaining accurate inventory records, including tracking and reporting discrepancies.

Ensure an organized workspace by pick, pack, and prepare inventory, ensuring accuracy and timelines.

Examine contents and compare them with records, such as manifests, invoices, or orders, to verify the accuracy of incoming or outgoing shipments.

Properly create and maintain all shipping data to ensure accurate records.

Select appropriate shipping methods based on the nature of the items and delivery requirements.

Confer and correspond with establishment representatives to rectify problems, such as damages, shortages, and nonconformance to specifications.

Operate forklifts, pallet jacks, and other material handling equipment as needed.

Use work devices, such as hand trucks and sorting bins, to deliver or route materials to various departments.

Adhere to all safety protocols and procedures to maintain a safe working environment.

Work closely with team members and other departments to ensure seamless operations.

Perform additional tasks and responsibilities as required to support organizational objectives.

Supervisory Responsibilities

This position does not have supervisory responsibilities.

Qualifications

REQUIRED
• High School Diploma or General Education Degree (GED); or equivalent experience in a related field.
• Being part of an on-call rotation is necessary, covering nights, weekends, and holidays.
• Proficient in handling multiple tasks simultaneously in a high-engery environment and willing to embrace new challenges.
• Excellent detail orientatoin and organizational abilities
• Proficient in both independent and team-oriented tasks
• Efective communication skills; verbal and written
• Essential computer capabilities for internal management systems.
• Competent in lifting and shifting heavy objects. Ability to maintain standing, walking, and bending for extended intervals.
• Capable working in diverse weather conditions, including extreme heat, cold, and rain.
• Able to perform tasks at elevated heights and adacent to water.

DESIRED

Preferably, over 2 years of experience in a fast-paced warehouse setting.

Experience in the Oil & Gas sector is preferred.

Knowledge, Skills, Abilities, and Other Characteristics
• Knowledge of appropriate steps to analytical problem solving.
• Ability to operate material handling equipment.
• Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos.
• Ability to write simple correspondence.
• Knowledge of principles and processes for providing customer service and personal services.
• Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships.
• Ability to work in a team environment, remaining attentive to ideas, recognizing responsibilities, and actively participating with others to accomplish assignments and achieve desired goals.
• Treats others fairly and with respect .
• Knowledge of department's policies, rules, regulations, business goals, vision, organizational structure, culture, philosophy, operating principles, and values, etc.
• Ability to establish and maintain project priorities.

Working Conditions

This position is considered ONSHORE WORK which is characterized as follows.

Almost exclusively indoors during the day and occasionally at night.

Requires working on or near moving equipment and vibrating equipment.

Frequently the humidity is above 90%, noise is over 85 decibels and the light are intense/glare

Occasional exposure to airborne dust in the workplace.

Must wear personal protective equipment (PPE) at all times.

Work surface is stable (flat). Able to work at heights, and near water.

Physical Activity/Requirements

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

This position is considered MEDIUM work.

OCCASIONAL

FREQUENT

CONSTANT
• Lift 20-50 pounds
• Work in confined spaces, kneel, jump, run, and work while lying on stomach/back, crawl, and use repetitive movements of the arms and hands.
• Identify color differences
• Wear PPE for skin protection
• Lift 10-25 pounds
• Climb stairs/ladders, stand, balance, stoop, squat, reach, and lift/carry objects
• Twist body sit with back supported, head forward/flexed, head tilted/rotated, and work with arms extended overhead.
• Operate a motor vehicle
• Lift up to 10 pounds
• Wear PPE protection for body, vision, and hearing protection

Job Sumary:
Material Handler

Shift: ['Advanced Computer skills Microsoft Word Microsoft Excel Cycle counting Pallet assembly Equipment safety Production support Package handling Load palletizing Pallet jack operation Barcode scanning Heavy lifting Loading and unloading']

Start: [' Stand-up/Sit-down Forklift Certification Order Picker Operation Powered Industrial Trucks RF Scanner Proficiency Warehouse Management Systems (WMS) Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint) Inventory Management Software']

description_final: Resumen y ubicación de posición El controlador de materiales es responsable del manejo y el movimiento eficientes de los materiales. Este rol consiste en cargar, descargar, almacenar y distribuir materiales dentro del almacén. Las responsabilidades clave incluyen el mantenimiento de registros de inventario precisos, la preparación de pedidos de envío y equipos de manejo de materiales operativos, como carretillas elevadoras. El manejador de materiales debe adherirse a los protocolos de seguridad y colaborar con los miembros del equipo para garantizar operaciones de almacén suaves. Esta posición requiere una fuerte atención al detalle, las habilidades organizativas y la capacidad de trabajar de forma independiente y como parte de un equipo. Este papel se encuentra en el almacén en Morgan City, LA, y requiere un horario de trabajo diario en el lugar. El apoyo rotacional de guardia para noches, fines de semana y vacaciones es un requisito de la posición. El horario de trabajo normal es M-F 8-5 con potencial necesidad de trabajar horas extras. Además, puede ser necesario que esté de guardia. No trabaje en las vacaciones de las a menos que se llamen y llamen. Las tareas y responsabilidades cargan, descargan, mueven y almacenan de manera segura y eficiente con el almacén. Asistir a mantener registros de inventario precisos, incluidas las discrepancias de seguimiento e informes. Asegúrese de un espacio de trabajo organizado por seleccionar, empacar y preparar inventario, asegurando la precisión y los plazos. Examine el contenido y compare los registros, como manifestaciones, facturas u órdenes, para verificar la precisión de los envíos entrantes o salientes. Crear y mantener correctamente todos los datos de envío para garantizar registros precisos. Seleccione métodos de envío apropiados basados ​​en la naturaleza de los artículos y los requisitos de entrega. Conferir y corresponder con representantes de establecimiento para rectificar problemas, como daños, escasez y no conformidad con las especificaciones. Opere elevadores, gatos de paletas y otros equipos de manejo de materiales según sea necesario. Use dispositivos de trabajo, como camiones de mano y contenedores de clasificación, para entregar o enrutar materiales a varios departamentos. Adherirse a todos los protocolos y procedimientos de seguridad para mantener un ambiente de trabajo seguro. Trabaje en estrecha colaboración con los miembros del equipo y otros departamentos para garantizar operaciones perfectas. Realice tareas y responsabilidades adicionales según sea necesario para apoyar los objetivos organizacionales. Responsabilidades de supervisión Esta posición no tiene responsabilidades de supervisión. Las calificaciones requeridas diploma de escuela secundaria o título de educación general (GED); o experiencia equivalente en un campo relacionado. Ser parte de una rotación de guardia es necesaria, cubriendo noches, fines de semana y vacaciones. Competente en el manejo de múltiples tareas simultáneamente en un entorno de alta energía y dispuesto a adoptar nuevos desafíos. Excelente detalle de orientación y habilidades organizativas competentes en tareas independientes y orientadas al equipo habilidades de comunicación efectivas; Capacidades informáticas esenciales verbales y escritas para sistemas de gestión interna. Competente en levantar y cambiar objetos pesados. Capacidad para mantener de pie, caminar y doblar a intervalos prolongados. Capaz trabajando en diversas condiciones climáticas, que incluyen calor extremo, frío y lluvia. Capaz de realizar tareas a alturas elevadas y adacentes al agua. Deseado preferiblemente, más de 2 años de experiencia en un entorno de ritmo rápido. Se prefiere la experiencia en el sector de petróleo y gas. Conocimiento, habilidades, habilidades y otras características Conocimiento de los pasos apropiados para la resolución analítica de problemas. Capacidad para operar equipos de manejo de materiales. Capacidad para leer y comprender instrucciones simples, correspondencia corta y notas. Capacidad para escribir correspondencia simple. Conocimiento de principios y procesos para proporcionar servicio al cliente y servicios personales. Capacidad para establecer y mantener relaciones de trabajo cooperativas. Capacidad para trabajar en un entorno de equipo, permanecer atento a las ideas, reconocer las responsabilidades y participar activamente con otros para cumplir las tareas y lograr los objetivos deseados. Trata a otros de manera justa y con respeto. Conocimiento de las políticas del departamento, reglas, regulaciones, objetivos comerciales, visión, estructura organizativa, cultura, filosofía, principios operativos y valores, etc. Capacidad para establecer y mantener las prioridades del proyecto. Condiciones de trabajo Esta posición se considera un trabajo en tierra que se caracteriza de la siguiente manera. Casi exclusivamente en interiores durante el día y ocasionalmente por la noche. Requiere trabajar en o cerca del equipo en movimiento y el equipo vibratorio. Con frecuencia, la humedad está por encima del 90%, el ruido es más de 85 decibelios y la luz es una exposición intensa/resplandor ocasional al polvo en el aire en el lugar de trabajo. Debe usar equipos de protección personal (PPE) en todo momento. La superficie de trabajo es estable (plana). Capaz de trabajar en alturas y cerca del agua. Actividad física/requisitos Las demandas físicas descritas aquí son representativas de aquellos que debe ser satisfecho por un empleado para realizar con éxito las funciones esenciales de este trabajo. Se pueden hacer adaptaciones razonables para permitir que las personas con discapacidades realicen las funciones esenciales. Esta posición se considera trabajo medio. El elevador constante frecuente ocasional trabaja 20-50 libras en espacios confinados, arrodillados, salta, corre y trabaja mientras está acostado en el estómago/espalda, gatea y usa movimientos repetitivos de los brazos y las manos. Identifique las diferencias de color Vea PPE para la protección de la piel Lift 10-25 libras escaleras de escalada/escaleras, soporte, equilibrio, agachado, cuclillas, alcance y elevación de objetos Twist Sit con la espalda, la cabeza hacia adelante/flexionada, la cabeza inclinada/rotada, y trabaje con los brazos extendidos en lo alto. Operar un elevador de vehículo motorizado hasta 10 libras de protección de PPE para el trabajo para el cuerpo, la visión y la protección auditiva Trabajo Sumary: Cambio del manejador de materiales: ['Habilidades avanzadas de la computadora Microsoft Word Microsoft Microsoft Excel Ciclo Conteo de Pallets Ensamblaje Safet Production Support Handling Palletizing Pallet Jack Operación de escaneo Barcode Barcode Lifting Hoaves Loabring Loading y Descargue de la descarga'] Inicio: ['Sitio/Certificación de butor de reputación de butor Sistemas de gestión de almacenes (WMS) Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint) Software de gestión de inventario ']
EURACE_skills: Gestión, Comunicación efectiva, Trabajo en equipo, Ética profesional
initial_skills: planificación, comunicación oral, colaboración interdisciplinaria, respeto

description:
Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:
• Perform duties to requisition and store materials, parts and components.
• Accumulate and move items/containers to designated areas. Interact with other departments.
• Work from schedules, shop orders, CRT and instructions.
• Review production schedules for period and perform Electronic Data Interchange or other ordering techniques for parts, materials or supplies to meet requirements. Select and accumulate material parts, verify identity, quantity, condition and record or call attention to shortages, defective or damaged material and store/move items to designated areas.
• Visually check work to maintain quality standards and notify supervisor or recurring defects and operating difficulties.
• Assist in unpacking or unloading items from trucks and other carriers.
• Prepare tickets/maintain records and other documents as required.
• Assist with physical inventories as required.
• Perform other duties as required.

Education, Skills, and Work Experience:
• Ability to operate a fork truck.
• Ability to use hand and power tools and other material handling equipment to include, but not limited to: pallet jack, hand truck, CRT, Microcomputer, EDI, fax and bar coding equipment.
• Ability to work effectively in a team environment and follow verbal/written work instructions.
• Ability to perform work safely and follow safety policies/rules and regulations.
• High School diploma or equivalent required.
• Must be able to work from schedules, shop orders, CRT and instructions.
• Must have a valid license for operating powered industrial trucks or pass written assessments after classroom training.

Wage Range: $16.85/hr - $21.42/hr

Benefits of Employment

In addition to excellent career growth opportunities, Federal Signal Corporation offers a wide array of benefits including: bonus potential, insurance (life, medical, dental, vision), paid holidays, paid vacation, 401(k) with matching contributions and tuition reimbursement. We provide our employees with a smoke-free, drug-free workplace.

About Us

Federal Signal in University Park is a leading manufacturer and supplier of comprehensive systems and products used to protect people and property. Our products and integrated solutions include systems for campus and community alerting, emergency vehicles, first responder interoperable communications, industrial communications, and command and municipal networked security. Specific products include: lightbars and sirens, public warning sirens and public safety software.

Federal Signal Corporation (NYSE: FSS) builds and delivers equipment of unmatched quality that moves material, cleans infrastructure, and protects the communities where we work and live. Founded in 1901, Federal Signal is a leading global designer and manufacturer of products and total solutions that serve municipal, governmental, industrial and commercial customers. Headquartered in Downers Grove, IL, with manufacturing facilities worldwide, the Company operates two groups: Environmental Solutions and Safety and Security Systems. For more information on Federal Signal, visit: www.federalsignal.com

The Company is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will not be discriminated against on the basis of, and will receive consideration for employment without regard to, race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, genetic information, status as a protected veteran, or any other protected category, characteristic, or trait under applicable law. If you require reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact Human Resources at HR@federalsignal.com. All other applications must be submitted online.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities
This employer is required to notify all applicants of their rights pursuant to federal employment laws. For further information, please review the Know Your Rights notice from the Department of Labor.

Nuestros productos y soluciones integradas incluyen sistemas para alertas de campus y comunidad, vehículos de emergencia, comunicaciones interoperables de primer respondedor, comunicaciones industriales y seguridad en red municipal y municipal. Los productos específicos incluyen: barras de luz y sirenas, sirenas de advertencia pública y software de seguridad pública. Federal Signal Corporation (NYSE: FSS) construye y ofrece equipos de calidad inigualable que mueve material, limpia la infraestructura y protege a las comunidades donde trabajamos y vivimos. Con sede en Downers Grove, IL, con instalaciones de fabricación en todo el mundo, la compañía opera dos grupos: soluciones ambientales y sistemas de seguridad. Para obtener más información sobre Federal Signal, visite: La compañía es un empleador de igualdad de oportunidades. Si necesita un alojamiento razonable en el proceso de solicitud, comuníquese con los recursos humanos en. Todas las demás solicitudes deben enviarse en línea. description:
SUMMARY: The material handler moves raw material between the warehouse and the operating production plants as well as moving finished product from production plants to warehouse staging areas to be loaded for delivery. RESPONSIBILITIES: Demonstrate the understanding of all required paperwork to include but not limited to, communication boards, standard work documents, quality visuals. Be able to read and understand orders.

Read, follow, and understand warehouse and forklift procedures. Operate a forklift safely and perform forklift inspections. Be able to use a product scanner.

Use a forklift to move finished product from production plants to appropriate warehouse staging areas. Use a forklift to move raw material between the warehouse and production plants. Be able to accurately produce and maintain all warehouse logs and paperwork.

Inspect to ensure that all finished product is packaged and labeled correctly. Maintain a clean and safe work environment. Identify and understand the properties and hazards of chemicals.

Demonstrate the capability to meet or exceed established production rates and standards. Must comply with all safety policies and procedures, including, but not limited to, wearing all required personal protective equipment (PPE). Other duties as assigned (including training of others within job class, sanitation, reporting labor & production, safety committee, etc.)High School Diploma or GED Valid Driver's License Written and oral communication skills in English

Ability to work overtime, rotating shifts, weekends, and holidays. Ability to multi-task, must be a quick learner and able to adapt to change. Physical ability to lift 55 lbs.

BENEFITS: Competitive Salary Medical Benefits Dental Benefits Vision Benefits Flexible Spending Accounts 401(k) Savings Plan Vacation Days Sick Days Paid Holidays Life Insurance Short-Term Disability Long-Term Disability Tuition Reimbursement Employee Development & Training #LI-DNIHigh School Diploma or GED Valid Driver's License Written and oral communication skills in English. Ability to work overtime, rotating shifts, weekends, and holidays. Ability to multi-task, must be a quick learner and able to adapt to change.

Physical ability to lift 55 lbs. Responsabilidades: Demuestre la comprensión de todos los documentos requeridos para incluir, entre otros, tableros de comunicación, documentos de trabajo estándar, imágenes de calidad. Poder leer y comprender las órdenes. Lea, siga y comprenda los procedimientos de almacén y montacargas. Opere una carretilla elevadora de forma segura y realice inspecciones de montacargas. Poder usar un escáner de producto. Use una carretilla elevadora para mover el producto terminado de las plantas de producción a las áreas de estadificación de almacén apropiadas. Use una carretilla elevadora para mover la materia prima entre el almacén y las plantas de producción. Ser capaz de producir y mantener con precisión todos los registros y documentos de almacén. Inspeccione para asegurarse de que todo el producto terminado esté empaquetado y etiquetado correctamente. Mantenga un ambiente de trabajo limpio y seguro. Identificar y comprender las propiedades y peligros de los productos químicos. Demuestre la capacidad de cumplir o exceder las tasas y estándares de producción establecidos. Debe cumplir con todas las políticas y procedimientos de seguridad, incluidos, entre otros, usar todo el equipo de protección personal (PPE) requerido. description:
Essential Job Functions
• Retrieve finished goods to be shipped from the assembly area and ship using proper systems and transactions.
• Receive materials and place them into inventory using proper systems and transactions.
• Transacting material movement into Epicor to ensure inventory accuracy.
• Must be able to operate material handling equipment.
• Operate Reach and Counterbalance Forklifts.
• Other related duties and projects as assigned.Loading and Unloading Semi Trailers.

Physical Requirements
• Employees are required to walk long distances repeatedly throughout the day.
• Employee required to climb step stools/small ladders.
• Workers are required to lift packages up to 50 pounds.
• Work may require bending or stooping.
• Standing/Walking 8+ hours per day.

Knowledge
• High School Diploma or equivalent.

Experience
• Operation of material handling equipment (6 months – 1 year).
• Understanding the importance of accurate inventory transactions.
• Working with other departments leads to achieving goals.
• 1-3 months related work experience

Skills
• Previously trained, or able to be trained in the operation of material handling equipment.
• Maintain quality service on all transactions and follow organizational standards.
• Ability to use or be trained in the use of RF scanner and tablets.
• Knowledge of product movement in and out of a warehouse.
• Knowledge and ability to use ERP systems such as Epicor.
• Basic Computer Skills, i.e. data entry, general knowledge.
• Able to work independently and as a member of a team.
• Operate basic hand tools, i.e. air drivers, wrenches etc.
• Ability to follow written and oral instructions.
• Knowledge of basic mathematical skills.
• Good work ethic.

• Good work ethic.

Reciba materiales y colóquelos en el inventario utilizando sistemas y transacciones adecuadas. Transactar el movimiento material hacia el epicor para garantizar la precisión del inventario. Debe poder operar equipos de manejo de materiales. Operar alcance y contrarrestar carretillas elevadoras. Otros deberes y proyectos relacionados según lo asignado. Carga y descarga de semi trailers. description:
We're Watts. Together, we're reimagining the future of water.

We feel proud every day about what we do. We're all part of the same crucial mission, no matter what function we support -- it's to provide safe, clean water for the world, and to protect our planet's most valuable resource.

What we do:

For 150 years, Watts has built best-in-class products that are trusted bycustomers in residential and commercial settings across the world.We areat theforefront of innovation, working with cutting-edge technology to provide smart andconnected, sustainable water solutions for the future. Watts is a leading brand with aquality reputation - and we have a dynamic future ahead.
As the Material Handler, you will report onsite to the Logistics Supervisor and be responsible for receiving, storing, counting, and issuing equipment, materials, products, tools, and inventories. You will manage the continuous flow of materials through the supply chain, ensuring efficient plant operations.

You Will:
• Perform receiving tasks, including the safe operation of forklift trucks and reach trucks.
• Pick materials according to established procedures.
• Package and ship products using proper techniques and scanner operations.
• Maintain a continuous flow of materials throughout the supply chain.
• Conduct physical inventories to ensure accuracy and availability of materials.

You Have:
• Forklift experience preferred (not required).
• High school diploma or GED (preferred).
• Basic math skills.
• Basic computer literacy for related transactions.
• Ability to read, write, and understand English.
• Familiarity with reading and interpreting safety rules, operating/maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals.

Before joining our team, you must successfully complete the following pre-employment screenings:
• Background Check: A comprehensive review of educational credentials, criminal records, and social security validation to ensure alignment with company standards and regulations.
• Drug Screen: Testing for controlled substances to maintain a safe and productive work environment.
• Physical Examination: Verification of physical fitness to perform job responsibilities safely.

Completion of these requirements is necessary for finalizing employment offers and ensuring compliance with company policies.

Physical Requirements:

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to walk, talk, and/or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand, sit, and use hands to finger, handle, or feel. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 30 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.

Work Environment:

Work in both office and manufacturing environment. May occasionally be required to perform job duties outside the typical office setting.

Watts in it for you:

Please note that the following benefits apply only to permanent roles and do not apply to internship roles.
• Competitive compensation based on your skills, qualifications and experience
• Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits
• Family building benefits, including paid maternity/paternity leave
• 10 paid holidays and Paid Time Off
• Continued professional development opportunities and educational reimbursement
• Additional perks such as fitness reimbursements and employee discount programs
• Learn more about our benefit offerings here: https://tapintowattsbenefits.com/

How we work:

At Watts, our culture is team-oriented and supportive. Employees here genuinely care about the quality of their work, and about each other. Our people are the heart of who we are and contribute to our longevity and continued success.

And this is a place where you can have a big career. No matter your role, there are opportunities for learning and development, and your daily contributions make a meaningful impact on the lives of people who use our products and on the future of water.

Watts is committed to equal employment opportunity. We follow a policy of administering all employment decisions and personnel actions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, pregnancy, national origin, sexual orientation, age, physical or mental disability, genetic disposition or carrier status, marital status, military or veteran status, minorities, or any other category protected under applicable federal, state, or local law. Consistent with the obligations of state and federal law, Watts will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. Any employee who needs a reasonable accommodation should contact Human Resources.

description_final: Somos Watts. Juntos, estamos reinventando el futuro del agua. Nos sentimos orgullosos todos los días sobre lo que hacemos. Todos somos parte de la misma misión crucial, sin importar la función que apoyemos: es proporcionar agua segura y limpia para el mundo y proteger el recurso más valioso de nuestro planeta. Lo que hacemos: durante 150 años, Watts ha construido los mejores productos de clase en la clase que son de confianza en los entornos residenciales y comerciales en todo el mundo. Afuera de la innovación, trabajando con tecnología de vanguardia para proporcionar soluciones de agua inteligentes y conectables y sostenibles para el futuro. Watts es una marca líder con reputación de Aqualidad, y tenemos un futuro dinámico por delante. Como manejador de materiales, informará en el sitio al supervisor de logística y será responsable de recibir, almacenar, contar y emitir equipos, materiales, productos, herramientas e inventarios. Gestionará el flujo continuo de materiales a través de la cadena de suministro, asegurando operaciones de planta eficientes. Usted: realizará tareas receptores, incluida la operación segura de camiones de carretillas elevadoras y camiones Reach. Elija materiales de acuerdo con los procedimientos establecidos. Paquete y envío productos utilizando técnicas adecuadas y operaciones de escáner. Mantenga un flujo continuo de materiales en toda la cadena de suministro. Realice inventarios físicos para garantizar la precisión y disponibilidad de materiales. Usted tiene: experiencia en la carretilla elevadora preferida (no requerida). Diploma de escuela secundaria o GED (preferido). Habilidades matemáticas básicas. Alfabetización informática básica para transacciones relacionadas. Capacidad para leer, escribir y comprender el inglés. Familiaridad con la lectura e interpretación de reglas de seguridad, instrucciones operativas/de mantenimiento y manuales de procedimientos. Antes de unirse a nuestro equipo, debe completar con éxito las siguientes proyecciones previas al empleo: Verificación de antecedentes: una revisión exhaustiva de las credenciales educativas, los antecedentes penales y la validación del Seguro Social para garantizar la alineación con los estándares y regulaciones de la empresa. Pantalla de drogas: prueba de sustancias controladas para mantener un entorno de trabajo seguro y productivo. Examen físico: verificación de la aptitud física para realizar responsabilidades laborales de manera segura. La finalización de estos requisitos es necesario para finalizar las ofertas de empleo y garantizar el cumplimiento de las políticas de la empresa. Requisitos físicos: mientras realiza las tareas de este trabajo, el empleado con frecuencia se requiere para caminar, hablar y/o escuchar. Ocasionalmente, se requiere que el empleado se pare, se sienta y use las manos para el dedo, manejar o sentir. El empleado ocasionalmente debe levantar y/o moverse hasta 30 libras. Las habilidades de visión específicas requeridas por este trabajo incluyen visión cercana, visión del color, visión periférica, percepción de profundidad y capacidad para ajustar el enfoque. Entorno de trabajo: trabaje tanto en la oficina como en el entorno de fabricación. Ocasionalmente se puede requerir que realice tareas laborales fuera del entorno típico de la oficina. Watts en él para usted: Tenga en cuenta que los siguientes beneficios se aplican solo a los roles permanentes y no se aplican a los roles de pasantías. Compensación competitiva basada en sus habilidades, calificaciones y experiencia Cobertura médica y dental integral, beneficios de jubilación Beneficios de construcción familiar, incluidas las licencias de maternidad/paternidad pagas 10 vacaciones pagadas y tiempo pagado de oportunidades de desarrollo profesional continuos y reembolso educativo ventajas adicionales, como reembolsos físicos y programas de descuento de empleados, aprenden más sobre nuestras ofertas de beneficios aquí: cómo trabajamos: en las vajillas, nuestro cultivo, es un equipo orientado a un equipo orientado y a los empleados. Los empleados aquí realmente se preocupan por la calidad de su trabajo y entre sí. Nuestra gente es el corazón de quienes somos y contribuye a nuestra longevidad y éxito continuo. Y este es un lugar donde puedes tener una gran carrera. No importa su papel, hay oportunidades de aprendizaje y desarrollo, y sus contribuciones diarias tienen un impacto significativo en la vida de las personas que usan nuestros productos y en el futuro del agua. Watts está comprometido con la igualdad de oportunidades de empleo. Seguimos una política de administrar todas las decisiones de empleo y acciones de personal sin tener en cuenta la raza, el color, la religión, el credo, el sexo, el embarazo, el origen nacional, la orientación sexual, la edad, la discapacidad física o mental, la disposición genética o el estado de los portadores, el estado civil, el estado militar o veterano, las minorías o cualquier otra categoría protegida por la ley federal, estatal o local aplicable. De acuerdo con las obligaciones de la ley estatal y federal, Watts hará adaptaciones razonables para personas calificadas con discapacidades. Cualquier empleado que necesite un alojamiento razonable debe comunicarse con los recursos humanos.

description:
6:00 am to 4:00 pm, Monday thru Thursday

The basic function of a Material Handler is to provide support to the production floor and be able to handle all job functions as they relate to this position.
• Ability to move parts from workstation to workstation and other areas of the manufacturing floor.
• Responsible for keeping the production floor supplied with all necessary parts and supplies. Routers must be signed off before moving to the next operation.
• Removing powder from presses and restocking with proper approved powder that has an approved sticker prior to moving to the production floor and making sure that the correct powder goes to the press.
• Ensure that all skids and carts are properly tagged with pertinent information and the proper routing.
• Consistency in the placement of parts in proper lanes in quality assurance and taking skids that are quality assurance evaluated to proper areas.
• Removal of ACCEPTED and FINALED product from Q.A. and route to appropriate destination.
• Boxes must be filled out with the part number, lot number, counts and date in neat legible writing.
• Ability to load and unload all trucks correctly and ensure that all pertinent paperwork is done accurately and on time and all products are shipped correctly according to customer requirements.
• Ability to identify powder correctly and use the Powder Kanban keeping powder in sequence by pack number and lot number. Inform team lead of a material or a lot change.
• Take care of scrap at the end of shift.
• Able to arrange and organize skids and parts in their designated areas.
• Proper rotation of stock - Using the oldest first.
• Load and unloading of temper furnaces.
• Lend support to the shipping & receiving associate when time permits.
• Must be able to pass all pertinent testing for a forklift license.

Performs any other duties as assigned by the shift supervisor and assumes other duties and responsibilities not specifically outlined herein, but which are logically inherent to the function of a Material Handler.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $13.75 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:
• 401(k)
• 401(k) matching
• Dental insurance
• Flexible spending account
• Health insurance
• On-the-job training
• Opportunities for advancement
• Paid sick time
• Paid time off
• Retirement plan
• Vision insurance

Schedule:
• 10 hour shift
• Day shift

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

Work Location: In person
skills: 6:00 am a 4:00 pm, lunes a jueves, La función básica de un controlador de materiales es proporcionar apoyo al piso de producción y poder manejar todas las funciones de trabajo en relación con este puesto., Capacidad para mover piezas de la estación de trabajo a la estación de trabajo y otras áreas del piso de fabricación, Responsable de mantener el piso de producción suministrado con todas las piezas y suministros necesarios, Los enrutadores deben firmarse antes de pasar a la siguiente operación, Eliminar el polvo de las prensas y reabastecer con el polvo aprobado adecuado que tiene una pegatina aprobada antes de moverse al piso de producción y asegurarse de que el polvo correcto vaya a la prensa, Asegúrese de que todos los patines y carros estén etiquetados correctamente con información pertinente y el enrutamiento adecuado, Consistencia en la colocación de piezas en carriles adecuados en garantía de calidad y tomando patines que son garantizados de calidad a las áreas adecuadas, Eliminación del producto aceptado y final de Q.A. y ruta al destino apropiado, Las cajas deben completarse con el número de pieza, el número de lote, los recuentos y la fecha en la escritura legible ordenada, Capacidad para cargar y descargar todos los camiones correctamente y asegurarse de que todo el papeleo pertinente se realice con precisión y tiempo y todos los productos se envíen correctamente de acuerdo con los requisitos del cliente., Capacidad para identificar el polvo correctamente y usar el polvo de mantenimiento de Kanban en secuencia por número de paquete y número de lote, Informar el liderazgo del equipo de un material o mucho cambio, Cuida la chatarra al final del turno, Capaz de organizar y organizar patines y piezas en sus áreas designadas, Rotación adecuada del stock: usando el primero más antiguo, Carga y descarga de hornos de temperatura, Prestar apoyo al asociado de envío y recepción cuando el tiempo lo permita, Debe poder aprobar todas las pruebas pertinentes para una licencia de carretilla elevadora, Realiza cualquier otra tarea asignada por el supervisor de turno y asume otras tareas y responsabilidades no específicamente descritas en este documento, pero que son lógicamente inherentes a la función de un controlador de material
description_final: 6:00 a. m. a 4:00 p. m. , lunes a jueves, la función básica de un controlador de material es brindar apoyo al piso de producción y poder manejar todas las funciones de trabajo en relación con este puesto. Capacidad para mover piezas de la estación de trabajo a la estación de trabajo y otras áreas del piso de fabricación. Responsable de mantener el piso de producción suministrado con todas las piezas y suministros necesarios. Los enrutadores deben firmarse antes de pasar a la siguiente operación. Eliminar el polvo de las prensas y reabastecer con el polvo aprobado adecuado que tiene una pegatina aprobada antes de moverse al piso de producción y asegurarse de que el polvo correcto vaya a la prensa. Asegúrese de que todos los patines y carros estén correctamente etiquetados con información pertinente y el enrutamiento adecuado. Consistencia en la colocación de piezas en carriles adecuados en garantía de calidad y tomando patines que sean garantizados por las áreas adecuadas. Eliminación del producto aceptado y final de Q. A. y ruta al destino apropiado. Las cajas deben completarse con el número de pieza, el número de lote, los recuentos y la fecha en una escritura legible ordenada. Capacidad para cargar y descargar todos los camiones correctamente y asegurarse de que todo el papeleo pertinente se realice con precisión y tiempo y todos los productos se envíen correctamente de acuerdo con los requisitos del cliente. Capacidad para identificar el polvo correctamente y usar el polvo de mantenimiento de Kanban en secuencia por número de paquete y número de lote. Informar al líder del equipo de un material o mucho cambio. Cuida la chatarra al final del turno. Capaz de organizar y organizar patines y piezas en sus áreas designadas. Rotación adecuada del stock: usando el más antiguo primero. Carga y descarga de hornos de temperatura. Preste apoyo al asociado de envío y recepción cuando el tiempo lo permita. Debe poder aprobar todas las pruebas pertinentes para una licencia de montacargas. Realiza cualquier otra tarea asignada por el supervisor de turno y asume otras tareas y responsabilidades no específicamente descritas en este documento, pero que son lógicamente inherentes a la función de un controlador de material. Tipo de trabajo: Pago a tiempo completo: desde $ 13. 75 por hora Horas esperadas: 40 por semana Beneficios: 401 (k) 401 (k) Mateador de seguros dentales Cuenta de gastos flexibles de la cuenta de gastos de salud Inserción de salud en el trabajo Oportunidades de capacitación para avance Tiempo de enfermedad pagado

description:
JOIN THE WAGNER FAMILY

Thank you for your interest in Wagner. We always have our eyes open for talented people who want to learn, grow and expand their capabilities with Wagner.

Wagner is small enough that you matter and large enough for you to make a difference.

Wagner Spray Tech believes that people represent a company's most important asset. At Wagner, we strive to create an organization where everyone participates and efforts are focused toward continuous improvement. These improvements are driven by dedication, teamwork, and the innovation of the Wagner family.

Our company participates in the US government's E-Verify process. In addition, all offers of employment are contingent on a drug test and background check.

YOUR BENEFITS

Our benefit package includes:
• Starting at 4 weeks PTO per year
• 401(k) and a company match
• Profit Sharing
• Medical
• Dental
• Life
• Disability
• 6 Weeks Parental Leave
• Long term care insurance
• Tuition reimbursement

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
• Resolves problems either verbally or electronically with venders, carriers and couriers.
• Able to train new forklift operators and give complete forklift certification test.
• Should be able to troubleshoot ERP system inventory movement and transactions to root cause problem solve
• Capable to act as back up team lead as needed.
• Trains and mentors Material Handler I individuals as it relates to pick, pack, ship, and load best practices.
• Confidentially handles usual, unusual or difficult inquiries or situations, or may direct to the appropriate individual as needed; may provide documented input to supervisor for performance reviews, corrective action, performance improvement and candidate selection.
• Picks units and/or parts and accessories for shipment to customers by reading a pick document, using a hand held RF Gun, or voice technology. May consolidate orders with additional shipments as needed. Packs and labels according to customer shipping and routing requirements.
• Coordinates with planners, buyers, production personnel and carriers for the timely unloading of containers and trailers and assists the Distribution Group Lead with the coordination and scheduling of incoming containers, trucks and trailers.
• Train new forklift operators and give complete forklift certification test.
• Resolves issues such as receipt of inventory, missing purchase orders and no cost in coordination with other departments.
• Unloads incoming trucks and containers and verifies that all items are accounted for, reporting damages or discrepancies; enters inventory items on the computer and forwards paperwork to appropriate individuals.
• Operates forklift and other material handling equipment to fill customer orders and move inventory throughout the warehouse.
• Sorts UPS and other courier shipments of smaller items.
• Matches manifests to purchase orders and prints and attaches travelers to product(s).
• Picks and ships ATS's, WV's and maintains DMA process DMR's and specialty shipments
• Offload, palletize, and inventory inbound shipments.
• Assist in the physical aspect of cycle counts and selected inventory daily and identifies and reports any inventory discrepancies.
• Receives work direction from department leadership, however, incumbent is responsible for prioritizing his/her own work by sales allocation, date needed to fill and logistics of work order.
• Records appropriate data on shipping documents using an ERP system and follows unique customer I.D requirements.
• Performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

Education and Experience:

High School Diploma or General Equivalency Diploma (GED); post-secondary education preferred. Must have at least 3 years of related experience and ability to obtain forklift certification or license.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
• Ability to read and comprehend simple and complex instructions and follow written and verbal directions.
• Ability to perform basic mathematical computations such as to adding, subtracting, and dividing using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals.
• Effective oral and written communication skills.
• Knowledge of and skill using Microsoft Office applications and ERP systems.
• Ability to use scanners for counting and inventory tracking and control.
• Knowledge of the standard methods used to pack and unpack materials and supplies from trucks, containers and racking/shelving.
• Ability to operate manual and powered material handling equipment such as electric and gas forklifts, pallet jacks, and high lifts.
• Ability to listen and be aware of production floor activity to support a safe and hazard free working environment.
• Ability to be objective and flexible in adapting to changes in priorities, work assignments and other interactions that may impact pre-established courses of action for completing projects and assignments.
• Ability to work extended hours and/or varying shifts as requested in order to maintain adequate coverage during hours of operation.
• Knowledge of Lean and Kaizan methods and practices and standard production safety protocol is beneficial.

Wagner is dedicated to the ongoing journey of equity, diversity and inclusion. We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and committed to building a workplace where everyone feels welcome, valued, and empowered to be themselves. We don't discriminate based on race, color, national origin, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We encourage you to be your authentic self and share your unique perspectives. If you require any accommodation throughout the hiring process, please let us know how we can assist you.

Siempre tenemos los ojos abiertos para personas talentosas que quieren aprender, crecer y expandir sus capacidades con Wagner. Wagner es lo suficientemente pequeño como para que importe y lo suficientemente grande como para que hagas la diferencia. Wagner Spray Tech cree que las personas representan el activo más importante de una empresa. En Wagner, nos esforzamos por crear una organización donde todos participen y los esfuerzos se centran en la mejora continua. Estas mejoras están impulsadas por la dedicación, el trabajo en equipo y la innovación de la familia Wagner. Nuestra empresa participa en el proceso E-Verify del gobierno de los EE. UU. Además, todas las ofertas de empleo dependen de una prueba de drogas y verificación de antecedentes. Capacidad para realizar cálculos matemáticos básicos, como sumar, restar y dividir utilizando números enteros, fracciones comunes y decimales. Habilidades efectivas de comunicación oral y escrita. Conocimiento y habilidad utilizando aplicaciones de Microsoft Office y sistemas ERP. Capacidad para usar escáneres para contar y controlar y control del inventario. Conocimiento de los métodos estándar utilizados para empacar y desempacar materiales y suministros de camiones, contenedores y estanterías/estanterías. Capacidad para operar equipos manuales y de manejo de materiales con alimentación, como carretillas elevadoras eléctricas y de gas, gatos de paletas y elevadores altos. Capacidad para escuchar y tener en cuenta la actividad del piso de producción para apoyar un entorno de trabajo seguro y libre de riesgos. Capacidad para ser objetivo y flexible para adaptarse a los cambios en las prioridades, las tareas laborales y otras interacciones que pueden afectar los cursos de acción preestablecidos para completar proyectos y tareas. Capacidad para trabajar horas extendidas y/o cambios variables según lo solicitado para mantener una cobertura adecuada durante las horas de operación. El conocimiento de los métodos y prácticas de Lean y Kaizan y el protocolo de seguridad de producción estándar es beneficioso. Wagner se dedica al viaje continuo de equidad, diversidad e inclusión. Estamos orgullosos de ser un empleador de igualdad de oportunidades y comprometidos a construir un lugar de trabajo donde todos se sientan bienvenidos, valorados y capacitados para ser ellos mismos. No discriminamos en función de la raza, el color, el origen nacional, la religión, el género, la identidad de género, la orientación sexual, la edad, la discapacidad, el estado veterano o cualquier otra característica protegida por la ley. Le recomendamos que sea su yo auténtico y comparta sus perspectivas únicas. Si necesita algún alojamiento durante todo el proceso de contratación, háganos saber cómo podemos ayudarlo.

description:
Job Description

Job Description

Job Title: Material Handler I, II, III

Job Category:I

Department: Manufacturing - Materials

Reports To: Production or Warehouse Supervisor

Job Type:

Full-time: X

Part-time:

FLSA Status:

Exempt:

Non-exempt: X

Job Summary(A brief description of the primary duty of this job):

Material Handler I

Material Handler II

Material Handler III

Summary

Under direct supervision, transfers products/materials, into and/or out of the warehouse. Unloads trailers and moves materials throughout the facility.

Under general supervision, transfers products/materials, into and/or out of the warehouse. Loads/unloads trailers and moves materials throughout the facility. Maintains information for recording keeping.

Performs manual and complex shipping, receiving, packing, and warehouse duties. Prepares related documentation and maintains files/records. Provides leadership to lower-level staff.

Essential Job Functions(Primary duties and responsibilities):

Material Handler I

Material Handler II

Material Handler III

Level Distinction

Must be able to perform up to2 distinct essential functions within the group/department.

Must be able to perform up to 4 distinct essential functions within the group/department.

Must be able to perform all distinctessential functions within the group/department.

Essential Functions
• Unloads trucks with incoming and outgoing materials.
• Transfers material, equipment, kits, and supplies required for assembly areas.
• Stacks pallets and arranges materials as directed, while adhering to safety guidelines.
• Beginner skills on a powered industrial truck such as, but not limited to, forklifts or cherry pickers.
• Handles, allocates, and transfers material, equipment, kits, supplies, and shortages in assembly areas.
• Verifies and maintains stock records, logs, reports, and other documentation.
• Moves materials to storage or staging areas and ensures proper placement in appropriate location.
• Maintains productivity standards for each operational area.
• Intermediate skills on a powered industrial truck such as, but not limited to, forklifts or cherry pickers.
• Maintains inventory levels by identifying, labeling, stocking, and recording materials and supplies.
• Recognizes damaged product during the warehousing process and takes the appropriate action when discovered.
• Responds to material requests from internal customers.
• Responsible and accountable for receipt, storage, and handling of hazardous materials.
• Cycle counts inventory as needed.
• Recommends countermeasure for inventory related discrepancies
• Advanced skills on a powered industrial truck such as, but not limited to, forklifts or cherry pickers.

The preceding description is a summary of essential job functions and is not designed to be a complete list of all duties and responsibilities required of the Title.

Other Job Functions(Non-primary duties and responsibilities) (all levels):
• n/a

Supervisory Responsibilities(all levels):

Does this job have supervisory responsibilities?

Yes:

No: X

If yes, listed below:

Travel Required(all levels):

Does this job require travel?

Yes: X

No:

If yes, list below:
• Up to 10% travel is required on an intermittent basis.

Normal Work Hours(all levels):

Monday-Friday: X

Day: X

Evening: X

Overtime, occasional: X

Weekends, occasional: X

Holidays, occasional: X

Required Skills(all levels):
• Ability to maintain a satisfactory attendance record.
• Demonstrated manual dexterity ability.
• Willingness to be flexibility in moving between different job assignments.
• Able to work overtime as required to meet production schedules.
• Ability to be exact or accurate in performing tasks.
• Ability to perform repetitive tasks.
• Ability to work under time pressure.

Required Education and Experience:

Material Handler I

Material Handler II

Material Handler III

Education & Experience

High School Diploma or GED.

Little or no prior relevant experience is required.

Must be dependable and work well in a team environment.

High School Diploma or GED.

Two years of warehouse experience is required. Ability to operate materials handling equipment including forklifts, pallet handler, and hand trucks.

High School Diploma or GED.

Five years of warehouse experience is required. Solid verbal communication and listening skills. Prior experience tracking and updating information in an ERP system is desired.

Physical Demands(all levels):
• Stand for extended periods of time
• Walk for extended periods of time.
• Maintain balance to prevent falling.
• Hold arms and hands in one position for extended periods of time.
• Use hands and fingers to move and assemble small parts.
• Repetitive motions of body parts.
• Coordinated use of hands and feet to operate equipment.
• Carry or move materials and equipment weighing up to 51 lbs. Lift objects of various weights in different directions.
• Ascend and descend ladders, stairs, and work platforms.
• Operate manual and powered hand tools (e.g., pneumatic rivet and staple guns; drills; drivers; and foaming guns).
• Operate powered industrial trucks and equipment (e.g., lifts, pallet jacks, and aerial platforms).
• Operate machinery (e.g., press brakes, refrigerant charging stations, and hoists).
• Frequent manual labor that includes bending, stooping, crouching, reaching, pushing, and pulling.
• Squat and kneel to access materials and equipment in tight or enclosed spaces. Occasionally crawl to access equipment.
• Handle chemicals.
• Close visual acuity to perform activities such as: viewing a computer terminal; visual inspection involving small defects, small parts, and/or operation of machines (including inspection); using measurement devices; and/or assembly or fabrication of parts at distances close to the eyes.
• Communicate with others to exchange information.
• When travel is required, visual acuity to operate motor vehicle in daytime and nighttime.

Work Environment(all levels):
• Works in manufacturing, warehouse, and/or supporting areas. Worker must be aware of and exercise caution around hazardous conditions such as electricity, moving equipment, moving parts, refrigerants, chemicals, torches, solvents, dust, dirt, fumes, and contaminants.
• Indoor and outdoor work tasks subject worker to indoor and outdoor environmental conditions. Outdoor environmental conditions could include heat and cold; precipitation; wind; and sunlight.
• Exposure to vibrations and moderate-to-loud noises.
• Use of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) required of the job and work area. PPE includes but is not limited to safety glasses, safety googles, face shields, welding shields, protective welding clothing, safety toed footwear, hearing protection, gloves, aprons, protective sleeves, hard hats, safety harnesses, and respiratory protection.

Educación y experiencia requeridas: Manejador de materiales I Manejador de materiales II Mandeador III Educación y experiencia Diploma de escuela secundaria o GED. Cortes y arrodíllate para acceder a materiales y equipos en espacios apretados o cerrados. Ocasionalmente se arrastra para acceder al equipo. Manejar productos químicos. Cerrar agudeza visual para realizar actividades como: ver un terminal de computadora; inspección visual que involucra pequeños defectos, piezas pequeñas y/u operación de máquinas (incluida la inspección); usando dispositivos de medición; y/o ensamblaje o fabricación de piezas a distancias cercanas a los ojos. Comunicarse con otros para intercambiar información. Cuando se requiere viajar, la agudeza visual para operar vehículos motorizados durante el día y la noche. Entorno de trabajo (todos los niveles): trabajos en fabricación, almacén y/o áreas de apoyo. El trabajador debe ser consciente y ejercer precaución en torno a condiciones peligrosas como electricidad, equipos móviles, piezas móviles, refrigerantes, productos químicos, antorchas, solventes, polvo, suciedad, humos y contaminantes. Tareas de trabajo en interiores y exteriores trabajador a las condiciones ambientales interiores y al aire libre. Las condiciones ambientales al aire libre podrían incluir calor y frío; precipitación; viento; y luz solar. Exposición a vibraciones y ruidos moderados a moudos. Uso de equipos de protección personal (PPE) requerido del trabajo y el área de trabajo. El PPE incluye, entre otros, gafas de seguridad, Googles de seguridad, escudos faciales, escudos de soldadura, ropa de soldadura protectora, calzado de seguridad, protección auditiva, guantes, delantales, mangas protectores, sombreros duros, arneses de seguridad y protección respiratoria.

description:
ABOUT UNITED ALLOY

United Alloy is a preferred designer, manufacturer and powder coater of certified metal tanks, skids, frames, trailers, chassis, and related products crafted to world-class quality standards in strategic partnership with Fortune 500 OEM customers.UA products are proudly “Made in the USA”. In addition to being made in the USA, UA is also 9001 certified and has been recognized as a WBENC woman/minority owned business.

CULTURE

United Alloy empowers and entrusts our employees to manage the responsibilities of both their work and home lives. We are an agile team that produces extraordinary results, setting the standard in safety, quality, productivity, and profitability. Employees act with a sense of ownership, take initiative to problem solve and is committed to the company’s mission, their team and themselves.

United Alloy is supportive and encouraging of our employees, we are able to help make their dreams become a reality. At UA, every employee matters to us. We want everyone to have their own success story in their personal and professional lives. It’s one way that makes us an actively engaged team, inspired to win together.

SUMMARY:

This position welds fabricated components, per custom or stock specifications, for sale to customers in conjunction with customer quality requirements and United Alloy manufacturing philosophies. Monitoring welding performance and efficiency are essential.

Hours: Monday-Thursday 5:00am - 3:00pm (OT as required)

WHAT YOU’LL DO:
• Pulls stored materials for orders and moves to production or shipping area
• Able to identify materials using part numbers
• Accurately counts raw materials
• Supplies work area with materials
• Performs kitting responsibilities as required
• Documents information related to the material handling of goods
• Issues raw material to jobs and performs location transfers in CSI accurately and timely
• Accurately counts and tags material prior to material handling
• Other duties as assigned
• Ensures clear and clean pathways to and from all outside and inside exits on the production floor daily.
• Follows safe manufacturing and material handling practices.

WHAT YOU’LL BRING:
• Valid driver license is required (3 years semi infraction, not revocation)
• Certified fork truck driving with at least one year of experience
• Experience operating LP gas driven fork trucks
• Experience moving at least 1,000 lbs. or more with a fork truck
• Must possess the ability to operate overhead cranes, bander, shrink wrapper, forklift, tape measures and calipers.
• Must be able to determine material types and gauges
• Must possess effective written and verbal communication skills
• Must perform all duties in conjunction with UA and ISO requirements.
• Must be able to regularly lift and/or move up to 25 pounds, frequently lift and/or move up to 50 pounds, and
occasionally lift and/or move 100 pounds with an assist
• 12 Expected Behaviors of Actively Engaged Person – 100% Responsible, Trustworthy, Team Player, Clear
Communicator, Empathy, Humility, Emotional Self-Control, Resolves Conflict Directly, Positive Attitude, Respects
Others, Problem Solver, and Agile.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:
• This will be an onsite position in Seguin, Texas.
• No travel requirements.
• If selected for the role, a drug screen and physical will be conducted.

BENEFITS

In addition to excellent starting wages, we offer a competitive compensation and benefits package as well as numerous perks.
• Medical, dental and vision
• Generous RTO and Vacation policy
• 401(k) with company match
• Bonus opportunities
• Paid training
• Company paid holidays
• Earn a competitive salary and performance-based bonuses

NOTE: Given the nature/size of our product and customer requirements, we require a stringent hiring process to ensure the highest quality product. Qualified candidates must successfully complete: Basic Skills/Measurement Test | Blueprint Reading Test | Pre-Employment Physical & Drug Screen

Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Ability to stand, sit, walk, bend, twist, stoop, pull, push, assemble, and carry for extended periods of time. Ability to lift and/or move up to 25 pounds regularly, frequently lift or move up to 50 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 100 pounds with an assist.

Work Environment: Ability to perform in a manufacturing environment that may have high noise levels, dust, chemicals, oil, and grease. Ability to work in an environment that may be either hot, cold or humid.

Equal Opportunity Employer
This employer is required to notify all applicants of their rights pursuant to federal employment laws. For further information, please review the Know Your Rights notice from the Department of Labor.
