description_final: Acerca de United Alloy United Alloy es un diseñador preferido, fabricante y revestimiento de polvo de tanques de metal certificados, patines, marcos, remolques, chasis y productos relacionados diseñados con estándares de calidad de clase mundial en asociación estratégica con clientes OEM Fortune 500. Además de hacerse en los EE. UU. , UA también tiene certificación 9001 y ha sido reconocida como un negocio de propiedad de WBENC Woman/minority. Culture United Alloy empodera y confía a nuestros empleados que administren las responsabilidades de su vida y su vida en el hogar. Somos un equipo ágil que produce resultados extraordinarios, estableciendo el estándar en seguridad, calidad, productividad y rentabilidad. Los empleados actúan con un sentido de propiedad, toman la iniciativa de resolver problemas y está comprometido con la misión de la compañía, su equipo y ellos mismos. United Alloy es de apoyo y alentador con nuestros empleados, podemos ayudar a que sus sueños se hagan realidad. En UA, cada empleado nos importa. Queremos que todos tengan su propia historia de éxito en su vida personal y profesional. Es una forma que nos hace un equipo activamente comprometido, inspirado para ganar juntos. Resumen: este puesto de soldadura componentes fabricados, según las especificaciones personalizadas o de stock, a la venta a los clientes junto con los requisitos de calidad del cliente y las filosofías de fabricación de Alloy United. Monitorear el rendimiento y la eficiencia de la soldadura son esenciales. Información adicional: Esta será una posición en el sitio en Seguin, Texas. Sin requisitos de viaje. Si se selecciona para el rol, se realizará una pantalla de drogas y un físico. Beneficios Además de los excelentes salarios iniciales, ofrecemos un paquete competitivo de compensación y beneficios, así como numerosas ventajas. description:
We are looking for experienced high-reach forklift drivers/yard jockeys to join our team in Richburg, SC!

Overview:

This position will be moving orange racks to and from the loading dock. This will include counting and verifying the SKUs and quantities of tires. You will also be asked to remove the poles from those orange racks. This is in a face pace environment with pedestrians loading the tires by hand so driving safely is of the up most importance as well as your overall skill on the lift. In your role as a yard jockey, it will only take up 1-2 hours of your day, the remainder time will be spent in your material handler role. We are a smaller team so when people call out, will all get assigned other tasks to help accomplish the goal for the day. Sometimes drivers are asked to load tires onto the conveyor belts, leads/supervisors have been asked to load tires into trailers. We all help out as needed.

In order to be considered for employment, you must pass an in person driving test. You will be observed for your safety awareness, comfortability on the lift/truck, as well as your efficiency/speed. Only apply to this position if you have experience using a high-reach stand-up forklift and yard jockey experience.

Pay:
• $21.00 per hour - $24.00 per hour

Requirements
• Has steel toe/composite toe shoes
• Has reliable transportation
• Reliable attendance
• Repetitive lifting up to 50lbs without limitation.

Experience:
• At least 1 year of previous reach truck experience (required)
• At least 1 year of yard jockey experience (required)
• 1-2 years of experience in a shipping and receiving environment

Schedule:
• M-F (7am-3:30pm)
skills: Para ser considerado para el empleo, debe aprobar una prueba de manejo en persona, Tiene zapatos de punta de acero/punta compuesta, Tiene transporte confiable, Asistencia confiable, Levante repetitivo hasta 50 libras sin limitación, Al menos 1 año de experiencia previa en el camión de alcance (requerido), Al menos 1 año de experiencia en jockey de patio (requerido), 1-2 años de experiencia en un entorno de envío y recepción, Esta posición se moverá con bastidores de naranja hacia y desde el muelle de carga., Esto incluirá contar y verificar los skus y las cantidades de neumáticos, También se le pedirá que elimine los postes de esos estantes de naranja., Esto está en un ambiente de ritmo facial con peatones que cargan los neumáticos a mano, por lo que conducir de manera segura es de mayor importancia, así como su habilidad general en el ascensor., En su papel de jinete de patio, solo tomará 1-2 horas de su día, el tiempo del resto se dedicará a su rol de manejador de material, Somos un equipo más pequeño, por lo que cuando la gente grite, se les asignará otras tareas para ayudar a lograr el objetivo del día., A veces se les pide a los conductores que carguen neumáticos en las cintas transportadoras, se les pide a los cables/supervisores que carguen neumáticos en los remolques, Se le observará su conciencia de seguridad, comodidad en el elevador/camión, así como su eficiencia/velocidad.
description_final: ¡Estamos buscando conductores de montacargas con experiencia/jinetes de patio para unirse a nuestro equipo en Richburg, SC! Descripción general: esta posición se moverá con bastidores de naranja hacia y desde el muelle de carga. Esto incluirá contar y verificar los SKU y las cantidades de neumáticos. También se le pedirá que elimine los postes de esos estantes de naranja. Esto está en un ambiente de ritmo facial con peatones que cargan los neumáticos a mano, por lo que conducir de manera segura es de mayor importancia, así como su habilidad general en el ascensor. En su papel de jinete de patio, solo tomará 1-2 horas de su día, el tiempo restante se dedicará a su rol de manejador de materiales. Somos un equipo más pequeño, por lo que cuando la gente llama, se les asignará otras tareas para ayudar a lograr el objetivo del día. A veces se les pide a los conductores que carguen neumáticos en las cintas transportadoras, se les ha pedido a los cables/supervisores que carguen neumáticos en los remolques. Todos ayudamos según sea necesario. Para ser considerado para el empleo, debe aprobar una prueba de manejo en persona. Se le observará su conciencia de seguridad, comodidad en el elevador/camión, así como su eficiencia/velocidad. Solo aplique a esta posición si tiene experiencia en el uso de una experiencia de stand-up de alto alcance y una experiencia de jockey de patio. PAGO: $ 21. 00 por hora - Los requisitos de $ 24. 00 por hora tienen zapatos de acero de punta de acero/dedo del pie compuesto tienen un transporte confiable de asistencia confiable Repetitive Levante hasta 50 libras sin limitación. Experiencia: Al menos 1 año de experiencia previa en la camioneta (requerido) Al menos 1 año de experiencia de jockey de patio (requerido) 1-2 años de experiencia en un cronograma de entorno de envío y recepción: M-F (7 am-3:30 p. m. )

description:
Richardson Durum Milling, a division of Richardson International, is North America's single largest durum miller. Richardson specializes in durum and is known for its Italgrani semolina flour, manufactured and sold by U.S. Durum Milling Inc.

Richardson International provides an excellent compensation package consisting of a competitive salary, flexible benefits including medical, dental, vision, 401(k), paid time off, paid holidays, and training and career development opportunities.

Working with Richardson opens the door to a world of possibility. We currently have an opportunity for a Material Handler to join our team at our St. Louis, MO Milling location.

Responsibilities:
• Load product from bins into rail cars or truck.
• Seal bulk containers.
• Optimize loading efficiencies to support the facility's production.
• Ensure the loadout area is organized and clean at all times.
• Maintain a safe and healthy work environment by following and enforcing standards and procedures while complying with legal regulations.
• Learn and execute basic equipment maintenance to improve production reliability.
• Communicate and assist with Loadout Supervisors and maintenance department as required.

Qualifications:
• Previous experience operating trackmobile and bobcat equipment.
• Strong communication skills.
• Basic computer knowledge and working experience.
• Previous experience blending or loading is considered an asset.
• Ability to work in conditions with exposure to dust, noise, and temperature extremes.
• Must be capable of lifting and stacking up to 50 lbs unassisted.
• Ability to work rotating shifts including evenings and weekends.

Richardson is recognized as a global leader in agriculture and food processing with over 3,500 employees across the U.S., Canada, the U.K. and Europe. At Richardson, we are committed to enhancing our facilities and services and supporting our communities.

Interested candidates should click the Apply icon to apply online by June 12, 2025.

Richardson is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

#LI-TG1

description:
We are seeking a dedicated and efficient Warehouse Associate to join our dynamic team in a fast-paced Fortune 500 Distribution team! The Warehouse Associate drive a forklift and tugger and will work in our Recycling department to breaking down boxes, pushing recyclables in a bailer. To work at the HONDA PLANT in Anna, OH and must be able to badge, pass a 12 panel drug test and background check. We are only looking for candidates with good attendance and performance that are looking for a long-term career.

Pay/Schedule
• 3rd shift: Sunday 10pm - Friday 6:30am
• Pay rate: $19.07/hr.

Duties
• Loads, unloads, transports and moves materials within the entire facility.
• Operate a PIV unit(tugger/forklift) in order to collect materials throughout the warehouse from assigned routes.
• Manually moves materials onto or from pallets, bins, boxes and shelves.
• Conveys materials from storage or work sites to designated areas.
• Cleans work area, machines, and equipment.
• Assembles crates to contain products when required.
• Attaches identifying tags or labels to materials or marks information on cases, bales, or other containers.
• Adheres to all safety rules and regulations.
• Must have the ability to stand for long periods of time and occasionally lift up to 35-40 pounds.

Qualifications
• Familiarity with stock management practices and order picking processes is advantageous.
• Ability to perform heavy lifting consistently throughout the shift.
• Knowledge of OSHA safety standards is beneficial for maintaining a safe work environment.
• Strong attention to detail with the ability to follow instructions accurately.
• Excellent teamwork skills, with a proactive approach to problem-solving in a collaborative setting.

The SkySource Difference: We are not just another staffing firm! We truly care about our candidates long-term success and how we get there together. So the BIG Question is... How do we get there?

We truly care about your short-term and long-term career goals and understand what's important in making that next career move. We want to understand what you are looking for from a cultural, compensation and benefits perspective.

Apply today and experience the SkySource difference!

job_title: 1st Shift Warehouse Material Handler 1- Kansas City, KS
description:
Phoenix Metals Company is a metal distribution company with 18 locations in the United States. The company is a subsidiary of Reliance, Inc., a Fortune 500 SEC registrant, and the largest metals service center company in North America.

Job Summary

This job is in the Plant family (Department), which includes positions responsible for supervising or performing metals processing and distribution work. Work includes specialized equipment operation and/or supporting functions and requires a practical knowledge of the nature and operations and the materials, facilities and methods employed by Phoenix Metals in metals processing and distribution.

Duties and Responsibilities
• Generally responsible for completing basic, routine tasks with detailed instructions.
• Responsible for moving inventory or equipment, filling customer orders, pulling material from racks, unloading incoming material, loading trucks and/or customer vehicles,helping maintain the upkeep of the warehouse.
• Receives, places/returns items into stock inventory locations.
• Pulls and assembles orders based on reviewing work/shipping orders or other documentation.
• Tags material for proper identification and completes all required documentation.
• Moves material from receiving or production areas to storage or to other designated areas using forklift, side loader, or crane.
• Operates yard truck for the purpose of loading and unloading trailers.
• Maintains work area in a clean, safe, and orderly condition.
• Sorts and places material on rack, shelves, or in bins according to predetermined sequence such as size, type, or product code.
• Spot checks on inventory, completes daily and/or ad hoc checks for proper tagging of material, as directed.
• Reports any irregularities to supervisor for direction.
• Restocks material.
• May occasionally drive motor vehicle (non-DOT truck) for local deliveries and parts pick-ups.
• Responsible for adhering to/ensuring compliance with applicable safety and quality standards

Other Duties and Responsibilities
• All other duties and responsibilities assigned by management.

Required and Preferred Qualifications
• 0-5 years of relevant experience or any equivalent combination of education and experience that provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities required.
• High School diploma/GED preferred.
• Must possess a Valid Drivers License.
• Ability to meet current Motor Vehicle Record (MVR) quality criteria as defined by Federal regulations and/or company policy required.
• Warehousing and material handling experience preferred.
• Must be able to obtain a certification to operate all required motorized material handling and rigging equipment.
• Clear oral and written communication skills, particularly legible handwriting required.
• Ability to show adequate manual dexterity, finger dexterity, arm-hand steadiness, and multi-limb coordination required.
• Ability to read and comprehend written instructions as applied to work situations required.
• Basic measurement skills, including taking, converting, and/or using measurements of length, width, height, and weight to perform basic math computations correctly required.
• Basic arithmetic skills to calculate and convert decimals and fractions required.
• Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively required.
• Ability to make sound decisions based on a combination of factors including knowledge, experience, and judgment required.
• Ability to develop and maintain good working relationships with supervisors and co-workers required.

BENEFITS
• Health coverage available after 30 days offering competitive premiums under a wide expansive network
• Health and Flexible Spending Account options available
• Short and Long Term disability benefits
• Life and Accidental Death/Dismemberment benefits
• Dental and vision coverage
• Wellness Incentives, discounts at gyms nationwide, and many other health and well-being discounts
• 401K plan with company match
• Generous PTO plan
• Company provided Employee Assistance Program across a wide variety of categories.
• Employee Referral Program

Medium work - Exerting up to 50 pounds of force occasionally, and/or up to 20 pounds of force frequently, and/or up to 10 pounds of force constantly to move objects.

Warehouse setting; minimal temperature environment

Quarterly bonus up to $1500

We are an equal opportunity employer. All applicants shall be considered for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable Federal, state, or local law.

description:
Komatsu is an indispensable partner to the construction, mining, forestry, forklift, and industrial machinery markets, maximizing value for customers through innovative solutions. With a diverse line of products supported by our advanced IoT technologies, regional distribution channels, and a global service network, we tap into the power of data and technology to enhance safety and productivity while optimizing performance. Komatsu supports a myriad of markets, including housing, infrastructure, water, pipeline, minerals, automobile, aerospace, electronics and medical, through its many brands and subsidiaries, including TimberPro, Joy, P&H, Montabert, Modular Mining Systems, Hensley Industries, NTC, and Gigaphoton.
Job Overview

To affect the movement of material through the warehouse beginning with the receipt of material from vendors to the shipping of material to distributors as directed on their purchase orders.

Key Job Responsibilities
• Unload partial and complete trailer loads of material from vendor and plants.
• Process receipt of this material verifying part number, quantity and quality.
• Contact supervisor when material is not correct.
• Remove material that has been process from receiving floor and place in appropriate warehouse location while providing required documentation of such transactions to insure accuracy and compliance to company policy.
• Pick, pack and ship material from warehouse locations as directed by purchase orders from distributors worldwide verifying accuracy and in compliance to instructions on order.
• Keep work area clean and safe in accordance with company policies and government regulations.
• Regular attendance required.
• Other duties and responsibilities as assigned by the supervisor.

Qualifications/Requirements
• Accuracy and quantity of line items putaway.
• Accuracy and quantity of line items picked, packed and shipped.
• Adherence to company policies and follow safety rules.
• Meet warehouse productivity and quality levels.
• Maintain a clean and safe work area.
• High school diploma or equivalent, on the job training provided. Prior warehouse experience a plus. Forklift certification a plus.
• General math and reading skills plus the ability to pay attention to detail. Training is required on various material handling equipment used in the facility. (i.e. lift truck, stock chaser, bander, radio frequency devices and various hand tools.)
• Regular attendance.
• Physical Requirements: While performing the duties of this job, the associate is required to have ordinary ambulatory skills sufficient to visit other locations within the facility and the ability to stand, walk stoop, kneel, crouch and manipulate (lift, carry, move) light to medium weight items of 20-30 pounds. Infrequently handle medium to heavy weight items of 35-50 pounds. Requires good hand-eye coordination, arm, hand and finger dexterity, including ability to grasp and visual acuity to use a keyboard, operate equipment and read application information. The associate frequently is required to reach with hands and arms, talk and hear.
• Limited phone contact is required with inhouse customer service and supply. Contact by phone may also be required with distributors and vendors as assigned by supervisor.

Additional Information

Komatsu is an Equal Opportunity Workplace and an Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

description_final: Komatsu es un socio indispensable para los mercados de construcción, minería, forestal, montacargas y maquinaria industrial, maximizando el valor para los clientes a través de soluciones innovadoras. Con una línea diversa de productos respaldados por nuestras tecnologías avanzadas de IoT, canales de distribución regional y una red de servicios globales, aprovechamos el poder de los datos y la tecnología para mejorar la seguridad y la productividad al tiempo que optimizamos el rendimiento. Komatsu apoya una miríada de mercados, que incluyen viviendas, infraestructura, agua, tuberías, minerales, automóviles, aeroespaciales, electrónicos y médicos, a través de sus muchas marcas y subsidiarias, incluidos Timberpro, Joy, P&H, Montabert, Modular Mining Systems, Hensley Industries, NTC y Gigaphoton. Descripción general del trabajo para afectar el movimiento del material a través del almacén comenzando con la recepción de material de los proveedores a la envío del material a los distribuidores según las indicaciones de sus órdenes de compra. Responsabilidades de trabajo clave Descargue las cargas de material parciales y completas de material del proveedor y las plantas. Procesar la recepción de este material que verifica el número de pieza, la cantidad y la calidad. Póngase en contacto con el supervisor cuando el material no sea correcto. Elimine el material que haya sido procesado del piso y el lugar en la ubicación adecuada del almacén al tiempo que proporciona la documentación requerida de tales transacciones para asegurar la precisión y el cumplimiento de la política de la empresa. Elija, empacar y envíe material de las ubicaciones de almacén según lo indicado por las órdenes de compra de los distribuidores en todo el mundo verificando la precisión y en el cumplimiento de las instrucciones al orden. Mantenga el área de trabajo limpia y segura de acuerdo con las políticas de la empresa y las regulaciones gubernamentales. Se requiere asistencia regular. Otros deberes y responsabilidades asignados por el supervisor. Calificaciones/Requisitos Precisión y cantidad de pedidos de pedido de pedido. Precisión y cantidad de artículos de línea elegidos, empacados y enviados. Adherencia a las políticas de la empresa y siga las reglas de seguridad. Conozca la productividad del almacén y los niveles de calidad. Mantenga un área de trabajo limpia y segura. Diploma de escuela secundaria o equivalente, en la capacitación laboral proporcionada. Experiencia previa de almacén una ventaja. Certificación de montacargas una ventaja. Habilidades generales de matemáticas y lectura más la capacidad de prestar atención a los detalles. Se requiere capacitación en varios equipos de manejo de materiales utilizados en la instalación. (es decir, camión de elevación, cazador de stock, bander, dispositivos de radiofrecuencia y varias herramientas manuales). Asistencia regular. Requisitos físicos: mientras realiza las tareas de este trabajo, el asociado debe tener habilidades ambulatorias comunes suficientes para visitar otros lugares dentro de las instalaciones y la capacidad de pararse, caminar, arrodillarse, agacharse y manipular (levantar, transportar, mover) artículos de peso ligero a mediano de 20-30 libras. Maneja con poca frecuencia artículos de peso medio a pesado de 35-50 libras. Requiere una buena coordinación mano-ojo, la destreza de los brazos, las manos y los dedos, incluida la capacidad de comprender y la agudeza visual para usar un teclado, operar equipos y leer información de la aplicación. El asociado con frecuencia debe alcanzar las manos y los brazos, hablar y escuchar. Se requiere contacto telefónico limitado con el servicio al cliente y el suministro interno. El contacto por teléfono también puede ser requerido con distribuidores y proveedores según lo asignado por Supervisor. Información adicional Komatsu es un lugar de trabajo de igualdad de oportunidades y un empleador de acción afirmativa. Todos los solicitantes calificados recibirán una consideración para el empleo sin tener en cuenta la raza, el color, la religión, el sexo, la orientación sexual, la identidad de género, el origen nacional, la discapacidad o el estatus de veteranos protegidos.

description:
Position Summary:

We are seeking a reliable and detail-oriented Warehouse Worker to join our team. This role is essential in ensuring accurate inventory control, efficient order fulfillment, and proper storage of incoming stock. The ideal candidate will handle both hardware and dimensional lumber, supporting our sales and production departments by pulling and delivering correct items in a timely and accurate manner.
Key Responsibilities:
• Receive and Verify Stock:
• Check incoming deliveries against purchase orders and packing slips for accuracy.
• Inspect materials for damage or discrepancies upon receipt.
• Record and report any variances or quality issues.
• Put Away Inventory:
• Safely and efficiently store materials in designated locations.
• Ensure proper organization and labeling of stock, maintaining cleanliness and orderliness in the warehouse.
• Order Fulfillment:
• Pull orders accurately for both sales and internal production departments.
• Verify that part numbers, sizes, and types of materials match order requirements, with special attention to items with similar specifications.
• Material Handling:
• Handle both hardware and dimensional lumber safely and appropriately.
• Operate forklifts or other warehouse equipment as required (training provided if necessary).
• Inventory Accuracy:
• Participate in cycle counts and periodic full inventory checks.
• Assist in maintaining accurate records of stock levels and movements.
• Teamwork & Communication:
• Work closely with sales, production, and purchasing teams to ensure smooth operations.
• Report shortages, overages, or stock concerns promptly.

Qualifications:
• High school diploma or equivalent preferred.
• Previous warehouse, inventory, or material handling experience is a plus.
• Ability to read and understand packing slips, work orders, and product specifications.
• Strong attention to detail to differentiate between similar materials (e.g., sizes or part numbers).
• Basic math and computer skills for inventory entry and verification.
• Ability to lift up to 50 lbs and stand for extended periods.
• Forklift certification (or willingness to obtain) is a plus.
• Must be a dependable team player with a proactive work ethic.

Work Environment:
• Primarily warehouse-based with exposure to outdoor conditions during unloading/loading.
• May involve working in varying temperatures and around heavy materials.

description_final: Resumen del puesto: estamos buscando un trabajador de almacén confiable y orientado a los detalles para unirse a nuestro equipo. Este rol es esencial para garantizar un control de inventario preciso, el cumplimiento eficiente del orden y el almacenamiento adecuado de stock entrante. El candidato ideal manejará la madera de hardware y dimensional, apoyando a nuestros departamentos de ventas y producción sacando y entregando artículos correctos de manera oportuna y precisa. Responsabilidades clave: Recibir y verificar las acciones: Verifique las entregas entrantes con las órdenes de compra y los resbalones de embalaje para su precisión. Inspeccionar los materiales por daños o discrepancias al recibir. Registre e informe cualquier variación o problema de calidad. Guarte el inventario: almacene de manera segura y eficiente los materiales en ubicaciones designadas. Asegure la organización adecuada y el etiquetado de stock, manteniendo la limpieza y el orden en el almacén. Cumplimiento de pedidos: realice órdenes con precisión tanto para las ventas como para los departamentos de producción interna. Verifique que los números de pieza, los tamaños y los tipos de materiales coincidan con los requisitos de pedido, con especial atención a los elementos con especificaciones similares. Manejo de materiales: maneje tanto hardware como madera dimensional de manera segura y apropiada. Opere elevadoras u otros equipos de almacén según sea necesario (capacitación proporcionada si es necesario). Precisión de inventario: participe en los recuentos de ciclo y las verificaciones de inventario completas periódicas. Asistir a mantener registros precisos de los niveles y movimientos de existencias. Trabajo en equipo y comunicación: trabaje en estrecha colaboración con los equipos de ventas, producción y compra para garantizar operaciones sin problemas. Informe escasez, excedentes o preocupaciones de acciones de inmediato. Calificaciones: Diploma de escuela secundaria o equivalente preferido. La experiencia previa en el almacén, el inventario o el manejo de materiales es una ventaja. Capacidad para leer y comprender los resbalones de embalaje, los pedidos laborales y las especificaciones del producto. Fuerte atención al detalle para diferenciar entre materiales similares (por ejemplo, tamaños o números de pieza). Habilidades básicas de matemáticas e informática para la entrada y verificación de inventario. Capacidad para levantar hasta 50 libras y soportar períodos prolongados. La certificación de la carretilla elevadora (o la voluntad de obtener) es una ventaja. Debe ser un jugador de equipo confiable con una ética de trabajo proactiva. Entorno de trabajo: principalmente basado en el almacén con exposición a condiciones al aire libre durante la descarga/carga. Puede implicar trabajar en diferentes temperaturas y alrededor de materiales pesados.

description:
Compensation Data

$17.00 - $23.00 Hourly

Company Summary

Pacific Supply is a distributor of building products with over 50 locations throughout the Western United States and has been serving the needs of the construction industry and the communities since 1953. We are accepting resumes for a Material Handler.

Pacific Supply recognizes that employees are their most valuable resource and an integral part of their success. Their goal is to attract and retain the highest quality candidates. Pacific Supply encourages the development of their employees and believes it is necessary for the growth and success of the company.

Job Description

Candidates will primarily be responsible for loading roofing materials onto roofs and drywall into homes.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Essential duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:
• Responsible for loading and unloading customer and company vehicles.
• Loads roofing shingles onto roofs as well as other material handling in the yard and on jobsites.
• Counts and reconciles incoming and outgoing materials.
• Assists all customers in a courteous and friendly manner.

Job Requirements
• Forklift experience required.
• Must be able to lift up to 100 pounds.
• Must be willing and able to load a roof or stock drywall.
• Must have basic reading, writing and mathematical skills.
• Prior experience in the distribution center industry preferred but not required.
• Must be able to work as a team member.

Benefits

We offer competitive compensation and a strong benefits package including medical, dental, vision, 401(k), profit sharing, flexible spending accounts, vacation and sick pay, life insurance and wellness programs.

We are an equal opportunity employer and promote a drug free workplace.

description:
WHO WE ARE:

Founded in 1947 and headquartered in Schofield, Wisconsin, Wausau Supply Company has a history of providing top-quality building materials to authorized retailers across the United States. As a proud 100% employee-owned company, we are dedicated to not only serving our customers but also ensuring that our employees have a direct stake in our success. We distribute building materials from the industry’s leading manufacturers to authorized retailers from the western Rocky Mountains to the east coast. In addition to our distribution capabilities, Wausau Supply Company is known for its high-quality manufactured brands, including Diamond Kote Siding System, Waudena, ChamClad and Taylor Entrance Systems. These brands reflect our commitment to innovation, safety, service and integrity. Our territory continues to expand as we continuously strive to meet the demands of our customers with nineteen distribution centers and five fabrication and finishing facilities across the United States.

At Wausau Supply Company, we are driven by a passion for excellence and a dedication to service, ensuring that we remain a trusted partner in the building materials industry for generations to come.

BENEFITS WE OFFER:

+ $1000 Sign on Bonus

+ 3 weeks paid vacation within 1st year

+ 9 paid holidays

+ 100% Employee Owned

+ Employee Stock Ownership Program

~Employer funded with an average retirement contribution of up to $4 per hour

+ 401K Retirement Fund - Additional opportunity for employee to contribute

+ Health, Dental, Vision, Short Term/ Long Term Disability

+ Employee Assistance Program

+ Opportunity for advancement

+ Training and development

+ Employee Material Purchase Program

WHAT THIS ROLE WILL BE DOING:

The Waudena Material Handler is responsible for receiving inventory, incoming quality control, sorting, and maintaining flow of materials through Waudena production system. It is the responsibility of the Material Handler to be aware of all production goals and anticipate problems that could impact long term goals, such as quality control and establishing high standards of workmanship. In order to be an effective as the Material Handler, individual must be fluent with communication and it is imperative that positive relations with all internal levels of the organization remain uncompromised.

Duties to include, (but not limited to):
• Consistently demonstrates and incorporates principals of safety for self and others into daily activities.
• Develops and maintains a clean, safe working environment and ensures participation in safety programs and required trainings.
• Safeguards Company property while maintaining acceptable level of productivity.
• Accurately picking work orders for production while maintaining a production pace.
• Prepare parts as required for downstream work cells
• Sorts and move product interdepartmentally while operating and using a variety of material handling equipment including but not limited to forklifts, pallet trucks, racks, hand-held scanners, system technology, etc.
• Use inventory and warehouse management software to facilitate electronic movement of inventory within the system
• Manage inventory as required.
• Receive and put away incoming material and process electronic receipts and movements through system.
• Identify inventory discrepancies and take necessary actions to rectify system stated and on-hand inventory records.
• Performs all duties in a manner that promotes team concept and encourages team effort.
• Performs other duties as assigned that would lead to successful operation of department, team and/or company mission.

Material Handler Demonstrates:
• Quality minded to ensure the product lives up to the reputation that Waudena has established
• Ability to communicate effectively, define problems, collect data and draw valid conclusions with all levels of the organization and team
• Ability to read paperwork, interpret instruction and exercise good judgment
• Ability to add, subtract, multiply and divide in all units of measure
• Ability to analyze and solve problems
• Being observant, able to identify issues, stop and correct the issue

Education / Experience:
• High school diploma or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Working Demands / Physical Requirements:
• Ability to lift and carry up to 75 pounds
• Ability to stand/bend/walk for long periods of time
• Work 10 hour shifts minimum

Reports to: Warehouse Supervisor

Conclusion: The Material Handler will exemplify the high standards that have come to be associated with WSC. As an ESOP owner, acting with honor, integrity, and positivity is imperative. The Material Handler’s prime objective is to oversee the internal movement of our product and to ensure quality standards remain uncompromised

description_final: Quiénes somos: fundada en 1947 y con sede en Schofield, Wisconsin, Wausau Supply Company tiene un historial de proporcionar materiales de construcción de alta calidad a minoristas autorizados en los Estados Unidos. Como una orgullosa empresa 100% propiedad de empleados, estamos dedicados no solo a servir a nuestros clientes, sino también a garantizar que nuestros empleados tengan una participación directa en nuestro éxito. Distribuimos los materiales de construcción de los principales fabricantes de la industria a minoristas autorizados desde las montañas rocosas occidentales hasta la costa este. Además de nuestras capacidades de distribución, Wausau Supply Company es conocida por sus marcas manufacturadas de alta calidad, incluidos los sistemas de entrada de Diamond Kote Kote, Waudena, Chamblad y Taylor Entrance. Estas marcas reflejan nuestro compromiso con la innovación, la seguridad, el servicio y la integridad. Nuestro territorio continúa expandiéndose a medida que nos esforzamos continuamente por satisfacer las demandas de nuestros clientes con diecinueve centros de distribución y cinco instalaciones de fabricación y acabado en los Estados Unidos. En Wausau Supply Company, estamos impulsados ​​por una pasión por la excelencia y una dedicación al servicio, asegurando que sigamos siendo un socio de confianza en la industria de materiales de construcción para las generaciones venideras. Beneficios que ofrecemos: + $ 1000 Iniciar sesión en el bono + 3 semanas de vacaciones pagadas dentro del 1er año + 9 vacaciones pagadas + 100% propiedad de las acciones de los empleados El Programa de propiedad de acciones de los empleados ~ Empleador financiado con una contribución promedio de jubilación de hasta $ 4 por hora + 401K Jubilado Fondo de jubilación - Oportunidad adicional Oportunidad de empleados para contribuir + salud, visión, visión, visión, visión, visión a largo plazo/ Diseño a largo plazo Programa de asistencia de empleados + Oportunidad para avanzar + Capacitación + Desarrollo de empleados Waudena Material Handler es responsable de recibir inventario, control de calidad entrante, clasificación y mantenimiento del flujo de materiales a través del sistema de producción de Waudena. Es responsabilidad del controlador de materiales tener en cuenta todos los objetivos de producción y anticipar problemas que podrían afectar los objetivos a largo plazo, como el control de calidad y el establecimiento de altos estándares de mano de obra. Para ser efectivo como el manejador de materiales, el individuo debe ser fluido con la comunicación y es imperativo que las relaciones positivas con todos los niveles internos de la organización sigan sin compromisos. Deberes para incluir, (pero no limitarse): demuestra e incorpora constantemente directores de seguridad para sí mismo y de los demás en actividades diarias. Desarrolla y mantiene un ambiente de trabajo limpio y seguro y garantiza la participación en los programas de seguridad y los capacitaciones requeridos. Salvaguardar la propiedad de la compañía mientras mantiene un nivel aceptable de productividad. Elige con precisión las órdenes de trabajo para la producción mientras mantiene un ritmo de producción. Prepare piezas como sea necesario para las celdas de trabajo aguas abajo y mueva el producto de forma interdepartamental mientras opera y usa una variedad de equipos de manejo de materiales que incluyen, entre otros, elevadoras, camiones de paletas, bastidores, escáneres de mano, tecnología de sistemas, etc. Utilice el software de inventario y gestión de almacenes para facilitar el movimiento electrónico del inventario dentro del sistema, el inventario de gestión del sistema según sea necesario. Reciba y guarde el material entrante y procese los recibos y movimientos electrónicos a través del sistema. Identifique las discrepancias de inventario y tome las medidas necesarias para rectificar los registros de inventario establecidos y disponibles del sistema. Realiza todas las tareas de una manera que promueve el concepto de equipo y fomenta el esfuerzo del equipo. Realiza otras tareas asignadas que conducirían a una operación exitosa de la misión de departamento, equipo y/o empresa. El controlador de materiales demuestra: la calidad de la calidad para garantizar que el producto esté a la altura de la reputación de que Waudena ha establecido la capacidad de comunicarse de manera efectiva, definir problemas, recopilar datos y sacar conclusiones válidas con todos los niveles de la organización y la capacidad del equipo para leer el papeleo, interpretar la instrucción y ejercer una buena capacidad de juicio para agregar, restar, multiplicar y dividir todas las unidades de la capacidad de analizar y solucionar los problemas observadores, poder para identificar los problemas, parar y corregir el problema y la experiencia de los problemas de la escuela. Combinación de educación y experiencia. Demandas de trabajo/Requisitos físicos: Capacidad para levantar y transportar hasta 75 libras Capacidad para pararse/doblar/caminar durante largos períodos de tiempo Trabajo de 10 horas Informes mínimos a: Conclusión del supervisor del almacén: El controlador de materiales ejemplificará los altos estándares que se han asociado con WSC. Como propietario de ESOP, actuar con honor, integridad y positividad es imprescindible. El objetivo principal del manejador de materiales es supervisar el movimiento interno de nuestro producto y garantizar que los estándares de calidad sigan sin compromisos

description:
POSITION: Material Handler
SHIFT: 6:00 am - 4:30 pm Monday - Thursday, 6:00 am - 11:30 am Friday (OT as needed)
PAY RATE: $23.00 - $25.00+ per hour (DOE)
LOCATION: West Fargo, ND

TrueNorth Steel is looking for a Material Handler to assist in the general handling, movement, and loading of steel at our West Fargo site.

Since 1945, TrueNorth Steel has been delivering quality manufactured and fabricated steel products. Our values of Safety, Integrity, Humility, Focus, Knowledge, Commitment, and Confidence guide our everyday work. If you’re looking for a job with an industry leader offering great benefits, TrueNorth Steel is the place for you!

SUMMARY OF RESPONSIBILITIESThis position is responsible for the general handling of materials where applicable, using overhead cranes, forklifts, telehandlers, and other similar equipment. The handling of material may be associated with various areas, including unloading in-bound material, loading out-bound material or moving and distributing material to various operation areas for fabrication.
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS
• Embrace and demonstrate the qualities of the TNS Game Changer definition.
• Follow all company safety and quality requirements.
• Ability to efficiently and safely operate applicable equipment to unload, load and distribute material with minimal supervision.
• Ability to communicate with team members verbally and non-verbally.
• Ability to work efficiently in all forms of weather (wind, heat, cold, rain, snow).
• Willing to work flexible hours and overtime or weekends as needed.
• Prompt and dependable attendance.
• Other duties as assigned.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND QUALITIES
• Exhibit strong skills in material identification.
• Exhibit strong organizational skills.
• Exhibit basic computer skills.
• Plan and organize work to meet deadlines.
• Understand and follow oral and written directions.
• Ability to read a tape measure (imperial and metric).
• Ability to work with others.
EDUCATION AND WORK EXPERIENCE
• Forklift and/or overhead crane experience preferred
• High School Diploma or GED Required
REQUIRED COMPETENCIES/QUALITIES
• Accountability – Ability to accept responsibility and account for his/her actions.
• Accuracy – Ability to perform work accurately and thoroughly.
• Honesty/Integrity – Ability to be truthful and be seen as credible in the workplace.
• Initiative – Ability to make decisions or take actions to solve a problem or reach a goal.
• Reliability – The trait of being dependable and trustworthy

description:
Join Hamshaw Lumber for a rewarding carreer in the lumber and building materials industry with competitive pay + benefits.

Full-time, year round position responsible for servicing customers in a retail lumber and building materials location. You must have solid customer service skills for counter and store sales, thrive in a fast paced environment, have strong people skills and have a positive team attitude. The right person must be detail oriented with knowledge of lumber and building materials. Previous experience with builders or contractors a plus. Great opportunity with career advancement potential in sales!

Job Responsibilities
• Responsible for waiting on customers in person, on the phone and via email
• Processes orders and quotes for building materials requested by customers

Full Time Benefits
• Medical Insurance & Prescription Drug Plan
• Dental Insurance
• Vision Insurance
• Employee Purchase Discount
• 401(k) Plan
• Paid Holidays
• Paid Time Off

Requirements
• Previous experience in customer service or sales preferred
• 2 years knowledge of building materials preferred, but not required
• Excellent telephone skills preferred
• Ideal candidate must be self-motivated and able to handle multiple projects simultaneously

Don't miss out on this exciting opportunity to join the Hamshaw Lumber team and grow your career in the building materials industry. Apply now!

Hamshaw Lumber is a family-run business that provides quality building supplies and exceptional customer service to Southwestern New Hampshire, North Central Massachusetts, and beyond.

Job Type: fulltime

Schedule:
• Weekend availability
• Day shift

Education: No education required

Work location: On-site

description:
Florida Supplement

Mon - Fri

6:30AM - 3:00PM

TITLE: MATERIAL HANDLER B

POSITION OBJECTIVE:

Be part of a team which main goal is to package bulk products into containers that will be delivered to the customers following SOP's and cGMP guidelines. The material handler is responsible for the quality of the product they produce.

QUALIFICATIONS:
• Ensure consistent, dependable attendance and demonstrate a willingness to accommodate non-standard work hours as necessary.
• Capable of effectively managing job-related stress and fostering productive workplace interactions.
• Proficiency in basic math.
• At least one year of equivalent machine operation experience, prior experience in a pharmaceutical/nutraceutical environment, familiarity with manufacturing processes and equipment procedures preferred, proven knowledge of high speed, manufacturing equipment.
• High School Diploma/Certificate; or one-year related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Ensures that the packaging line is set-up and runs productively and efficiently following all the SOP's and cGMP's guidelines.
• Follows all the PPE guidelines.
• Performs the filling, weighing, securing, labeling, and packaging of the containers as per company and/or customer specifications following all the SOP's and cGMP's guidelines.
• Works along with Line Lead and QC to ensure that the proper fill weights are being met by customer specifications.
• Helps to maintain a positive working environment within the packaging line and department.
• Identifies any deficiencies, constrains and/or problems that could impede the efficient packaging process flow and assist and/or provide ideas and feedback to solve them.
• Maintains working area orderly and clean.
• Works efficiently to achieve all the production output goals.
• Perform operational tasks and equipment maintenance as needed, requested, directed or instructed by the supervisor/manager.
• Able to assist with equipment preventive maintenance and operational tasks, as needed.
• Utilize Safety in the Workplace Best Practices
• Follow MSDS instructions and compliance with the Lockout/Tagout program, if and when applicable; adhere to safety policies and procedures at all times. Report any out-of-compliance items to the supervisor immediately.
• May be required to perform other duties as requested, directed or assigned.

MACHINES, TOOLS, EQUIPMENT, ELECTRONIC DEVICES & SOFTWARE:
• Experience using a manual and electric pallet jack.

PHYSICAL ACTIVITY REQUIRED FOR THIS POSITION:
• Ability to stand for 8-10 hours daily.
• Ability to routinely lift 30-50 lbs

Florida Supplement is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

description:
We are looking for an Experienced Construction Material Testing Technician to join out team. We are a small and growing company that has great opportunities to grow. Pay will be based on Technician Certifications & Experience.
Job Description General Responsibilities: Our experienced Construction Materials Technicians should know how to perform various observations and tests on construction materials such as soils, concrete, masonry, reinforcing steel and asphalt. You will communicate with Project Managers, client representatives, contractor’s representatives and other key stakeholders regarding testing and inspection results. Tests are performed on building construction projects in the Houston area and at our lab in Houston, TX.
Essential Role and Responsibilities:
Under direction of senior technicians, staff professionals or project managers, learns and assists with tasks and perform basic sample tests and observation of soils, aggregates, concrete, masonry, reinforcing steel and asphalt. Document and prepare sample testing and observation data using a laptop or tablet device; submit findings accurately to a Project Manager. Effectively communicate testing and inspection results. Will be placed in a progressively increased role of training and responsibility in work assignments. Ensure that all testing equipment and tools are properly calibrated and maintained. Follows safety rules and practices and other safety requirements for all projects. Performs pre-task planning prior to executing work. Reports any safety issues or concerns to management. Maintains quality standards on all projects. Transports materials safely from various job sites to the lab using a company provided full size pickup truck. Requirements: High school diploma or equivalent Obtain ACI certification within 90 days of hire Successful completion of related internal safety and technical certifications Valid driver’s license with acceptable violation history Preferred Requirements: Related work experience in construction helpful, but not required Current industry certifications for materials testing a plus, but not required The successful candidate will be encouraged to expand their skills and certifications through company provided training and mentoring. This is an opportunity to become a member of a successful team, be part of the construction process and make a career at a steady, growing organization.

We're in search of a seasoned Construction Material Testing Technician to join our team. As a small but rapidly expanding company, we offer abundant prospects for professional growth. Compensation will be commensurate with Technician Certifications & Experience.

Job Description:

General Responsibilities:
We have an exciting opportunity for an experienced Construction Materials Technician to join our team in Houston, Texas. Our adept Construction Materials Technicians should be proficient in conducting various observations and tests on construction materials including soils, concrete, masonry, reinforcing steel, and asphalt. You will collaborate with Project Managers, client representatives, contractor’s representatives, and other key stakeholders regarding testing and inspection results. Tests are conducted on building construction projects in the Houston area and at our laboratory in Houston, TX.

Essential Role and Responsibilities:
• Under the guidance of senior technicians, staff professionals, or project managers, you will learn and assist with tasks, performing basic sample tests and observations of soils, aggregates, concrete, masonry, reinforcing steel, and asphalt.
• Document and prepare sample testing and observation data using a laptop or tablet device; submit findings accurately to a Project Manager.
• Communicate testing and inspection results effectively.
• Progressively take on increased responsibility and training in work assignments.
• Ensure proper calibration and maintenance of all testing equipment and tools.
• Adhere to safety rules, practices, and other safety requirements for all projects. Perform pre-task planning before executing work. Report any safety issues or concerns to management.
• Maintain quality standards on all projects.
• Safely transport materials from various job sites to the lab using a company-provided full-size pickup truck.

Requirements:
• High school diploma or equivalent.
• Obtain ACI certification within 90 days of hire.
• Successful completion of related internal safety and technical certifications.
• Valid driver’s license with acceptable violation history.

Preferred Requirements:
• Related work experience in construction is helpful, though not required.
• Current industry certifications for materials testing are a plus, but not mandatory.

The successful candidate will be encouraged to expand their skills and certifications through company-provided training and mentoring. This role offers the opportunity to join a successful team, contribute to the construction process, and build a fulfilling career at a stable, growing organization.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $19.00 - $30.00 per hour

Benefits:
• Health insurance
• Paid time off
• Professional development assistance

Schedule:
• 10 hour shift
• 8 hour shift

Work Location: In person

description_final: Estamos buscando un técnico experimentado en pruebas de material de construcción para unirse al equipo. Somos una empresa pequeña y en crecimiento que tiene grandes oportunidades para crecer. El pago se basará en certificaciones y experiencia técnicas. Descripción del trabajo Responsabilidades generales: nuestros técnicos experimentados de materiales de construcción deben saber cómo realizar diversas observaciones y pruebas sobre materiales de construcción como suelos, concreto, mampostería, acero de refuerzo y asfalto. Se comunicará con gerentes de proyecto, representantes del cliente, representantes del contratista y otras partes interesadas clave con respecto a los resultados de las pruebas y la inspección. Las pruebas se realizan en proyectos de construcción de edificios en el área de Houston y en nuestro laboratorio en Houston, TX. Rol y responsabilidades esenciales: bajo la dirección de técnicos superiores, profesionales del personal o gerentes de proyectos, aprende y ayuda con las tareas y realiza pruebas básicas de muestra y observación de suelos, agregados, concreto, mampostería, refuerzo de acero y asfalto. Documentar y preparar datos de pruebas de muestra y observación utilizando una computadora portátil o tableta; Envíe los hallazgos con precisión a un gerente de proyecto. Comunicar efectivamente los resultados de las pruebas y la inspección. Se colocará en un papel progresivo de capacitación y responsabilidad en las tareas laborales. Asegúrese de que todos los equipos y herramientas de prueba estén correctamente calibrados y mantenidos. Sigue las reglas y prácticas de seguridad y otros requisitos de seguridad para todos los proyectos. Realiza la planificación previa a la tarea antes de ejecutar el trabajo. Informa cualquier problema o inquietud de seguridad para la gerencia. Mantiene estándares de calidad en todos los proyectos. Transporta materiales de forma segura desde varios sitios de trabajo al laboratorio utilizando una empresa proporcionada camioneta de tamaño completo. Requisitos: Diploma de escuela secundaria o equivalente obtenga la certificación ACI dentro de los 90 días posteriores a la finalización exitosa de la finalización de certificaciones técnicas y de seguridad técnicas relacionadas con la licencia de conducir válida con historial de violación aceptable Requisitos preferidos: experiencia laboral relacionada en la construcción útil, pero no se requiere certificaciones de la industria actuales para la prueba de materiales una ventaja, pero no se requiere que el candidato exitoso sea alentado a expandir sus habilidades y certificaciones a través de la formación prevista para la compañía y la mentalización. Esta es una oportunidad para convertirse en miembro de un equipo exitoso, ser parte del proceso de construcción y hacer una carrera en una organización estable y en crecimiento. Estamos en busca de un técnico de prueba de material de construcción experimentado para unirse a nuestro equipo. Como una empresa pequeña pero en rápida expansión, ofrecemos abundantes perspectivas para el crecimiento profesional. La compensación será acorde con las certificaciones y la experiencia del técnico. Descripción del trabajo: Responsabilidades generales: Tenemos una oportunidad emocionante para que un técnico de materiales de construcción experimentado se una a nuestro equipo en Houston, Texas. Nuestros técnicos de materiales de construcción adeptos deben ser competentes en la realización de diversas observaciones y pruebas sobre materiales de construcción, incluidos suelos, concreto, mampostería, acero de refuerzo y asfalto. Colaborará con gerentes de proyecto, representantes de los clientes, representantes de los contratistas y otras partes interesadas clave con respecto a los resultados de las pruebas y la inspección. Las pruebas se realizan sobre proyectos de construcción de edificios en el área de Houston y en nuestro laboratorio en Houston, TX. Rol y responsabilidades esenciales: bajo la guía de técnicos superiores, profesionales del personal o gerentes de proyecto, aprenderá y ayudará con las tareas, realizando pruebas básicas de muestras y observaciones de suelos, agregados, concreto, mampostería, refuerzo de acero y asfalto. Documentar y preparar datos de pruebas de muestra y observación utilizando una computadora portátil o tableta; Envíe los hallazgos con precisión a un gerente de proyecto. Comunicar los resultados de las pruebas y la inspección de manera efectiva. Asumir progresivamente una mayor responsabilidad y capacitación en tareas laborales. Asegure la calibración y el mantenimiento adecuados de todos los equipos y herramientas de prueba. Adherirse a las reglas de seguridad, las prácticas y otros requisitos de seguridad para todos los proyectos. Realice la planificación previa a la tarea antes de ejecutar el trabajo. Informe cualquier problema o inquietud de seguridad para la gerencia. Mantener estándares de calidad en todos los proyectos. Transporte de forma segura los materiales de varios sitios de trabajo al laboratorio utilizando una camioneta de tamaño completo proporcionado por la empresa. Requisitos: Diploma de escuela secundaria o equivalente. Obtenga la certificación ACI dentro de los 90 días posteriores a la contratación. Finalización exitosa de certificaciones técnicas y de seguridad interna relacionadas. Licencia de conducir válida con historial de violación aceptable. Requisitos preferidos: la experiencia laboral relacionada en la construcción es útil, aunque no es necesaria. Las certificaciones actuales de la industria para las pruebas de materiales son una ventaja, pero no obligatorias. Se alentará al candidato exitoso a expandir sus habilidades y certificaciones a través de capacitación y tutoría proporcionadas por la compañía. Este rol ofrece la oportunidad de unirse a un equipo exitoso, contribuir al proceso de construcción y construir una carrera satisfactoria en una organización estable y en crecimiento. description:
At TireHub we move more than tires – we move businesses forward, support communities, and help keep America rolling. And behind it all? Our people. We call them Hubbers – because they’re at the center of everything we do. From behind the wheel to the warehouse floor, from customer calls to corporate strategy, every Hubber plays a role in something bigger than themselves. And we show up every day ready to say yes – to challenges, to each other, and to getting it done right.

The primary role of the Logistics Specialist (LS) involves loading and unloading tires for warehouse storage and/or timely customer delivery, including the unloading and staging of products at the customer’s business location. The LS is expected to represent TireHub professionally in all customer interaction and maintain safe driving practices, all while delivering exceptional customer service and fostering strong customer relationships.

When you say YES to something bigger:

Starting wage of $19.50 hr., with applicable wage progression after 90-day, 180-day, and 1-year tenure with TireHub.

Monday through Saturday – Fluctuating day shift hours

Benefits summary:

· Paid weekly on Fridays

· Choose your benefits which include a no cost health insurance option

· TireHub funded Health Savings Account

· Additional benefit options including TireHub paid short/long term disability and life insurance benefits

· Paid vacation and holidays PLUS your birthday off!

· Parental leave programs

· Build your financial future with 401k including TireHub match

· Uniform program

· Access to tire discounts, perks, and so much more!

This position reports to an Assistant TLC Leader.

The individual must exhibit the following TireHub core commitments:
• Approachable - If a company could smile, we would. Instead, we rely on our people to show it. We care about each other and our customers because we know business only gets done right when people respect each other and value relationships.
• Adventurous - What TireHub is set up to do is intentionally outrageous. So, we readily embrace challenges with the courage to introduce new ideas and the ambition to build something unique.
• Relentless - We tackle our work with energy. We deliver on our commitments with enthusiasm. And we don't give up until we get to the end. 
• Speedy - Speed is the currency in the tire industry. When we commit to a job, we get the job done – and we do it fast. 

Roles and Responsibilities:
• Responsible for distribution of tasks including:

· General Warehousing

· Delivery Services

· Vehicle Maintenance
• Adjustments to these allocations are made as business needs evolve
• Loads, unloads, inspects, and tallies tires to and from transport vehicles (trailer trucks/box trucks/delivery vans).
• Follows TireHub safety standards with respect to selecting, packing, counting, labeling, and palletizing customer orders and position them in designated locations using the bin locator system.
• Operates equipment such as forklifts, order pickers and pallet jacks, ensuring adherence to safety protocols.
• Conducts and participates in cycle counts, tallies, and labeling as part of regularly scheduled and annual inventory control procedures.
• Collecting payments from customers on Cash on Delivery (COD) transactions.
• Ensures vehicles remain clean and in good mechanical/physical condition.
• Conducts pre/post-trip vehicle inspections daily and immediately report any operational issues or mechanical defects to the supervisor or designated person.
• Completes all the necessary driver and vehicle maintenance logs, on a regular basis.
• Ensure compliance with all TireHub policies and procedures.
• Participates and maintains ongoing training through in-class, in-person, or computer-based learning modules, as assigned.
• Completes other tasks assigned by their Supervisor or another member of leadership.

Competencies:
• Optimizes Work Processes: Knowing the most effective and efficient processes to get things done, with a focus on continuous improvement.
• Manages Ambiguity: Operating effectively, even when things are not certain, or the way forward is not clear.
• Drives Results: Consistently achieving results, even under tough circumstances.
• Collaborates: Building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives.
• Communicates Effectively: Delivers communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences.

For this role, you will need:
• At least 1 year of general work experience.
• Must have a valid driver’s license.
• Must have a mimimum of 2 years of driving history, with a valid driver's license (does not include driver's permit).
• Must be 19 years old or older.

· Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
• Excellent communication and customer service skills.
• Repeatedly lift, pull, push and/or move tires (up to 50lbs) with or without mechanical assistance.
• Capable of frequent bending, twisting and lifting.
• Multitask in a fast-paced environment.
• Accurately and efficiently load, unload and place tires in warehouse and delivery vehicles.
• Work up to 35 feet above ground-level.
• Work up to 8 hours per day on a forklift.
• Follow traffic rules and regulations by safely driving TireHub vehicles to deliver tires to customer locations.
• Work independently and as part of a team.
• Familiarity with Manifest, GPS and Navigation systems.
• Must be able to maintain a forklift certification.
• Must be able to maintain a valid driver’s license.

Working Conditions

· Required to lift, pull, push, and/or move tires (up to 50 lbs. or greater with or without mechanical assistance following standard operating and safety procedures. Other physical requirements including, regularly being required to stand, walk, kneel, bend, crawl, climb and balance.

· Maybe required to handle hazardous materials and wear various forms of protective equipment (gloves, protective eyewear, etc.).

· Specific vision requirements may include close, distance, color, peripheral visions, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.

· Works and operate equipment in various settings, ranging from non-climate-controlled warehouses to customer locations.

· Extended day, evening, and weekend work (including Saturday) may be required as job duties demand and may include little to no advanced notice.

· Driving during the night or in inclement weather may be required.

· Must not exceed 400 pounds in weight or 6 feet 3 inches in height, to meet physical compatibility with equipment and safety restraints. (These limitations are based on equipment specifications and the need to ensure safe operation; any reasonable accommodations will be reviewed in accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) and other relevant laws).

This position also offers up to $1,500 signing bonus payable in two installments.

description_final: En Tirehub nos movemos más que los neumáticos, avanzamos a las empresas, apoyamos a las comunidades y ayudamos a mantener a Estados Unidos enrollando. ¿Y detrás de todo? Nuestra gente. Los llamamos Hubbers porque están en el centro de todo lo que hacemos. Desde detrás del volante hasta el piso del almacén, desde las llamadas de los clientes hasta la estrategia corporativa, cada esposo juega un papel en algo más grande que ellos. Y aparecemos todos los días listos para decir que sí a los desafíos, el uno al otro, y a hacerlo bien. El papel principal del especialista en logística (LS) implica la carga y descarga de neumáticos para el almacenamiento de almacén y/o la entrega oportuna del cliente, incluida la descarga y la puesta en escena de productos en la ubicación comercial del cliente. Se espera que el LS represente a Tirehub profesionalmente en toda la interacción del cliente y mantenga prácticas de conducción seguras, todo mientras ofrece un servicio al cliente excepcional y fomenta fuertes relaciones con los clientes. Cuando dice sí a algo más grande: salario inicial de $ 19. 50 horas, con progresión salarial aplicable después de 90 días, 180 días y 1 año de tenencia con Tirehub. De lunes a sábado, fluctuando el día de turnos de turnos RESUMEN: Pagado semanalmente los viernes elige sus beneficios, que incluyen una opción de seguro de salud sin costo, cuenta de ahorro de salud financiada por Tirehub Opciones de beneficios adicionales que incluyen Tirehub pagado a corto/a largo plazo, los beneficios de seguro de vida pagan vacaciones y vacaciones pagadas más su cumpleaños. ¡Los programas de licencia de los padres construyen su futuro financiero con 401k, incluido el acceso al programa de uniformes de uniformes de Tirehub a descuentos en neumáticos, ventajas y mucho más! Este puesto informa a un líder asistente de TLC. El individuo debe exhibir los siguientes compromisos centrales de Tirehub: accesible: si una empresa pudiera sonreír, lo haríamos. En cambio, confiamos en nuestra gente para mostrarlo. Nos preocupamos el uno por el otro y nuestros clientes porque sabemos que los negocios solo se hacen bien cuando las personas se respetan entre sí y valoran las relaciones. Aventoso: lo que Tirehub está configurado para hacer es intencionalmente escandaloso. Por lo tanto, adoptamos fácilmente los desafíos con el coraje de introducir nuevas ideas y la ambición de construir algo único. Implente: abordamos nuestro trabajo con energía. Entregamos nuestros compromisos con entusiasmo. Y no nos rendimos hasta que llegamos al final. Speedy: la velocidad es la moneda en la industria de los neumáticos. Cuando nos comprometemos con un trabajo, hacemos el trabajo y lo hacemos rápido. Roles y responsabilidades: responsable de la distribución de tareas que incluyen: Servicios de entrega generales de entrega Los ajustes de mantenimiento del vehículo a estas asignaciones se realizan a medida que las necesidades comerciales evolucionan las cargas, las descargas, las inspecciones y los neumáticos de los vehículos de transporte (camiones de remolques/camiones de box/camionetas de entrega). Sigue los estándares de seguridad de Tirehub con respecto a la selección, el embalaje, el conteo, el etiquetado y la paletización de los pedidos de los clientes y colocarlos en ubicaciones designadas utilizando el sistema de localización de Bin. Opera equipos como carretillas elevadoras, recolectores de pedidos y gatos de paletas, asegurando la adherencia a los protocolos de seguridad. Realiza y participa en los recuentos de ciclo, los titulares y el etiquetado como parte de los procedimientos de control de inventario anuales y programados regularmente. Recopilar pagos de los clientes en efectivo en transacciones de entrega (COD). Asegura que los vehículos permanezcan limpios y en buenas condiciones mecánicas/físicas. Realiza diariamente las inspecciones de vehículos previos/posteriores al viaje e informa inmediatamente cualquier problema operativo o defecto mecánico al supervisor o la persona designada. Completa todos los registros de mantenimiento del conductor y del vehículo necesarios, de forma regular. Asegure el cumplimiento de todas las políticas y procedimientos de Tirehub. Participa y mantiene la capacitación continua a través de módulos de aprendizaje en clase, en persona o basados ​​en computadora, según lo asignado. Completa otras tareas asignadas por su supervisor u otro miembro del liderazgo. Competencias: optimiza los procesos de trabajo: Conocer los procesos más efectivos y eficientes para hacer las cosas, con un enfoque en la mejora continua. Administra la ambigüedad: operar de manera efectiva, incluso cuando las cosas no son ciertas, o el camino a seguir no está claro. Resultados de conducción: logre constantemente los resultados, incluso en circunstancias difíciles. Colabora: construir asociaciones y trabajar en colaboración con otros para cumplir con los objetivos compartidos. Se comunica de manera efectiva: ofrece comunicaciones que transmiten una comprensión clara de las necesidades únicas de diferentes audiencias. Para este papel, necesitará: al menos 1 año de experiencia laboral general. Debe tener una licencia de conducir válida. Debe tener un Mimimum de 2 años de historial de manejo, con una licencia de conducir válida (no incluye el permiso de conducir). Debe tener 19 años o más. Conocimiento, habilidades y habilidades requeridas: excelentes habilidades de comunicación y servicio al cliente. Levante repetidamente, tire, empuje y/o mueva neumáticos (hasta 50 libras) con o sin asistencia mecánica. Capaz de flexión frecuente, torcer y levantar. Multitarea en un entorno de ritmo rápido. Cargue, descargue y coloque de manera precisa y eficiente los neumáticos en el almacén y los vehículos de entrega. Trabaje hasta 35 pies sobre el nivel del suelo. Trabaje hasta 8 horas por día en una carretilla elevadora. Siga las reglas y regulaciones de tráfico impulsando los vehículos Tirehub de forma segura para entregar neumáticos a las ubicaciones de los clientes. Trabaja de forma independiente y como parte de un equipo. Familiaridad con los sistemas de manifiesto, GPS y navegación. Debe poder mantener una certificación de montacargas. Debe poder mantener una licencia de conducir válida. Condiciones de trabajo requeridas para levantar, tirar, empujar y/o mover neumáticos (hasta 50 libras. O más con o sin asistencia mecánica después de procedimientos de operación y seguridad estándar. Otros requisitos físicos que incluyen, requeridos regularmente para pararse, caminar, rodear, doblar, arrastrar, escalar y equilibrar. Percepción y capacidad para ajustar el enfoque y el equipo de operación en varios entornos, desde los almacenes no climados hasta las ubicaciones de los clientes, puede ser necesario que el trabajo de fin de semana (incluido el sábado) se requerirá como la demanda de trabajo y los 6 pies, de 6 pies, y no se deben tener un aviso. (Estas limitaciones se basan en las especificaciones del equipo y la necesidad de garantizar una operación segura; cualquier adaptación razonable se revisará de acuerdo con la Ley de Americanos con Discapacidades (ADA) y otras leyes relevantes).

description:
Carrier is a leading provider of HVAC, refrigeration, fire, security, and building automation technologies. These high-technology products and services enable modern life by delivering efficiency, safety, and security across several platforms. Enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.

UTEC, Inc. is seeking a Global Purchasing Material Planner to work in its facility located in downtown Fort Wayne for the Control Box Division. The Control Box Division produces control boxes that are used in small, medium, and large roof top units along with refrigeration and HVAC markets.

Our Global Purchasing Material Planners are the drivers behind our continued growth and success. With our commitment to innovation, it’s our material planners who seek out, develop, and help implement strategic initiatives for improved efficiency and productivity. We’re currently searching for an experienced Global Purchasing Material Planner to help guide our organization into the future. Our ideal candidate is a detail-oriented planner, motivated problem solver, expert communicator, and top-notch MRP analyst.

Key Responsibilities:
• Partner with other stakeholder teams across business units (i.e., sales, scheduling, production, customer service, quality, expeditors, global sourcing, finance, shipping/receiving, and engineering to develop necessary analysis and documentation in a collaborative way, communicating effectively and efficiently with each team.
• Manage the supply chain for assigned commodities. The employee will plan, analyze, procure, and expedite components utilizing accurate purchase order/schedule agreement placement to meet sales demands, monitor and maintain acceptable inventory levels, and achieve on-time deliveries to meet our customer's production schedules.
• Analyze the MRP for inventory control to ensure material arrives on time for production while not exceeding monthly inventory dollar goal initiatives, including but not limited to running specialized reports to manage inventory.
• Analyze the SAP system daily to ensure our goal of 100% supplier on-time-delivery is met through sending open order reports to the suppliers and meeting weekly with to confirm orders will arrive on time, as well as demonstrate the ability to use business judgment to resolve problems to get to root cause analysis.
• The Global Purchasing Material Planner will work closely with the Engineering and Product Management departments involving New Product Introductions and ECN’s including but not limited to; issuing RFQ’s to suppliers, material master set up, determining obsolescence, and providing delivery status details of new materials to ensure new product launch dates are met.
• The Global Purchasing Material Planner will resolve daily Accounts Payable rejections to ensure on time payments to suppliers.
• The Global Purchasing Material Planner will work closely with the Quality Department on supplier quality issues and ensure defective material is returned to the supplier for credit.
• Assist management for assigned projects as needed.

Required Qualifications:
• Associate’s Degree
• 5+ years’ experience as a Buyer/Materials Planner with Accounts Payable resolution experience.

Preferred Qualifications:
• SAP experience preferred, but not required
• Accounts Payable invoice resolution experience required
• Expert knowledge of MRP
• Problem solving skills
• Strong communication skills
• Must have attention to detail, be very organized, and thrive in a fast-paced work environment
• Must possess a strong work ethic, ability to overcome challenges, and a willingness to learn new systems
• Must be self-motivated and focused on results
• Must have strong inventory management skills
• Moderate to expert skill with Microsoft Office, specifically Microsoft Excel V Lookups and Pivot tables
• Ability to work in a team environment as well as work independently.
• Must be able to read and interpret drawings

#LI-Onsite

RSRCAR
