description_final: Carrier es un proveedor líder de tecnologías HVAC, refrigeración, incendios, seguridad y automatización de edificios. Estos productos y servicios de alta tecnología permiten la vida moderna al ofrecer eficiencia, seguridad y seguridad en varias plataformas. Permitir a las personas calificadas con discapacidades para realizar funciones esenciales. UTEC, Inc. está buscando un planificador de material de compra global para trabajar en sus instalaciones ubicadas en el centro de Fort Wayne para la división de caja de control. La división de caja de control produce cajas de control que se utilizan en unidades de techo pequeñas, medianas y grandes junto con la refrigeración y los mercados de HVAC. Nuestros planificadores de materiales de compra globales son los impulsores detrás de nuestro continuo crecimiento y éxito. Con nuestro compromiso con la innovación, son nuestros planificadores de materiales quienes buscan, desarrollan y ayudan a implementar iniciativas estratégicas para mejorar la eficiencia y la productividad. Actualmente estamos buscando un planificador de materiales de compra global experimentado para ayudar a guiar a nuestra organización hacia el futuro. Nuestro candidato ideal es un planificador orientado a los detalles, solucionador de problemas motivado, comunicador experto y analista de MRP de primer nivel. Responsabilidades clave: asociarse con otros equipos de partes interesadas en las unidades de negocios (es decir, ventas, programación, producción, servicio al cliente, calidad, expedentes, abastecimiento global, finanzas, envío/recepción e ingeniería para desarrollar el análisis y la documentación necesarios de manera colaborativa, comunicar de manera efectiva y eficiente con cada equipo. Administrar la cadena de suministro para las Comodidades Asignadas. La colocación del acuerdo de pedido/programa para satisfacer las demandas de ventas, monitorear y mantener los niveles de inventario aceptables, y lograr entregas a tiempo para cumplir con los horarios de producción de nuestros clientes. Los proveedores y la reunión semanal con los pedidos de confirmación llegarán a tiempo, así como para demostrar la capacidad de usar el juicio comercial para resolver problemas para llegar al análisis de la causa raíz. El planificador de materiales de compra resolverá los rechazos de las cuentas diarias para garantizar los pagos de tiempo a los proveedores. La experiencia de resolución de la factura de cuentas por pagar requerida el conocimiento experto de las habilidades de resolución de problemas de MRP Las habilidades de comunicación sólidas deben tener atención al detalle, estar muy organizados y prosperar en un entorno laboral de ritmo rápido deben poseer una fuerte ética de trabajo, la capacidad de superar los desafíos, y la voluntad de los nuevos sistemas debe ser auto motivado y centrarse en los resultados de los resultados de los resultados de la gestión fuertes con la habilidad de los especificaciones especificadas, los especificaciones de la especificación de los microsoftaciones de la creación de los reflejados de los resultados. Trabajar en un entorno de equipo y trabajar de forma independiente.

description:
Description:

Summary Process parts and products throughout the manufacturing floor to meet

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Load and unload materials in manufacturing from warehouse and outside suppliers.

Organize and verify materials against invoices and job requirements to ensure accuracy of deliveries.

Organize any documentation for deliveries/job requirements.

Facilitate the inter-departmental transfer of parts using pallet jacks, forklifts, and dollies.

Maintain clean and safe work area.

Responsible for traceability, inventory control, and all associated paperwork and record keeping.

Adhere to all departmental and company-wide safety and procedural policies.

Notify supervisor of any quality or production problems.

Perform cycle counts to ensure inventory accuracy.

Supervisory Responsibilities

This job has no supervisory responsibilities.

Competencies

To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies:

Problem Solving – Identifies problems and addresses with manager in a timely manner.

Technical Skills – Pursues training and development opportunities; Strives to continuously build knowledge and skills.

Customer Service – Responds promptly to customer needs; Responds to requests for service and assistance; Meets commitments.

Interpersonal Skills – Focuses on solving conflict, not blaming; Maintains confidentiality; Listens to others without interrupting; Keeps emotions under control; Remains open to others’ ideas.

Oral Communication – Speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations; Communicates need for clarification; Responds well to questions; Participates in meetings.

Written Communication – Writes clearly and informatively; Edits work for spelling and grammar; Presents numerical data effectively; Able to read and interpret written information.

Teamwork – Balances team and individual responsibilities; Exhibits objectivity and openness to others’ views; Contributes to building a positive team spirit; Puts success of team above own interests; Supports everyone’s efforts to succeed.

Cost Consciousness – Conserves organizational resources; Actively seeks cost control in material utilization, overtime efficiencies, and inventory control.

Diversity – Shows respect and sensitivity for cultural differences; Educates others on the value of diversity; Promotes a harassment-free environment.

Ethics – Treats people with respect; Keeps commitments; Inspires the trust of others; Works with integrity and ethics; Upholds organizational values.

Organizational Support – Follows policies and procedures; Completes administrative tasks correctly and on time; Supports organization’s goals and values; Supports affirmative action and respects diversity.

Judgment – Displays willingness to make decisions; Exhibits sound and accurate judgment; Supports and explains reasoning for decisions; Includes appropriate personnel in decision-making process; Makes timely decisions.

Motivation – Sets and achieves challenging goals; Demonstrates persistence and overcomes obstacles; Measures self against standard of excellence; Takes calculated risks to accomplish goals.

Planning/Organizing – Prioritizes and plans work activities; Uses time efficiently.

Professionalism – Approaches others in tactful manner; Reacts well under pressure; Accepts responsibility for own actions; Follows through on commitments.

Quality – Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness; Monitors own work to ensure quality.

Quantity – Completes work in a timely manner.

Safety and Security – Observes safety and security procedures; Determines appropriate action beyond guidelines; Reports potentially unsafe conditions; Uses equipment and material properly.

Adaptability – Adapts to changes in the work environment; Able to deal with frequent change, delays, or unexpected events.

Attendance/Punctuality – Consistently at work and on time; Arrives at meetings and appointments on time.

Dependability – Follows instructions; responds to management direction; Takes responsibility for own actions; Completes tasks on time or notifies appropriate personnel with an alternate plan.

Initiative – Undertakes self-development activities; Asks for and offers help when needed.

Innovation – Displays original thinking and creativity; Meets challenges with resourcefulness; Generates suggestions for improving work.
Requirements:

Qualifications

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Education and/or Experience

High school diploma or equivalent.

Language Skills

Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence.

Mathematical Skills

Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals.

Reasoning Ability

Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions in written, oral, or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.

Computer Skills

To perform this job successfully, an individual should have knowledge of Database software; Internet software; Spreadsheet software and Word Processing software.

Certificates, Licenses, Registrations

Certified Forklift Operator preferred within 90 days.

Other Skills and Abilities

None. May be required at any time with reasonable notice and timeline for completion.

Other Qualifications

None. May be required at any time with reasonable notice and timeline for completion.

Physical Demands

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to walk; talk; hear; use hands to finger, handle, or feel. The employee may occasionally be required to sit. The employee must also be able to stand in one position and move their body, from the waist up, for the shift consistently. The employee is frequently required to stand and reach with hands and arms. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 40 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include color vision, close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.

Work Environment

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently exposed to moving mechanical parts. The employee is occasionally exposed to wet and/or humid conditions and outside weather conditions. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

La calidad demuestra precisión y minuciosidad; Monitorea el trabajo propio para garantizar la calidad. La cantidad completa el trabajo de manera oportuna. La seguridad observa procedimientos de seguridad; Determina la acción apropiada más allá de las pautas; Informes de condiciones potencialmente inseguras; Utiliza equipos y material correctamente. La adaptabilidad se adapta a los cambios en el entorno de trabajo; Capaz de lidiar con cambios frecuentes, retrasos o eventos inesperados. Asistencia/puntualidad constantemente en el trabajo y a tiempo; Llega a las reuniones y citas a tiempo. La fiabilidad sigue las instrucciones; responde a la dirección de gestión; Asume la responsabilidad de propias acciones; Completa las tareas a tiempo o notifica al personal apropiado con un plan alternativo. La iniciativa realiza actividades de autodesarrollo; Pide y ofrece ayuda cuando sea necesario. La innovación muestra pensamiento original y creatividad; Enfrenta desafíos con el ingenio; Genera sugerencias para mejorar el trabajo. Requisitos: Calificaciones para realizar este trabajo con éxito, un individuo debe poder cumplir con cada deber esencial satisfactoriamente. Los requisitos que se enumeran a continuación son representativos del conocimiento, la habilidad y/o la capacidad requeridos. Se pueden hacer adaptaciones razonables para permitir que las personas con discapacidades realicen las funciones esenciales. Educación y/o experiencia Diploma de escuela secundaria o equivalente. Habilidades del lenguaje Capacidad para leer e interpretar documentos como reglas de seguridad, instrucciones de operación y mantenimiento, y manuales de procedimientos. Capacidad para escribir informes de rutina y correspondencia. Capacidad de habilidades matemáticas para sumar, restar, multiplicar y dividir en todas las unidades de medida, utilizando números enteros, fracciones comunes y decimales. Capacidad de razonamiento Capacidad para aplicar la comprensión del sentido común para llevar a cabo instrucciones en forma escrita, oral o diagrama. Capacidad para lidiar con problemas que involucran varias variables concretas en situaciones estandarizadas. Habilidades informáticas Para realizar este trabajo con éxito, un individuo debe tener conocimiento del software de la base de datos; Software de Internet; Software de hoja de cálculo y software de procesamiento de textos. Certificados, licencias, registros operador de montacargas certificado preferido dentro de los 90 días. Otras habilidades y habilidades ninguna. Puede ser requerido en cualquier momento con notificación razonable y cronograma para su finalización. Otras calificaciones ninguna. Puede ser requerido en cualquier momento con notificación razonable y cronograma para su finalización. Demandas físicas Las demandas físicas descritas aquí son representativas de aquellos que un empleado debe satisfacer con éxito las funciones esenciales de este trabajo. Se pueden hacer adaptaciones razonables para permitir que las personas con discapacidades realicen las funciones esenciales. Mientras realiza las tareas de este trabajo, se requiere regularmente al empleado para caminar; hablar; escuchar; Usa las manos para el dedo, manejar o sentir. El empleado ocasionalmente se le puede requerir que se siente. El empleado también debe poder pararse en una posición y mover su cuerpo, desde la cintura hacia arriba, para el cambio de manera consistente. Con frecuencia se requiere al empleado para pararse y alcanzar las manos y los brazos. El empleado debe levantar con frecuencia y/o moverse hasta 40 libras. Las habilidades de visión específicas requeridas por este trabajo incluyen visión de color, visión cercana, visión de distancia, visión periférica, percepción de profundidad y capacidad para ajustar el enfoque. Entorno de trabajo Las características del entorno de trabajo descritas aquí son representativas de aquellos que un empleado encuentra mientras realiza las funciones esenciales de este trabajo. Se pueden hacer adaptaciones razonables para permitir que las personas con discapacidades realicen las funciones esenciales. Mientras realiza las tareas de este trabajo, el empleado se expone con frecuencia a las piezas mecánicas en movimiento. El empleado ocasionalmente está expuesto a condiciones húmedas y/o húmedas y condiciones climáticas externas. El nivel de ruido en el entorno de trabajo suele ser moderado.

description:
Why Oatey?

Since 1916, Oatey has provided reliable, high-quality products for the residential and commercial plumbing industries, with a commitment to delivering quality, building trust and improving lives. Today, Oatey operates a comprehensive manufacturing and distribution network comprised of industry leading family of companies: Oatey, Cherne, Keeney, Quick Drain, Hercules, Dearborn, GF Thompson, William H. Harvey, Masters, Contact, Belanger, Lansas, and Durgo.

At Oatey, we're doing big things — and by joining us, you'll have the chance to do big things too. You can build a strong career in an innovative, inclusive, high-performance environment, with the confidence that your company cares — about you, our customers and our world. Ready to make an impact in a place where you matter?

Cleveland Distribution

Because our business is growing, we need to hire top talent. We're hoping you're that future team member!

Cleveland Distribution is a team atmosphere and a commitment to safety and quality.

3rd shift schedule is as follows: Sunday - Thursday 10pm - 6:30am.

Position Summary:

Accurately processes all customer and replenishment orders in a manner to ensure safety, quality and performance goals are met on a daily basis.

Position Responsibilities:
• Pull raw material request orders for delivery to specified work centers in production and properly scan in RF device; supply required consumables to production areas and handle disposal of some waste from the production floor, i.e., bad pallets, recyclables, etc.
• Return material to the raw warehouse and consolidate into existing bays where possible upon put away and properly scan in RF device
• Follow all safety procedures, including safety startup checklists at the beginning of the shift for powered industrial vehicles, notifying the team leader/supervisor of any equipment problems immediately, wearing all required PPE, participating in 6S events, and maintaining good housekeeping and execution of standard work
• Report any scrap, damaged product, or quality problems to the team leader/supervisor immediately
• Establish and maintain effective working relationships with co-workers by willingness to take on additional responsibility and/or support as assigned

Knowledge and Experience:
• One to four (1-4) years of experience in a warehouse setting
• Good communication skills, English fluency, both verbal and written
• Forklift operator authorization required and demonstrated ability in safe equipment operation, including elevated locations (heights)
• Must be able to comply with manufacturer’s weight limit to wear required safety tether for picking at elevated locations
• Demonstrated ability in proper freight handling. Working knowledge of all hazardous shipping rules and regulations
• Willingness to work and to follow instructions
• Reading ability sufficient to identify labels and understand written documentation
• Cooperative attitude toward co-workers and supervisors.
• Willingness to partner, collaborate with teammates, and take on additional duties and projects as needed
• Skills in operating a forklift, reach truck, and order picker are preferred, but not required (applicant will be required to complete the company powered industrial truck certification training and operate an order picker within first 3 months)

Education and Certification:
• High school diploma or equivalent required

At Oatey we are committed to help our Associates grow their career. Apply today and grow with Oatey!

Oatey Total Rewards
• Generous paid time off programs and paid company holidays to support flexibility and work-life balance
• Annual Discretionary Cash Profit Sharing
• 401(k) with competitive company match
• Market leading health insurance including medical, dental, vision, and life insurance offerings for associates and qualified dependents
• Significant company contribution to Health Savings Account with a High Deductible Health Plan (HDHP)
• Short-Term and Long-Term Disability income protection coverage at no cost to associates
• Paid Maternity and Paid Parental Leave
• Tuition reimbursement
• A robust suite of complementary benefits to support associate well being

Equal Opportunity Employer

The Oatey family of companies are an equal opportunity employer committed to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion. We recruit, employ, promote, and offer competitive pay for all jobs without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by law.
skills: Uno a cuatro (1-4) años de experiencia en un entorno, Buenas habilidades de comunicación, fluidez en inglés, tanto verbal como escrita, Autorización del operador de montacargas requerida y capacidad demostrada en la operación de equipo seguro, incluidas ubicaciones elevadas (alturas), Debe poder cumplir con el límite de peso del fabricante para el uso de la conexión de seguridad requerida para recoger en ubicaciones elevadas, Habilidad demostrada en el manejo adecuado de la carga, Conocimiento práctico de todas las reglas y regulaciones de envío peligroso, Disposición a trabajar y seguir instrucciones, Capacidad de lectura suficiente para identificar etiquetas y comprender la documentación escrita, Se requiere diploma de escuela secundaria o equivalente, Procesos con precisión todos los pedidos de clientes y reposición de una manera para garantizar que los objetivos de seguridad, calidad y rendimiento se cumplan a diario, Extraer órdenes de solicitud de materia prima para su entrega a centros de trabajo especificados en producción y escanear adecuadamente en el dispositivo RF; El suministro requería consumibles a las áreas de producción y manejar la eliminación de algunos desechos del piso de producción, es decir, paletas malos, reciclables, etc., Devuelva el material al almacén en bruto y consoliden en las bahías existentes cuando sea posible al guardar y escanear correctamente en el dispositivo RF, Siga todos los procedimientos de seguridad, incluidas las listas de verificación de inicio de seguridad al comienzo del turno de vehículos industriales con alimentación, notificando al líder/supervisor del equipo de cualquier problema de equipo de inmediato, usando todo el PPE requerido, participando en eventos 6S y manteniendo una buena limpieza y ejecución de trabajo estándar, Informe cualquier problema de chatarra, producto dañado o calidad al líder/supervisor del equipo inmediatamente, Establecer y mantener relaciones de trabajo efectivas con los compañeros de trabajo mediante la voluntad de asumir responsabilidad y/o apoyo adicionales según lo asignado, Actitud cooperativa hacia los compañeros de trabajo y supervisores, Disposición para asociarse, colaborar con compañeros de equipo y asumir tareas y proyectos adicionales según sea necesario

description:
POSITION SUMMARY
U.S. AutoForce, a division of U.S. Venture, Inc., brings together more than 100 years of experience as an industry leader in the distribution of tires, undercar parts, and lubricants to independent tire retailers, auto repair shops, and automotive dealerships.

The schedule for this position is Sunday 11:00am-7:30pm, Monday-Thursday 3-11:30pm. Schedules are subject to change based on business needs and may require overtime.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
• Load, unload, stock tires and auto parts in a fast-paced warehouse environment using industrial vehicles such as a forklift or picker equipment
• Use scanners to find and put away tires and assist with inventory control
• You can expect to lift 50 pounds consistently throughout your shift and occasionally lift up to 80 pounds. When lifting commercial tires you will do team lifts or use mechanical equipment.
• When working with barrels or industrial/agricultural tires you will need to be able to exert a pushing force of up to 40 pounds
• Some of our stock racks are 25 feet tall, so you must be comfortable working at those heights safely while operating equipment.
• Be on the move. You should be willing and able to work on your feet for extended periods of time and work overtime as needed
• Contribute to our culture of safety, ensuring adherence to all safety policies and operating procedures.
• May assist other departments, such as ecomm, inventory, and will call depending on business needs
• The duties listed in this job description are not exhaustive. Team members may be asked to perform other job-related tasks and follow any job-related instructions given by their supervisor, subject to reasonable accommodations

OUR BENEFITS
• Highly competitive wages starting at $22.00/hour!
• Weekly pay
• Work boot reimbursement program
• Healthcare benefits, available your first day on the job
• 401(k) with Generous Employer Contribution AND Match
• Paid Vacation, Sick time and Holidays
• On-the-job training and skill development
• Tuition Reimbursement
• Employee Discount Programs

Physical Demands and Work Environment

Physical demands: While performing the duties of this job, the employee must be qualified as to visual, auditory, physical, and mental ability to operate equipment safely with or without reasonable accommodation. The employee must frequently lift products weighing up to approximately 50 pounds, and occasionally up to 80 pounds. Occasionally exert a pushing force up to 40 pounds. Handling of commercial tires (e.g., rolling, destacking, team lifting) conduct team lifts or use mechanical equipment.
Protective equipment required: steel or composite toe boots, safety vest, safety harness , seatbelt, SRL (self-retracting lifeline). All equipment is provided by U.S. AutoForce except for steel / composite toe boots. All team members must be able to adhere with safety and manufacture guidelines for compliant use of all protective equipment.
Work environment: While performing the duties of this job, the employee may be exposed to weather conditions prevalent at the time. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. Fumes associated with tires and occasionally car parts and lubricants prevalent.

QUALIFICATIONS
• Must be 18 years or older to operate equipment
• 1 year of warehouse/logistics or relevant experience
• Ability to safely lift 50 pounds consistently and occasionally lift up to 80 pounds
• Ability to exert a pushing force of up to 40 pounds - working with barrels and industrial/agricultural tires
• Ability to work at heights of 25 feet while operating equipment and maintaining safety standards
• Abide by all Company safety policies and state and federal transportation regulations and manufacturing guidelines
• Ability to pass forklift certification
• Willing to work overtime as needed
• Ability to follow instructions and safe operating procedures
• Ability to work in a team environment
• Successfully pass a pre-employment drug test (do not test for THC / marijuana)

DIVISION:
U.S. AutoForce

U.S. Venture requires that a team member have and maintain authorization to work in the country in which the role is based. In general, U.S. Venture does not sponsor candidates for nonimmigrant visas or permanent residency unless based on business need.

U.S. Venture will not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of an executed recruitment Master Service Agreement, there will be no obligation to any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without an agreement, U.S. Venture shall reserve the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, shall be deemed the property of U.S. Venture.

U.S. Venture, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or other protected characteristic. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may call Human Resources at (920) 739-6101.

description_final: El resumen de la posición de U. S. Autoforce, una división de U. S. Venture, Inc. , reúne más de 100 años de experiencia como líder de la industria en la distribución de neumáticos, piezas subterráneas y lubricantes a minoristas independientes de neumáticos, talleres de reparación de automóviles y concesionarios automotrices. El horario para este puesto es el domingo 11:00 a. m. a 7:30 p. m. , de lunes a jueves 3-11: 30pm. Los horarios están sujetos a cambios basados ​​en las necesidades comerciales y pueden requerir horas extras. Responsabilidades laborales Carga, descarga, neumáticos de stock y autopartes en un entorno de almacén de ritmo rápido utilizando vehículos industriales, como un elevador o equipos de recolectores, usan escáneres para encontrar y guardar neumáticos y ayudar con el control de inventario, puede esperar levantar 50 libras de manera consistente durante todo su turno y ocasionalmente levantar hasta 80 libras. Al levantar los neumáticos comerciales, hará ascensores en equipo o usará equipos mecánicos. Cuando trabaje con barriles o neumáticos industriales/agrícolas, deberá poder ejercer una fuerza de empuje de hasta 40 libras, algunos de nuestros bastidores de stock tienen 25 pies de altura, por lo que debe sentirse cómodo trabajando a esas alturas de manera segura mientras operan equipos. Estar en movimiento. Debe estar dispuesto y capaz de trabajar en sus pies durante períodos prolongados de tiempo y trabajar horas extras, según sea necesario, contribuya a nuestra cultura de seguridad, asegurando el cumplimiento de todas las políticas de seguridad y los procedimientos operativos. Puede ayudar a otros departamentos, como el comercio electrónico, el inventario, y llamarán dependiendo de las necesidades comerciales que las tareas enumeradas en esta descripción del trabajo no son exhaustivas. Se puede pedir a los miembros del equipo que realicen otras tareas relacionadas con el trabajo y sigan cualquier instrucción relacionada con el trabajo dadas por su supervisor, sujeto a alojamientos razonables, ¡nuestros beneficios salarios altamente competitivos a partir de $ 22. 00/hora! Programa de reembolso de Boot de trabajo de pago semanal Beneficios de salud, disponible su primer día en el trabajo 401 (k) con una generosa contribución del empleador y coincidir con vacaciones pagadas, tiempo de enfermedad y vacaciones en el trabajo de capacitación y desarrollo de habilidad alojamiento. El empleado debe levantar frecuentemente productos que pesen hasta aproximadamente 50 libras, y ocasionalmente hasta 80 libras. Ocasionalmente ejerce una fuerza de empuje hasta 40 libras. Manejo de neumáticos comerciales (por ejemplo, rodamiento, destacado, levantamiento del equipo) realiza ascensores del equipo o usa equipos mecánicos. Equipo de protección requerido: botas de acero o punta compuesta, chaleco de seguridad, arnés de seguridad, cinturón de seguridad, SRL (línea de vida auto-retractante). Todo el equipo es proporcionado por la autoforce de EE. UU. Excepto las botas de acero / punta compuesta. Todos los miembros del equipo deben poder adherirse a las pautas de seguridad y fabricar para el uso de todos los equipos de protección. Entorno de trabajo: mientras realiza las tareas de este trabajo, el empleado puede estar expuesto a condiciones climáticas que prevalecen en ese momento. El nivel de ruido en el entorno de trabajo suele ser moderado. Humos asociados con neumáticos y ocasionalmente piezas de automóviles y lubricantes prevalentes. Las calificaciones deben ser mayores de 18 años para operar equipos 1 año de almacén/logística o capacidad de experiencia relevante para levantar de manera segura 50 libras de manera consistente y ocasionalmente elevar hasta 80 libras de capacidad para ejercer una fuerza de empuje de hasta 40 libras, trabajando con barriles y neumáticos industriales/agrícolas, la capacidad de trabajar a las alturas de 25 pies mientras los equipos operativos y los estándares de seguridad tienen todas las políticas de seguridad de la compañía y las políticas de transporte federal y federales. La certificación de la carretilla elevadora dispuesta a trabajar horas extras como necesaria la capacidad de seguir instrucciones y procedimientos operativos seguros para trabajar en un entorno de equipo aprobar con éxito una prueba de drogas previa al empleo (no pruebe la división de THC / marihuana): la empresa de Estados Unidos de la Autoforce de los Estados Unidos requiere que un miembro del equipo tenga y mantenga la autorización para trabajar en el país en el que se basa el papel. En general, US Venture no patrocina candidatos para visas no inmigrantes o residencia permanente a menos que se basen en la necesidad comercial. La empresa de EE. UU. No aceptará currículums no solicitados de reclutadores o agencias de empleo. En ausencia de un acuerdo de servicio maestro de reclutamiento ejecutado, no habrá obligación con ninguna compensación de referencia o tarifa de reclutador. En el caso de que un reclutador o agencia presente un currículum o candidato sin un acuerdo, la empresa de EE. UU. Se reservará el derecho de perseguir y contratar a esos candidatos sin ninguna obligación financiera con el reclutador o agencia. Cualquier currículums no solicitado, incluidos los presentados a los gerentes de contratación, se considerará propiedad de la empresa de EE. UU. U. S. Venture, Inc. es un empleador de igualdad de oportunidades comprometido con la inclusión y la diversidad. Aseguramos la igualdad de oportunidades para todos los solicitantes sin tener en cuenta la raza, el color, la religión, el sexo, la orientación sexual, el género, la identidad o expresión de género, el estado civil, la edad, el origen nacional, la discapacidad, el estado veterano, la información genética u otra característica protegida. Si necesita ayuda o un alojamiento debido a una discapacidad, puede llamar a los recursos humanos al (920) 739-6101.

description:
Description
Description

Summary: The main areas of responsibility will include working with supervision and management to ensure quality conformance, inventory accuracy and customer satisfaction. The Material Handler reports to the Materials Supervisor.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following; others may be assigned:

· Maintain inventory accuracy through consistency, security, cycle counting and various audits

· Shipping domestic and international

· Advanced M3 transactions and research

· Perform other inventory management responsibilities as assigned

· Ability to prioritize work based on business need

· Must carefully and safely handle raw material and manufactured parts to ensure the integrity and quality is not compromised by handling.

· All employees have an affirmative duty to protect and maintain the confidentiality of all company products.

· As business conditions change it is necessary that all employees productively react and handle other essential tasks as assigned now or in the future.

· Tasks may vary slightly based on products produced at division.

§ This is a safety sensitive role, "Safety-sensitive" means any job that includes tasks or duties that the employer reasonably believes could affect the safety and health of the employee performing the task or others

Requirements
Requirements

Qualifications: To perform this job successfully an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Requirements:

· Must be able to effectively control and manipulate various pneumatic and hand tools such as drills, screwdrivers, clamps, and pliers.

· Must be able to safely operate a power hand saw.

· Demonstrated knowledge and proficiency in interpreting SDS and hazard warning labels.

· Must have current and valid driver’s license.

· Must have current certification or recent certification as forklift operator as assigned.

· Must have sensitivity to safety regulations and requirements.

· Able to work within the time constraints dictated by company’s agreement to customer requests.

· Must know how to read and use a tape measure.

· Able to self-inspect personal work and correct discrepancies in a timely manner.

· Must meet or exceed current training requirements.

· Available to assist in other areas of the company, as directed by supervisor.

· Must be able to speak, read and write English in order to safely and accurately follow all processes.

· MS Windows?. Microsoft Office Environment, basic knowledge of Excel

· Basic experience in part tracking system (ex: Royal IV)

Key Competencies:

· Strong organization skills

· High level of attention to detail and accuracy

· Ability to prioritize

· Professional level written and verbal communication skills

· Problem-solving skills

· Interpersonal skills

· Decision-making skills

· High level of integrity

· Ability to thrive in a fast paced, high volume, team environment

Education and/or Experience: High School Graduate or GED. 0-1 years’ experience in a warehouse or manufacturing environment. 1 year data entry or comparable experience. Preferred Skills (not required), warehouse environment-manufacturing and-or aerospace experience. Intermediate excel usage/knowledge. Basic knowledge of MRP systems, and actively participates in implementation and maintenance of key quality principles, lean manufacturing, and 5s programs.

Job Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Reading: The ability to read, and interpret English documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, procedure manuals and reports, drawings and schematics

Writing: The ability to write and/or type all types of correspondence or reports.

Mathematics: Basic knowledge of accounting principles with the ability to analyze figures and basic mathematical skills

Customer Service: Knowledge of principles and processes for providing customer service. This includes customer needs assessment, meeting quality standards for services and evaluation of customer satisfaction.

Reading Comprehension: Understanding written sentences and paragraphs in work related documents.

Judgment and Decision Making: Considering the relative costs and benefits of potential actions to choose the most appropriate one.

Social Perceptiveness: Being aware of others’ reactions and understanding why they react as they do.

Critical Thinking: Using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems

Complex Problem Solving: Identifying complex problems and reviewing related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions

Oral Expression: The ability to communicate information and ideas in speaking so others will understand

Oral Comprehension: The ability to listen to and understand information and ideas presented through spoken work and sentences

Deductive Reasoning: The ability to apply general rules to specific problems to produce answers that make sense

Inductive Reasoning: The ability to combine pieces of information to form general rules or conclusions (including finding a relationship among seemingly unrelated events)

Problem Sensitivity: The ability to tell when something is wrong or is likely to go wrong. Information Ordering: The ability to arrange things or actions in a certain order or pattern according to a specific rule or set of rules (e.g., pattern of numbers, letters, words, pictures, mathematical operations).

Attention to Detail: The ability to be precise and thorough in completing work task

Physical Demands: Ability to pick up and carry statements, records and marketing materials for placement in files or trunk of car. Ability to access record manuals and office equipment (cutter, laminator). Ability to retrieve items from lower file cabinets and shelving. Ability to work over desk for projects and communication with other personnel. Assisting with daily duties to retrieve files from lower cabinets. Ability to go up and down steps to go to meeting on second floor. Ability to grasp and carry manuals, folders, and other office equipment (staplers).Ability to work with employees throughout plant and parking lot.

Employee may be subject to random drug and alcohol testing under FAA regulations.

Work Environment: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Exposed to a combination of normal climate controlled office type environments and shop environments. Job tasks are performed in close physical proximity to other people. Exposed to any number of elements, but none present to the extent of being disagreeable

"This job description should not be interpreted as all inclusive. It is intended to identify the essential functions and requirements of this job. Incumbents may be requested to perform job-related responsibilities and tasks other than those stated in this specification. Any essential function or requirement of this class will be evaluated as necessary should an incumbent/applicant be unable to perform the function or requirement due to a disability as defined by the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA). Reasonable accommodation for the specific disability will be made for the incumbent/applicant unless it would present an undue hardship for the employer.

“Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veteran/Disability”

El controlador de materiales informa al supervisor de materiales. Los deberes y responsabilidades esenciales incluyen lo siguiente; A otros se les puede asignar: mantener la precisión del inventario a través de la consistencia, la seguridad, el conteo de ciclos y diversas auditorías que envían transacciones y investigaciones avanzadas nacionales e internacionales de M3 realizan otras responsabilidades de gestión de inventario como la capacidad asignada para priorizar el trabajo basado en las necesidades comerciales necesarias cuidadosamente y de manera segura, las piezas de materia prima y fabricadas para garantizar que la integridad y la calidad no se ven comprometidas por el manejo. Todos los empleados tienen el deber afirmativo de proteger y mantener la confidencialidad de todos los productos de la empresa. A medida que cambian las condiciones comerciales, es necesario que todos los empleados reaccionen y manejen productivamente otras tareas esenciales como se asigna ahora o en el futuro. description:
Description:

We are seeking a dependable and detail-oriented Material Handler to join our team at Metals America. The successful candidate will be responsible for the efficient, safe, and accurate handling of raw copper materials, finished products, and related supplies. Responsibilities include transportation, storage, and documentation of materials, ensuring smooth production operations in accordance with company protocols and safety regulations. Work is performed in a copper manufacturing and warehouse facility. This environment may include exposure to loud machinery, heat from furnaces, and heavy equipment. Personal protective equipment (PPE) will be provided and must be worn at all times.

Key Responsibilities:
• Receive, inspect, and verify deliveries of raw copper materials and supplies.
• Safely transport copper coils, bars, ingots, and other materials using forklifts, pallet jacks, and other equipment.
• Store materials in designated locations and ensure accurate labeling and documentation.
• Support copper production lines by supplying required materials in a timely manner.
• Track and log inventory movements using warehouse management systems.
• Perform routine inspections and maintenance of handling equipment.
• Follow all company safety procedures and proper handling protocols, particularly when dealing with heavy or sharp copper components.
• Assist in packaging, staging, and preparing finished copper products for shipment.
• Coordinate with production and warehouse teams to meet daily operational goals.

Requirements:
• High school diploma or equivalent.
• Prior experience as a material handler or in a manufacturing/industrial setting, preferably with metal or copper products.
• Familiarity with safe handling and storage of metal materials.
• Ability to operate forklifts and other heavy equipment (certification preferred).
• Attention to detail with strong organizational and recordkeeping skills.
• Basic computer literacy for inventory and logistics software.
• Ability to lift up to 50 lbs and work in a physically demanding environment.
skills: Diploma de escuela secundaria o equivalente, Experiencia previa como manejador de materiales o en un entorno de fabricación/industrial, preferiblemente con productos de metal o cobre, Familiaridad con el manejo seguro y el almacenamiento de materiales metálicos, Atención al detalle con fuertes habilidades organizativas y de mantenimiento de registros, Alfabetización informática básica para el software de inventario y logística, Capacidad para levantar hasta 50 libras y trabajar en un entorno físicamente exigente, El candidato exitoso será responsable del manejo eficiente, seguro y preciso de materiales de cobre crudo, productos terminados y suministros relacionados., Las responsabilidades incluyen transporte, almacenamiento y documentación de materiales, asegurando operaciones de producción sin problemas de acuerdo con los protocolos y las regulaciones de seguridad de la empresa., El trabajo se realiza en una instalación de fabricación y almacén de cobre, Se proporcionará equipos de protección personal (PPE) y se debe usar en todo momento, Recibir, inspeccionar y verificar las entregas de materiales y suministros de cobre crudo, Transporte de forma segura bobinas de cobre, barras, lingotes y otros materiales utilizando carretillas elevadoras, gatos de paletas y otros equipos, Almacene los materiales en ubicaciones designadas y garantice un etiquetado y documentación precisos, Apoye las líneas de producción de cobre mediante el suministro de materiales requeridos de manera oportuna, Seguimiento de los movimientos de inventario de seguimiento y registro utilizando sistemas de gestión de almacenes, Realizar inspecciones de rutina y mantenimiento de equipos de manejo, Siga todos los procedimientos de seguridad de la compañía y los protocolos de manejo adecuados, particularmente cuando se trata de componentes de cobre pesados ​​o afilados., Asistir en empaquetado, puesta en escena y preparación de productos de cobre terminados para el envío, Coordinar con los equipos de producción y almacén para cumplir con los objetivos operativos diarios
description_final: Descripción: Estamos buscando un manejador de material confiable y orientado a los detalles para unirse a nuestro equipo en Metals America. El candidato exitoso será responsable del manejo eficiente, seguro y preciso de materiales de cobre crudo, productos terminados y suministros relacionados. Las responsabilidades incluyen transporte, almacenamiento y documentación de materiales, asegurando operaciones de producción suaves de acuerdo con los protocolos de la empresa y las regulaciones de seguridad. El trabajo se realiza en una instalación de fabricación y almacén de cobre. Este entorno puede incluir exposición a maquinaria ruidosa, calor de hornos y equipos pesados. Se proporcionará equipos de protección personal (PPE) y se debe usar en todo momento. Responsabilidades clave: recibir, inspeccionar y verificar las entregas de materiales y suministros de cobre crudo. Transporta de forma segura bobinas de cobre, barras, lingotes y otros materiales utilizando carretillas elevadoras, gatos de paletas y otros equipos. Almacene los materiales en ubicaciones designadas y garantice un etiquetado y documentación precisos. Apoye las líneas de producción de cobre mediante el suministro de materiales requeridos de manera oportuna. Seguimiento y registro de movimientos de inventario utilizando sistemas de gestión de almacenes. Realice inspecciones de rutina y mantenimiento de equipos de manejo. Siga todos los procedimientos de seguridad de la compañía y los protocolos de manejo adecuados, particularmente cuando se trata de componentes de cobre pesados ​​o afilados. Asistir en el embalaje, la puesta en escena y la preparación de productos de cobre terminados para el envío. Coordinar con los equipos de producción y almacén para cumplir con los objetivos operativos diarios. Requisitos: Diploma de escuela secundaria o equivalente. Experiencia previa como manejador de materiales o en un entorno de fabricación/industrial, preferiblemente con productos de metal o cobre. Familiaridad con el manejo seguro y el almacenamiento de materiales metálicos. Capacidad para operar carretillas elevadoras y otros equipos pesados ​​(preferida la certificación). Atención al detalle con fuertes habilidades de organización y mantenimiento de registros. Alfabetización informática básica para el software de inventario y logística. Capacidad para levantar hasta 50 libras y trabajar en un entorno físicamente exigente.

description:
Job Summary/Overview

This position is responsible for maintaining and accurately reporting the flow of material at both plants including Work-in-Process, Semi-finished Goods and Finished Goods. The employee transfers empty material handling containers to departmental staging areas and services the material handling needs of the production employees at their assigned plant.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
• Using dead weights, check scale accuracy every morning.
• Weigh, tag and record inventory transactions for all production, warehouse, and outside processing functions.
• Record inventory movements in CMBIS modules to ensure accurate inventory records.
• Locate store items in proper rack locations.
• Maintain required paperwork.
• Must be able to perform the TPM required for all equipment used in this position.
• Maintain a clean orderly and safe working area.
• Inspect forklift daily
• Perform other duties as required or requested.

Knowledge, Skills, Competencies, and Abilities
• Ability to read and interpret documents such as Work Instructions, Manufacturing Prints, ABC prints, work-order packets, and Non-Conforming Material Reports (NMR’s). Must be able to verbally communicate with other employees, lead persons and supervisors.
• Ability to review production schedule reports to identify and label products during the -weigh-counting operation. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Must be able to operate weight-counting scales.

Required Qualifications
• High school graduate, GED, or equivalent.
• Employees will be required to complete training in the operation of the weight counting scales.
• Must have and maintain a valid forklift license.
• Knowledge of Kanban cards, pull systems, and computer data entry is required.
• Ability to safely lift/lower/push/pull up to 40 lbs.

description:
Overview:

RLG Healthcare, a division of Resource Label Group, LLC, leads the way in providing innovative packaging solutions to the Healthcare market. RLG Healthcare provides a one-stop shop for all pharmaceutical packaging needs including labels, folding cartons and boxes, inserts, outserts, IFUs and DFUs, Med Guides, and physician support literature. Our industry-best lead times are made possible by our coast-to-coast manufacturing footprint and our dedicated team of packaging specialists with a passion for quality and service.

We are currently seeking a reliable and hardworking Material Handler to join our team. The Material Handler will be responsible for handling all printed pharmaceutical materials, including loading and unloading trucks, operating a forklift, and transporting materials between manufacturing facilities.

Responsibilities:
• Safely operate a forklift to load and unload trucks.
• Handle, wrap, and secure pallets of raw materials and finished goods.
• Transport materials between manufacturing facilities using a company vehicle.
• Ensure all materials are wrapped, labeled, and handled with care in compliance with company standards.
• Reads production schedule, customer order, work order, shipping order, or requisition to determine items to be moved, gathered, or distributed.
• Conveys materials and items from receiving or production areas to storage or to other designated areas.
• Sorts and places materials or items on racks, shelves, or in bins according to predetermined sequence such as size, type, style, color, or product code.
• Opens bales, crates, and other containers.
• Records amounts of materials or items received or distributed.
• Weighs or counts items for distribution within plant to ensure conformance to company standards.
• Maintain accurate documentation of transported materials.
• Perform basical vehicle checks, reporting any maintenance issues to supervisor.
• Ensure timely delivery of all materials while adhering to traffic laws and safety regulations.
• Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:
• Valid driver's license with a clean driving record
• High School Diploma or equivalent
• Prior experience in warehouse operations or delivery driving preferred
• Ability to live and move heavy objects up to 50 lbs.
• Strong attention to detail and commitment to safety
• Ability to work independently and as part of a team

Why work with us? Take a look at all we have to offer!
• Paid Time Off and Paid Holidays
• Comprehensive and Competitive Medical, Dental and Vision coverage
• Company Paid Short-Term Disability Insurance and Life Insurance
• Additional Benefits – Long-Term Disability, Supplemental Life, Accident and Critical Illness Coverage Plans
• Excellent 401(k) retirement plan with generous company contribution
• We pride ourselves in investing in our employees by offering onsite training and the ability to have unlimited growth potential within our organization
• We believe in rewarding our employees with performance-based salary increases

Check out this video to learn more about us! https://vimeo.com/553408937/659ab4290f

RLG Healthcare proporciona una ventanilla única para todas las necesidades de envasado farmacéutico, incluidas etiquetas, cajas y cajas plegables, inserciones, exteriores, IFUS y DFU, guías MED y literatura de apoyo médico. Nuestros mejores tiempos de entrega de la industria son posibles posibles por nuestra huella de fabricación de costa a costa y nuestro equipo dedicado de especialistas en envases con pasión por la calidad y el servicio. Actualmente estamos buscando un manejador de material confiable y trabajador para unirse a nuestro equipo. El controlador de materiales será responsable de manejar todos los materiales farmacéuticos impresos, incluida la carga y la descarga de camiones, operar una carretilla elevadora y transportar materiales entre las instalaciones de fabricación. Responsabilidades: Opere de forma segura una carretilla elevadora para cargar y descargar camiones. Manejar, envolver y asegurar paletas de materias primas y productos terminados. Materiales de transporte entre las instalaciones de fabricación utilizando un vehículo de la empresa. Asegúrese de que todos los materiales estén envueltos, etiquetados y manejados con cuidado de conformidad con los estándares de la empresa. Lee el cronograma de producción, el pedido del cliente, el pedido de trabajo, el pedido de envío o la solicitud para determinar los artículos que se moverán, recopilarán o distribuirán. Transmite materiales y artículos de las áreas de recepción o producción al almacenamiento o a otras áreas designadas. Clasifica y coloca materiales o artículos en bastidores, estantes o en contenedores de acuerdo con la secuencia predeterminada, como tamaño, tipo, estilo, color o código de producto. Abre fardos, cajas y otros contenedores. Registra cantidades de materiales o artículos recibidos o distribuidos. Pesa o cuenta los artículos para su distribución dentro de la planta para garantizar la conformidad con los estándares de la empresa. Mantener una documentación precisa de los materiales transportados. Realice controles básicos de vehículos, informando cualquier problema de mantenimiento al supervisor. Asegure la entrega oportuna de todos los materiales mientras se adhiere a las leyes de tráfico y las regulaciones de seguridad. Otras tareas asignadas. Calificaciones: Licencia de conducir válida con un Diploma de Escuela Secundaria de Driving Clean o una experiencia previa equivalente en operaciones de almacén o entrega de la capacidad de conducción de la capacidad preferida para vivir y mover objetos pesados ​​hasta 50 libras. description:
Material Handling Branch/Operations Manager (PSM)

Department: Service

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: BR01- CHARLOTTE, NC

Reporting To: Craig Carrigan

Description
🏗️🔥 Lead. Optimize. Elevate – Become Our Next Operations Powerhouse! 📈📦

Why WMH? Because Your Career Deserves More! 🌟

At WMH (www.wmhsolutions.com), we don’t just offer jobs—we build unstoppable careers. With over 35 years of industry excellence, we’ve grown into the Southeast’s fastest-growing material handling leader, with 11 locations across NC, SC, TN, VA, GA & AL—and we’re just getting started.

We operate on honor, integrity, and a relentless drive for excellence. Your success is our mission, which is why we invest in training, mentorship, and leadership development to accelerate your career.

What sets us apart? We’re not just another dealership—we’re redefining the industry as a full-scale solutions provider, delivering cutting-edge automation, fleet technology, and next-level innovation that keeps businesses moving forward. When you join WMH, you’re stepping into a future filled with opportunity, advancement, and impact—because here, your career moves forward. 🚀

As a Branch Operations Manager (PSM), you're not just overseeing a location—you’re driving performance, optimizing efficiency, and leading a high-impact team that keeps industries moving. Your leadership will shape operations, enhance customer relationships, and fuel business growth in the material handling industry. This role demands strategic vision, operational excellence, and a hands-on approach to managing both people and processes. 🏗️🔧

Your Mission?
To lead, innovate, and execute a world-class operational strategy that strengthens WMH’s market presence and delivers exceptional service. You’ll oversee branch operations, streamline workflows, & develop high-performing teams that are aligned with our commitment to excellence. As a key decision-maker, you will drive profitability, optimize service delivery, & ensure that every aspect of our business runs like a well-oiled machine.🛢️🏭

Key Responsibilities

Operational Leadership & Branch Growth 💼🚀
✅ Oversee Branch Performance – Lead all branch functions, including service, parts, rental, and sales support, ensuring smooth operations and customer satisfaction.
✅ Optimize Workflow & Efficiency – Streamline processes, reduce inefficiencies, and enhance service delivery to maximize branch performance.
✅ Financial & Budget Oversight – Manage P&L, monitor expenses, oversee pricing, and ensure profitability while maintaining high service standards.
✅ Cross-Department Collaboration – Work closely with Sales, Service, and Corporate teams to align strategies, resolve challenges, and enhance overall business performance.

Team Leadership & Development 🛠📚
✅ Build & Mentor High-Performing Teams – Recruit, train, and develop a strong team of technicians, support specialists, and branch personnel.
✅ Set Goals & Foster Accountability – Establish clear objectives, track team performance, and cultivate a culture of continuous improvement and achievement.
✅ Lead Training & Development – Provide hands-on mentorship, technical guidance, and structured learning opportunities to empower employee growth.

Customer & Business Impact 📊🗃️

✅ Customer Engagement & Relationship Building – Act as the face of WMH, working directly with customers to ensure satisfaction, resolve concerns, and drive retention.
✅ Strategic Sales & Market Expansion – Develop and implement plans to increase market share, enhance customer relationships, and boost revenue.
✅ Vendor & Supplier Coordination – Build partnerships with vendors, manage procurement processes, and oversee invoicing and purchase orders.

Safety, Compliance & Operations Excellence⚡🛑
✅ Ensure Safety & Regulatory Compliance – Uphold OSHA standards, implement best practices, and maintain a safe work environment.
✅ Facility & Fleet Management – Oversee maintenance, repairs, and optimization of branch facilities, equipment, and fleet.
✅ Monitor & Report Key Metrics – Prepare insightful performance reports, track operational success, and drive data-driven improvements.

Join the Revolution: 🚀
Our work environment is as diverse as our ambitions, from climate-controlled offices to bustling warehouses. 🌆🏭

Power Up: 💪
This job is active, demanding your presence - standing, walking, bending, kneeling, stooping, crouching. You'll lift and move items weighing over 50 lbs. Vision? You've got it - close, distant, color, peripheral, depth perception, and a knack for adjusting focus. 👁️🏋️

Skills, Knowledge and Expertise 🛠️📝🗣️🎓💼📈
✔ Education: High School Diploma or GED (required); preferred 7-10+ years of sales/service management experience in industrial equipment.

✔ Industry Experience: Extensive background in Material Handling, Parts, or Service Management (highly preferred).

✔ Management & Leadership: 5+ years of experience in strategic planning, team development, operational efficiency & management experience , with supervisory experience overseeing 2-6 direct reports and 10-15 technicians (preferred)

✔ Operational & Strategic Oversight: Ability to manage branch operations, optimize workflows, and drive performance metrics.

✔ Customer-Centric Approach: Proven ability to engage with customers, understand their needs, and enhance satisfaction and retention.

✔ Regulatory & Compliance Knowledge: Understanding of OSHA regulations and other applicable industry standards (preferred).

✔ Technical Knowledge – Strong understanding of forklifts, material handling equipment, and product management.

✔ Leadership & Team Development – Proven ability to mentor, coach, and lead high-performing teams with a focus on growth and accountability.

✔ Time Management & Organization: Strong ability to multitask, manage priorities, and adapt to changing conditions while maintaining efficiency.

✔ Communication & Relationship Building: Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to influence and collaborate effectively.

✔ Technical & Technology Proficiency: Experience with Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Outlook, PowerPoint), Windows-based systems, CRM systems, & operational management software.

✔ Customer-Centric Mindset – Ability to build strong relationships, enhance customer satisfaction, and drive retention through exceptional service.

✔ Problem-Solving & Decision-Making: Strong analytical skills to assess challenges, implement solutions, and optimize branch performance.

✔ Safety & Compliance Commitment: Dedication to upholding industry standards, workplace safety, operational best practices, and compliance with government regulations.

✔ Valid Driver’s License & Travel Readiness: Required for occasional travel (20%), including product demonstrations, customer visits, and branch operations support.

✔ Industry-Specific Experience – Prior experience in lift truck industry and territory sales preferred.

Perks of Being a WMH Team Member:
🏥 Premium Health Coverage – Your well-being matters! We offer premium medical, dental, and vision insurance with HSA & PPO options + company-paid AD&D & life insurance (with additional coverage available).

🎓 Exclusive Training & Career Growth – Gain cutting-edge technical skills through our ongoing in-house/OEM exclusive technical training programs. We invest in your growth, leadership, and future success.

💰 Competitive Pay + Performance Opportunities – Earn a strong compensation package with quarterly bonuses based on fleet productivity and profit targets.

📆 Paid Time Off & Holidays – Recharge and spend time with loved ones with generous PTO & paid holidays.

📱 Cell Phone Allowance – Stay connected with a monthly phone allowance for business needs.

🚗 Hit the Road with Style: Enjoy your journey with our generous car allowance!

💼 Secure Your Future – 401(k) match up to 9% + profit-sharing benefits to help you build long-term financial success.

⚖️ Work-Life Balance That Works for You – We know flexibility matters, and we offer schedules that support a thriving career and personal life.

🤝 Collaborative & Inclusive Team – Work with driven, like-minded professionals in an innovative, people-first environment.

🎉 Unmatched Job Stability in a Booming Industry – Material handling is the backbone of logistics, warehousing, and supply chains. Your skills will always be in demand.

📚 Ongoing Professional Development – We invest in your success with mentorship, leadership training, skill-building opportunities & career advancement opportunities.

💪 Be Part of Something Bigger – At WMH, you're not just another employee—you’re a key player in an industry that keeps the world moving.

Your Cue: Take the Wheel of Your Future! 📢
This isn’t just another job—it’s your chance to be part of a powerhouse team that’s revolutionizing the industry and redefining careers. At WMH, we don’t just keep businesses moving—we propel careers to new heights.

🔥Don’t wait. Don’t watch. Be part of something BIG, something BOLD, something that makes you excited to jump out of bed every morning!

💥The future is calling—ignite yours today! Apply now.🌟

description: Who We Are Applied Materials is the global leader in materials engineering solutions used to produce virtually every new chip and advanced display in the world. We design, build and service cutting-edge equipment that helps our customers manufacture display and semiconductor chips – the brains of devices we use every day. As the foundation of the global electronics industry, Applied enables the exciting technologies that literally connect our world – like AI and IoT. If you want to work beyond the cutting-edge, continuously pushing the boundaries of science and engineering to make possible the next generations of technology, join us to Make Possible® a Better Future. What We Offer Salary: $18.00 - $24.75 Location: Gloucester,MA At Applied, we prioritize the well-being of you and your family and encourage you to bring your best self to work. Your happiness, health, and resiliency are at the core of our benefits and wellness programs. Our robust total rewards package makes it easier to take care of your whole self and your whole family. We’re committed to providing programs and support that encourage personal and professional growth and care for you at work, at home, or wherever you may go. Learn more about our benefits. You’ll also benefit from a supportive work culture that encourages you to learn, develop and grow your career as you take on challenges and drive innovative solutions for our customers. We empower our team to push the boundaries of what is possible—while learning every day in a supportive leading global company. Visit our Careers website to learn more about careers at Applied. Key Responsibilities Locates, audits, and transfers kits or materials as required. May perform satellite receiving functions. May perform materials pick-up or drop-off at vendor sites (requiring use of a van or truck). Performs cycle count to verify and maintain inventory Under direction from management, prevents accumulation of excess material. Moves stock as required. In a manufacturing environment, may replenish empty line-side bins. Receives parts and updates inventory records or shortage reports; may perform transactions in Oracle, or other inventory systems. Verifies vendor delivery before accepting parts and/or inventory. May monitor, update and maintain shortage reports including review of work orders. Under direction from supervisor, purges stock of excess and obsolete material. Takes action necessary to rework, transfer, or scrap these items. Operates powered industrial vehicles as assigned; may operate pallet jack, electric pallet jack and/or forklift. May drive a van or truck if necessary, or operate overhead crane. Regulates and prepares material for delivery to the cleanroom environment. Adheres to all safety standards and protocols. Follows documented business processes. Employees may be assigned to work in a spares environment, with a heavier focus on activities related to inventory management. Performs transactions in SAP. Other Requirements: This is a physically demanding position that often requires standing for extended periods of time, walking, working in tight spaces, bending, squatting, twisting, kneeling, reaching, climbing stairs and ladders, lifting, the ability to distinguish between colors, the ability to work in an environment with noise that may be difficult for some individuals with sensitivity to noise, the use of hand and power tools, and driving or operating heavy machinery including forklifts. Additionally, because this position may involve working in a clean room, the use of appropriate Personal Protective Equipment such as coveralls, hoods, booties, safety glasses, gloves, respirators, chemical aprons, and face shields may be required. Functional Knowledge Develops skills to perform basic, repetitive and manual activities in the job Business Expertise Understands own tasks and how they relate to others in the team Leadership Has no supervisory responsibilities Problem Solving Uses existing procedures to perform straightforward tasks; has limited opportunity to solve problems Impact Impacts own work Interpersonal Skills Requires basic communication skills and common courtesy Additional Information Time Type: Full time Employee Type: Assignee / Regular Travel: No Relocation Eligible: No The salary offered to a selected candidate will be based on multiple factors including location, hire grade, job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and with consideration of internal equity of our current team members. In addition to a comprehensive benefits package, candidates may be eligible for other forms of compensation such as participation in a bonus and a stock award program, as applicable. For all sales roles, the posted salary range is the Target Total Cash (TTC) range for the role, which is the sum of base salary and target bonus amount at 100% goal achievement. Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law. In addition, Applied endeavors to make our careers site accessible to all users. If you would like to contact us regarding accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact us via e-mail at Accommodations_Program@amat.com, or by calling our HR Direct Help Line at 877-612-7547, option 1, and following the prompts to speak to an HR Advisor. This contact is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications. We have seen a recent rise in recruitment scams and want to share some info to help you protect yourself during your job search with Applied Materials. Learn More
description_final: Quien somos materiales aplicados es el líder mundial en soluciones de ingeniería de materiales utilizadas para producir prácticamente todos los chips nuevos y exhibición avanzada del mundo. Diseñamos, compilamos y atiende equipos de vanguardia que ayuda a nuestros clientes a fabricar visualización y chips de semiconductores el cerebro de los dispositivos que usamos todos los días. Como la base de la industria electrónica global, Apliced ​​permite las emocionantes tecnologías que literalmente conectan nuestro mundo como la IA y la IoT. Si desea trabajar más allá de la vanguardia, empujando continuamente los límites de la ciencia y la ingeniería para hacer posible las próximas generaciones de tecnología, únase a nosotros para hacer posible un futuro mejor. Lo que ofrecemos salario: $ 18. 00 - $ 24. 75 Ubicación: Gloucester, MA en aplicado, priorizamos el bienestar de usted y su familia y lo alentamos a que lo haga mejor para trabajar. Su felicidad, salud y resistencia están en el centro de nuestros programas de beneficios y bienestar. Nuestro sólido paquete de recompensas totales hace que sea más fácil cuidarse de todo su ser y toda su familia. Estamos comprometidos a proporcionar programas y apoyo que fomenten el crecimiento y la atención personal y profesional de usted en el trabajo, en el hogar o donde sea que vaya. Obtenga más información sobre nuestros beneficios. También se beneficiará de una cultura laboral de apoyo que lo aliente a aprender, desarrollar y hacer crecer su carrera a medida que asume desafíos e impulse soluciones innovadoras para nuestros clientes. Empoderamos a nuestro equipo para que supere los límites de lo que es posible mientras aprende todos los días en una empresa global líder en apoyo. Visite nuestro sitio web de carreras para obtener más información sobre carreras en aplicado. Las responsabilidades clave ubica, auditorías y transferencias kits o materiales según sea necesario. Puede realizar funciones de recepción satelital. Puede realizar la recogida o la caída de los materiales en los sitios de proveedores (que requieren el uso de una camioneta o camión). Realiza el recuento de ciclos para verificar y mantener el inventario bajo la dirección de la gestión, evita la acumulación del exceso de material. Mueve stock según sea necesario. En un entorno de fabricación, puede reponer los contenedores del lado de la línea vacíos. Recibe piezas y actualizaciones de registros de inventario o informes de escasez; Puede realizar transacciones en Oracle u otros sistemas de inventario. Verifica la entrega del proveedor antes de aceptar piezas y/o inventario. Puede monitorear, actualizar y mantener informes de escasez que incluyan la revisión de las órdenes de trabajo. Bajo la dirección desde el supervisor, purga stock de exceso y material obsoleto. Toma medidas necesarias para reelaborar, transferir o desechar estos elementos. Opera vehículos industriales con energía asignado; Puede operar Jack Pallet, Jack Pallet y/o carretilla elevadora. Puede conducir una camioneta o camión si es necesario, o operar una grúa superior. Regula y prepara material para la entrega al entorno de la sala limpia. Se adhiere a todos los estándares y protocolos de seguridad. Sigue procesos comerciales documentados. Los empleados pueden ser asignados para trabajar en un entorno de repuestos, con un enfoque más pesado en actividades relacionadas con la gestión de inventario. Realiza transacciones en SAP. Otros requisitos: esta es una posición físicamente exigente que a menudo requiere soportar períodos prolongados de tiempo, caminar, trabajar en espacios ajustados, doblar, acumularse, retorcerse, arrodillarse, alcanzar, subir escaleras y escaleras, elevar, la capacidad de distinguir entre colores, la capacidad de trabajar en un entorno con ruido que puede ser difícil para algunas personas con sensibilidad a ruido, el uso de la mano y las herramientas de energía y la conducción o el funcionamiento de la batería pesada. Además, debido a que esta posición puede implicar trabajar en una sala limpia, se puede requerir el uso de equipos de protección personal apropiados, como cubiertas, capuchas, botines, gafas de seguridad, guantes, respiradores, delantales químicos y escudos faciales. El conocimiento funcional desarrolla habilidades para realizar actividades básicas, repetitivas y manuales en la experiencia en el negocio laboral comprende las tareas propias y cómo se relacionan con otros en el liderazgo del equipo no tiene responsabilidades de supervisión de los problemas utiliza procedimientos existentes para realizar tareas directas; tiene una oportunidad limitada para resolver problemas impactos impactos en el trabajo propio Las habilidades interpersonales requieren habilidades de comunicación básicas y cortesía común Tipo de tiempo de información adicional: Tipo de empleado a tiempo completo: cesionario / Viajes regulares: sin reubicación elegible: No, el salario ofrecido a un candidato seleccionado se basará en múltiples factores que incluyen ubicación, grado de alquiler, conocimiento relacionado con el trabajo, habilidades, experiencia y consideración de la equidad interna de los miembros actuales del equipo. Además de un paquete integral de beneficios, los candidatos pueden ser elegibles para otras formas de compensación, como la participación en un bono y un programa de adjudicación de acciones, según corresponda. Para todos los roles de ventas, el rango salarial publicado es el rango de efectivo total (TTC) objetivo para el rol, que es la suma del salario base y el monto del bonificación objetivo con un logro de objetivos del 100%. Los materiales aplicados son un empleador de igualdad de oportunidades. Los solicitantes calificados recibirán una consideración para el empleo sin tener en cuenta la raza, el color, el origen nacional, la ciudadanía, la ascendencia, la religión, el credo, el sexo, la orientación sexual, la identidad de género, la edad, la discapacidad, el estado veterano o militar, o cualquier otra base prohibida por la ley. Este contacto es solo para solicitudes de alojamiento y no se puede utilizar para preguntar sobre el estado de las solicitudes. description:
• Job Description
• You will be responsible for planning, scheduling, and controlling the production processes and material flow within a manufacturing environment. You will ensure that production targets are met, materials are available when needed, and costs are managed efficiently.
• Requirements
• A bachelor’s degree in Industrial Engineering, Supply Chain Management, or equivalent experience
• Minimum 3 to 5 years of experience in production planning or inventory management
• Experience in material control (preferred)
• Knowledge of ERP and SAP systems is a plus
• Responsibilities
• Develop and maintain production schedules to meet customer demands and optimize factory capacity
• Coordinate with manufacturing teams to ensure that production plans align with operational goals
• Monitor production progress and adjust schedules as necessary to accommodate planned or unexpected changes
• Manage inventory levels to ensure that materials are available to meet production needs
• Coordinate with suppliers to ensure timely delivery of materials and components
• Conduct regular inventory audits to maintain accuracy and minimize discrepancies
• Analyze production costs and work to optimize material usage and reduce waste
• Collaborate with Procurement Teams to negotiate terms with suppliers and control material costs
• Monitor and report on production and material costs to executives
• Work closely with Production, Procurement, and Logistics Teams to ensure adherence to production schedules
• Communicate production plans, material needs, and potential issues to relevant stakeholders
