description:
DIVISION:
U.S. AutoForcePOSITION SUMMARY
U.S. AutoForce, a division of U.S. Venture, Inc., brings together more than 100 years of experience as an industry leader in the distribution of tires, undercar parts, and lubricants to independent tire retailers, auto repair shops, and automotive dealerships.

The schedule for this position is Monday - Friday from 7:00am - 3:30pm, rotating Saturdays. Schedules are subject to change based on business needs, and may require overtime.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
• Load, unload, stock tires and auto parts in a fast-paced warehouse environment using industrial vehicles such as a forklift or picker equipment
• Use scanners to find and put away tires and assist with inventory control
• You can expect to lift 50 pounds consistently throughout your shift and occasionally lift up to 80 pounds. When lifting commercial tires you will do team lifts or use mechanical equipment.
• When working with barrels or industrial/agricultural tires you will need to be able to exert a pushing force of up to 40 pounds
• Some of our stock racks are 25 feet tall, so you must be comfortable working at those heights safely while operating equipment.
• Be on the move. You should be willing and able to work on your feet for extended periods of time and work overtime as needed
• Contribute to our culture of safety, ensuring adherence to all safety policies and operating procedures.
• May assist other departments, such as ecomm, inventory, and will call depending on business needs

Driving
• Drive a box truck under 26,001 pounds or other vehicles during one of our many routes while making 10-20 deliveries/day deliveries
• Complete and maintain accurate records and logs including driver's logs, fuel purchase logs, and other records as required by company policy and law
• Make on time deliveries at our customer's locations while in a safe, punctual manner in all weather conditions
• Perform pre-trip and post-trip inspections on the vehicle you're driving for the day
• Operate a handheld device, provided, and ensure all deliveries are fulfilled
• Ability to communicate effectively and efficiently with customers, coworkers, and management
• Collect payments from customers upon delivery of product
• The duties listed in this job description are not exhaustive. Team members may be asked to perform other job-related tasks and follow any job-related instructions given by their supervisor, subject to reasonable accommodations

OUR BENEFITS
• Highly competitive wages, starting at $20.50/hour!
• Weekly pay
• Work boot reimbursement program
• Healthcare benefits, available your first day on the job
• 401(k) with Generous Employer Contribution AND Match
• Paid Vacation, Sick time and Holidays
• On-the-job training and skill development
• Tuition Reimbursement
• Employee Discount Programs

Physical Demands and Work Environment

Physical demands: While performing the duties of this job, the employee must be qualified as to visual, auditory, physical, and mental ability to operate equipment safely with or without reasonable accommodation. The employee must frequently lift products weighing up to approximately 50 pounds, and occasionally up to 80 pounds. Occasionally exert a pushing force up to 40 pounds. Handling of commercial tires (e.g., rolling, destacking, team lifting) conduct team lifts or use mechanical equipment.
Protective equipment required: steel or composite toe boots, safety vest, safety harness , seatbelt, SRL (self-retracting lifeline). All equipment is provided by U.S. AutoForce except for steel / composite toe boots. All team members must be able to adhere with safety and manufacture guidelines for compliant use of all protective equipment.
Work environment: While performing the duties of this job, the employee may be exposed to weather conditions prevalent at the time. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. Fumes associated with tires and occasionally car parts and lubricants prevalent.

QUALIFICATIONS
• Must be 21 years or older (mandatory company policy)
• 1 year of professional driving experience (cube van, box truck or semi), and satisfactory completion of company road test by qualified assessor
• 1 year of warehouse/logistics or relevant experience
• Must possess a valid driver’s license and good driving record in compliance with our driver policy
• Ability to be trained and safely use powered industrial trucks (forklifts) and high reach lifts. Pass a forklift certification test
• Must possess a valid driver’s license and good driving record in compliance with our driver policy
• Ability to safely lift 50 pounds consistently and occasionally lift up to 80 pounds
• Ability to exert a pushing force of up to 40 pounds - working with barrels and industrial/agricultural tires
• Ability to follow instructions and safe operating procedures
• Demonstrated ability to provide quality customer service
• Ability to work overtime as needed
• Successfully pass a pre-employment drug test (do not test for THC / marijuana)
• Valid DOT Medical Card or the ability to obtain DOT Medical Card per DOT/FMCSA guidelines and requirements during the hiring process. (Please visit the DOT/FMCSA website for a complete list of requirements)

U.S. Venture requires that a team member have and maintain authorization to work in the country in which the role is based. In general, U.S. Venture does not sponsor candidates for nonimmigrant visas or permanent residency unless based on business need.

U.S. Venture will not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of an executed recruitment Master Service Agreement, there will be no obligation to any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without an agreement, U.S. Venture shall reserve the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, shall be deemed the property of U.S. Venture.

U.S. Venture, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or other protected characteristic. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may call Human Resources at (920) 739-6101.

Venture, Inc. , reúne más de 100 años de experiencia como líder de la industria en la distribución de neumáticos, piezas inferiores y lubricantes a minoristas de neumáticos independientes, talleres de reparación de automóviles y concesionarios automotrices. El horario para este puesto es de lunes a viernes de 7:00 a. m. a 3:30 p. m. , rotando los sábados. Los horarios están sujetos a cambios basados ​​en las necesidades comerciales, y pueden requerir horas extras. Responsabilidades laborales Carga, descarga, neumáticos de stock y autopartes en un entorno de almacén de ritmo rápido utilizando vehículos industriales, como un elevador o equipos de recolectores, usan escáneres para encontrar y guardar neumáticos y ayudar con el control de inventario, puede esperar levantar 50 libras de manera consistente en todo su turno y ocasionalmente levantar hasta 80 libras. Al levantar los neumáticos comerciales, hará ascensores en equipo o usará equipos mecánicos. Cuando trabaje con barriles o neumáticos industriales/agrícolas, deberá poder ejercer una fuerza de empuje de hasta 40 libras, algunos de nuestros bastidores de stock tienen 25 pies de altura, por lo que debe sentirse cómodo trabajando a esas alturas de manera segura mientras operan equipos. Estar en movimiento. Debe estar dispuesto y capaz de trabajar en sus pies durante períodos prolongados de tiempo y trabajar horas extras, según sea necesario, contribuya a nuestra cultura de seguridad, asegurando el cumplimiento de todas las políticas de seguridad y los procedimientos operativos. Puede ayudar a otros departamentos, como el comercio electrónico, el inventario, y llamará dependiendo de las necesidades comerciales que conducen un camión de caja por debajo de 26,001 libras u otros vehículos durante una de nuestras muchas rutas mientras realizan 10-20 entregas/entregas diarias y mantienen registros y registros precisos, incluidos los registros de la compra de combustibles, y otras registros de la empresa, según lo requerido por las políticas y la ley de la compañía, las entregas de la compañía, mientras están en las ubicaciones de los clientes, mientras que están en una forma segura, los registros de los controladores de combustible y otros registros de la empresa. Las inspecciones posteriores al viaje en el vehículo que conduce durante el día operan un dispositivo portátil, proporcionado y garantiza que todas las entregas se cumplan la capacidad de comunicarse de manera efectiva y eficiente con los clientes, los compañeros de trabajo y la gerencia recopilan los pagos de los clientes después de la entrega de productos que los deberes enumerados en esta descripción del trabajo no son exhaustivos. Se puede pedir a los miembros del equipo que realicen otras tareas relacionadas con el trabajo y sigan las instrucciones relacionadas con el trabajo dadas por su supervisor, sujeto a alojamientos razonables, nuestros beneficios altamente competitivos, ¡a partir de $ 20. 50/hora! Programa de reembolso de Boot de trabajo de pago semanal Beneficios de salud, disponible su primer día en el trabajo 401 (k) con una generosa contribución del empleador y coincidir con vacaciones pagadas, tiempo de enfermedad y vacaciones en el trabajo de capacitación y desarrollo de habilidad alojamiento. El empleado debe levantar frecuentemente productos que pesen hasta aproximadamente 50 libras, y ocasionalmente hasta 80 libras. Ocasionalmente ejerce una fuerza de empuje hasta 40 libras. Manejo de neumáticos comerciales (por ejemplo, rodamiento, destacado, levantamiento del equipo) realiza ascensores del equipo o usa equipos mecánicos. Equipo de protección requerido: botas de acero o punta compuesta, chaleco de seguridad, arnés de seguridad, cinturón de seguridad, SRL (línea de vida auto-retractante). description:
POSITION SUMMARY:
• A Material Handler Operator handles, moves and stores various non-hazardous and hazardous materials within Ventower’s property. Main duties include loading and unloading different transport items, recording inventory statuses, and making sure deliveries properly match purchase orders.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO THE FOLLOWING:
• Operate large forklifts to safely unload and move steel plates and similar materials of 20,000 - 40,000 lbs. Operate motor vehicles - including small forklifts and trucks
• - to retrieve miscellaneous consumable items.
• Organize mixed materials by type.
• Perform regular vehicle maintenance and inspections in accordance with established rules and regulations.
• Verify inventory received by type and quantity, reporting discrepancies or problems to supervisor.
• Prepare shipping documents and related reports.
• Input inventory information, vehicle maintenance requirements and other information into computer system
• Loading and unloading hazardous waste materials including paint waste
• Identification, and ensuring the correct documentation on hazardous waste manifests.
• Other duties as assigned.

REQUIREMENTS:
• High school diploma or equivalent qualification.
• A minimum of 2 years’ experience in a similar role.
• Occupational Safety & Health Administration (OSHA) forklift certification is an advantage.
• Excellent physical fitness with the ability to lift up to a maximum of 100 pounds.
• Availability to work overtime including weekends, public holidays, and evenings.

QUALIFICATIONS:
• 2 years’ experience operating heavy forklifts.
• Understanding of the balance and leverage concepts needed to safely load and unload heavy materials.
• Able to use and maintain appropriate tools and equipment.
• Able to lift and carry objects up to 50 pounds.
• Able to work inside and outside in cold, damp, drafty and hot areas.
• Able to perform work on hard surfaces, in work areas that require the incumbent to stand, stoop, bend and work in tiring and uncomfortable positions.
• Able to exert moderate physical effort used in operating hand and foot controls while driving, turning, starting, and stopping the forklift and raising, lowering, and tilting the loads being moved.
• You must provide your own steel-toed shoes.
• Able to complete training for MI state forklift certification.
• Able to take and pass background check and drug test as conditions for employment.
• Legally authorized to work in the United States.
skills: Diploma de escuela secundaria o calificación equivalente, Un mínimo de 2 años de experiencia en un papel similar, La certificación de montacargas en la Administración de Seguridad y Salud Ocupacional (OSHA) es una ventaja, Excelente aptitud física con la capacidad de levantar hasta un máximo de 100 libras, Disponibilidad para trabajar horas extras, incluidos fines de semana, días festivos y tardes., 2 años de experiencia operando elevadores pesados, Comprensión del equilibrio y apalancamiento Los conceptos necesarios para cargar y descargar de forma segura materiales pesados, Capaz de usar y mantener herramientas y equipos apropiados, Capaz de levantar y transportar objetos de hasta 50 libras, Capaz de trabajar dentro y fuera en áreas frías, húmedas, corrientes y calientes, Capaz de realizar el trabajo en superficies duras, en áreas de trabajo que requieren que el titular se pare, se incline, se doble y el trabajo en posiciones agotadoras e incómodas, Capaz de ejercer un esfuerzo físico moderado utilizado para operar los controles de las manos y el pie mientras conduce, giran, comienza y detiene la carretilla elevadora y la elevación, bajando e inclinando las cargas que se mueven, Debe proporcionar sus propios zapatos con punta de acero, Capaz de completar la capacitación para la certificación de montacargas de MI State, Capaz de tomar y aprobar la verificación de antecedentes y la prueba de drogas como condiciones para el empleo, Legalmente autorizado para trabajar en los Estados Unidos, Un operador de manejador de materiales maneja, se mueve y almacena varios materiales no peligrosos y peligrosos dentro de la propiedad de Ventower, Las tareas principales incluyen cargar y descargar diferentes elementos de transporte, registrar estados de inventario y asegurarse de que las entregas coincidan correctamente las órdenes de compra, Opere grandes carretillas elevadoras para descargar y mover de manera segura placas de acero y materiales similares de 20,000 - 40,000 libras, Operar vehículos de motor, incluidos pequeñas carretillas elevadoras y camiones, - Recuperar artículos consumibles misceláneos, Organizar materiales mixtos por tipo, Realice el mantenimiento e inspecciones regulares del vehículo de acuerdo con las reglas y reglamentos establecidos, Verificar el inventario recibido por tipo y cantidad, informando discrepancias o problemas al supervisor, Preparar documentos de envío e informes relacionados, Información de inventario de entrada, requisitos de mantenimiento del vehículo y otra información en el sistema informático, Carga y descarga de materiales de desecho peligrosos, incluidos los desechos de pintura,, Identificación y garantizar la documentación correcta sobre los manifiestos de desechos peligrosos, Otras tareas asignadas
description_final: Resumen de posición: un operador de manejador de materiales maneja, mueve y almacena varios materiales no peligrosos y peligrosos dentro de la propiedad de Ventower. Las tareas principales incluyen cargar y descargar diferentes elementos de transporte, registrar los estados de inventario y asegurarse de que las entregas coincidan correctamente las órdenes de compra. Las tareas y las responsabilidades incluyen, entre otros, lo siguiente: operar grandes carretillas elevadoras para descargar y mover placas de acero de forma segura y materiales similares de 20,000 - 40,000 lbs. Opere los vehículos de motor, incluidos los montacargas pequeños y los camiones, para recuperar artículos consumibles varios. Organizar materiales mixtos por tipo. Realice un mantenimiento e inspecciones regulares del vehículo de acuerdo con las reglas y regulaciones establecidas. Verifique el inventario recibido por tipo y cantidad, informando discrepancias o problemas al supervisor. Prepare documentos de envío e informes relacionados. Información de inventario de entrada, requisitos de mantenimiento del vehículo y otra información en el sistema informático Carga y descarga de materiales de desecho peligrosos, incluida la identificación de residuos de pintura, y garantizar la documentación correcta sobre los manifiestos de desechos peligrosos. Otras tareas asignadas. Requisitos: Diploma de escuela secundaria o calificación equivalente. Un mínimo de 2 años de experiencia en un papel similar. La certificación de la carretilla elevadora de la Administración de Seguridad y Salud Ocupacional (OSHA) es una ventaja. Excelente aptitud física con la capacidad de levantar hasta un máximo de 100 libras. Disponibilidad para trabajar horas extras, incluidos fines de semana, días festivos y tardes. Calificaciones: 2 años de experiencia en operar carretillas elevadoras pesadas. Comprensión del equilibrio y aprovechan los conceptos necesarios para cargar y descargar de forma segura materiales pesados. Capaz de usar y mantener herramientas y equipos apropiados. Capaz de levantar y transportar objetos hasta 50 libras. Capaz de trabajar dentro y fuera en áreas frías, húmedas, con corrientes de aire y calientes. Capaz de realizar el trabajo en superficies duras, en áreas de trabajo que requieren que el titular se pare, se agote, se doble y trabaje en posiciones agotador e incómodas. Capaz de ejercer un esfuerzo físico moderado utilizado para operar los controles de manos y pies mientras conduce, giran, comienza y detiene la carretilla elevadora y la elevación, bajando e inclinando las cargas que se están moviendo. Debe proporcionar sus propios zapatos con punta de acero. Capaz de completar la capacitación para la certificación de montacargas de MI State. Capaz de tomar y aprobar la verificación de antecedentes y la prueba de drogas como condiciones para el empleo. Legalmente autorizado para trabajar en los Estados Unidos.

description:
Company Description

Peerless-AV is a leading designer and manufacturer of award-winning audio solutions for over 75 years. Our AV solutions range from interactive kiosks, outdoor displays, video wall mounts and more. You may not know Peerless-AV by name, but you have likely seen our products in malls, amusement parks, hotels, sport stadiums and/or different restaurant drive-thru.
• We are leading the industry by providing our customers with standard-setting product quality, service and value.
• We strive to create a fun work environment throughout the year, not just during the holiday seasons. Employees look forward to our company parties with raffles, contests, lunch and laughs.

Job Description

To maintain distribution of products and component parts according to the needs of the department by delivering materials and supplies to and from warehouse inventory locations.

Qualifications

QUALIFICATIONS:

Education:
• High School Degree

Experience:
• Two years of forklift and warehouse environment experience preferred
• Preferred bilingual Spanish/English
• Some computer experience

Skills/Abilities:
• Effectively communicate (written/verbal) with personnel from all departments.
• Must pass material handler competency tests.
• Must pass Peerless Forklift Training Program.
• Must be able to work overtime without notice.
• Must be able to read basic Engineering prints to identify parts for transactions.

Pay:
• $18/hour

Hours:
• Monday - Thursday
• 5:00 am - 3:30 pm

ESSENTIAL RESULTS:
• Transfer material from fabrication and into ARA OR AWA locations.
• Maintain inventory by correctly identifying, labeling, and placing materials and supplies in stock. Inventory Identification Tags must be maintained during all transactions.
• Pulls materials and supplies for work orders, move tickets, material reqs. delivers them to appropriate workstations or other locations.
• Supports other departments by executing inventory adjustments and physical deliveries.
• Oversee and maintain warehouse vehicles and equipment by following manufacturer's standards of use and reports damage or mechanical problems to the Maintenance department. Maintains and verifies that all forklift checklists are properly filled out.
• Maintains/Promotes safe, organized, and clean working environment by complying with procedures, rules, and regulations.
• Contributes to team effort with all departments by accomplishing related results as needed
• Performs regular random audits on MH physical and systematical transactions.
• Verifies inventory is properly marked and stocked in correct locations.
• Handles issues with inventory discrepancies
• Perform other duties as assigned.

WORKING CONDITIONS:
• Must be able to work overtime, including weekends as needed.
• Must be physically capable of standing/bending/stooping/squeezing 8+ hour shift(s)
• Must be able to lift, carry and/or move up to 30 lbs. without assistance. Anything above 30 lbs. requires a team lift.
• Must have the ability to push, pull material and equipment as needed.
• Must be able to wear required safety equipment including glasses, gloves and harnesses.

Additional Information

We offer stability, competitive pay, plus outstanding benefits, including Blue Cross Blue Shield PPO health plan with eye and dental care, 401(k) with company match, paid vacation and a friendly, progressive work environment.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

3:30 pm, Transfiera el material de la fabricación y en las ubicaciones ARA o AWA, Mantener el inventario identificando, etiquetando y colocando correctamente los materiales y suministros en stock, Las etiquetas de identificación de inventario deben mantenerse durante todas las transacciones, Tira de materiales y suministros para pedidos laborales, mueve boletos, reqs de materiales, los ofrece a estaciones de trabajo apropiadas u otras ubicaciones, Apoya a otros departamentos ejecutando ajustes de inventario y entregas físicas, Supervisar y mantener vehículos y equipos de almacén siguiendo los estándares de uso del fabricante e informa daños o problemas mecánicos al departamento de mantenimiento, Mantiene y verifica que todas las listas de verificación de montacargas se completen correctamente, Mantiene/promueve un entorno de trabajo seguro, organizado y limpio al cumplir con los procedimientos, reglas y reglamentos, Contribuye al esfuerzo de equipo con todos los departamentos logrando resultados relacionados según sea necesario, Realiza auditorías aleatorias regulares en transacciones físicas y sistemáticas de MH, Verifica el inventario está correctamente marcado y almacenado en ubicaciones correctas, Maneja problemas con discrepancias de inventario, Realizar otras tareas asignadas, Debe poder trabajar horas extras, incluidos los fines de semana según sea necesario
description_final: Descripción de la empresa Peerless-AV es un diseñador y fabricante líder de soluciones de audio galardonadas durante más de 75 años. Nuestras soluciones AV van desde quioscos interactivos, pantallas al aire libre, soportes de paredes de video y más. Es posible que no conozca a Peerless-AV por su nombre, pero es probable que haya visto nuestros productos en centros comerciales, parques de diversiones, hoteles, estadios deportivos y/o diferentes restaurantes. Estamos liderando la industria al proporcionar a nuestros clientes la calidad, el servicio y el valor que establece el producto estándar. Nos esforzamos por crear un ambiente de trabajo divertido durante todo el año, no solo durante las temporadas de vacaciones. Los empleados esperan con ansias las fiestas de nuestra empresa con rifas, concursos, almuerzo y risas. Descripción del trabajo Para mantener la distribución de productos y piezas de componentes de acuerdo con las necesidades del departamento mediante la entrega de materiales y suministros hacia y desde las ubicaciones de inventario de almacén. Calificaciones CALIFICACIONES: Educación: Experiencia de grado secundario: dos años de montacargas y experiencia ambiental de almacén preferido preferido español/inglés algunas habilidades/habilidades de experiencia informática: comunicarse efectivamente (escrito/verbal) con personal de todos los departamentos. Debe pasar pruebas de competencia del manejador de material. Debe pasar un programa de capacitación para carretillas elevadoras sin igual. Debe poder trabajar horas extras sin previo aviso. Debe poder leer impresiones de ingeniería básicas para identificar piezas para transacciones. PAGO: $ 18/HORA HORA: lunes a jueves de 5:00 a. m. a 3:30 PM Resultados esenciales: transferir material de la fabricación y en las ubicaciones ARA o AWA. Mantenga el inventario identificando, etiquetando y colocando correctamente los materiales y suministros en stock. Las etiquetas de identificación de inventario deben mantenerse durante todas las transacciones. Trae materiales y suministros para pedidos de trabajo, mueve boletos, reqs de materiales. Los ofrece a las estaciones de trabajo apropiadas u otras ubicaciones. Apoya a otros departamentos ejecutando ajustes de inventario y entregas físicas. Supervisa y mantiene los vehículos y equipos de almacén siguiendo los estándares de uso del fabricante e informa daños o problemas mecánicos al departamento de mantenimiento. Mantiene y verifica que todas las listas de verificación de montacargas se completen correctamente. Mantiene/promueve un entorno de trabajo seguro, organizado y limpio al cumplir con los procedimientos, reglas y regulaciones. Contribuye al esfuerzo de equipo con todos los departamentos al lograr resultados relacionados según sea necesario, realiza auditorías aleatorias regulares en transacciones físicas y sistemáticas de MH. Verifica el inventario está correctamente marcado y almacenado en ubicaciones correctas. Manejo de problemas con discrepancias de inventario realiza otras tareas asignadas. Condiciones de trabajo: debe poder trabajar horas extras, incluidos los fines de semana según sea necesario. Deben ser físicamente capaces de estar de pie/doblar/agachar/exprimir el cambio (s) de más de 8 horas deben poder levantar, transportar y/o moverse hasta 30 lbs. sin ayuda. Cualquier cosa por encima de 30 libras. Requiere un ascensor de equipo. Debe tener la capacidad de empujar, tirar de material y equipo según sea necesario. Debe poder usar el equipo de seguridad requerido, incluidos vasos, guantes y arneses. Información adicional Ofrecemos estabilidad, pago competitivo, además de beneficios pendientes, incluido el plan de salud PPO Blue Cross Blue Shield con atención ocular y dental, 401 (k) con coincidencia de la compañía, vacaciones pagadas y un ambiente de trabajo amigable y progresivo. Toda su información se mantendrá confidencial de acuerdo con las pautas de EEO.

description:
The Material Receiver will be responsible to ensure that all materials (mill coils, rejects and "in process" material) is received accurately, efficiently and in a timely manner.
• Must be able to use Calipers, Micrometers, Hand tools, Torches, Crane, Forklift and Shear.
• Cut samples for Mill Coils for testing of Tensile, Yield and Elongation;p as well as Rockwell, Olsen and chemistry testing.
• Accurately measure physical of material and describe using handheld and tablets.
• Download information from handhelds and tablets to allow material to be used in inventory.
• Some outside work is required and computer skill is a plus.
• Keep work area clean and perform all duties in a safe and timely manner.
• Training available for motivated candidates.

description_final: El receptor de material será responsable de garantizar que todos los materiales (bobinas de molino, rechazos y material "en proceso") se reciban de manera precisa, eficiente y oportuna. Debe poder usar pinzas, micrómetros, herramientas manuales, antorchas, grúa, montacargas y cizallamiento. Mantenga limpia el área de trabajo y realice todas las tareas de manera segura y oportuna. Capacitación disponible para candidatos motivados.

description:
Why work for APP?
• On-the-job training and opportunities for advancement with a strong promote within program.
• Medical, Dental, Vision – Generous company contribution, low cost to employee
• Life insurance – 100% company paid - covers employee, spouse and dependent children
• Generous Vacation Time
• 9 Paid Holidays
• Holiday Shut Down (Christmas thru New Year’s)
• Sick Time
• Annual Bonus (based on company meeting Key Results)
• 401k (Company matches up to 4%)
• ESOP Employee Profit Sharing Retirement Plan (100% Company Paid)
• Tuition reimbursement
• Robust training program

What we need:

We are looking for a Material Handler that can start working right away. We will train a person to assist with the transporting and handling of parts between operations and departments.

Job Requirements:
• Work safe and maintain an organized, lean work environment.
• Strong commitment to good attendance and being on time as it is critical to meet production needs.
• Stock workstations with parts.
• Ability to work collaboratively.
• Load and unload parts into tumblers, carts, or etching baskets.
• Maintain accurate part and/or work piece counts.
• Assure quality and production requirements are met, as per the job-specific travelers.
• On-the-job training will be provided for this position.

Skill Requirements:
• Wear proper Personal Protection Equipment in work area at all time.
• Must be able to operate in a drug-free workplace.
• In compliance with ITAR regulations, must be a US Citizen or US Person.
• English (reading, writing, and verbal comprehension)
• Must be able to work overtime when required to meet operational deadlines.

Compensation: $19.50 an hour. This is the lowest to highest hourly rate we in good faith believe we would pay for this role at the time of this posting. We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range, and the range may be modified in the future. An employee’s pay within the salary range will be based on several factors including, but limited to, relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, geographic location, performance, and business or organizational needs.

Entrenaremos a una persona para que ayude con el transporte y el manejo de piezas entre operaciones y departamentos. Requisitos de trabajo: Trabajar seguro y mantener un ambiente de trabajo organizado y delgado. Fuerte compromiso con la buena asistencia y llegar a tiempo, ya que es fundamental para satisfacer las necesidades de producción. Estaciones de trabajo de stock con piezas. Capacidad para trabajar en colaboración. Cargue y descargue piezas en tumblers, carros o cestas de grabado. Mantenga los recuentos precisos de piezas y/o de trabajo. Se cumplen los requisitos de calidad y producción, según los viajeros específicos del trabajo. Se proporcionará capacitación en el trabajo para este puesto. description:
Seize your opportunity to make a personal impact as a Material Coordinator supporting the Department of Veterans. GDIT is your place to make meaningful contributions to challenging projects and grow a rewarding career.

At GDIT, people are our differentiator. As a Material Coordinator supporting the Department of Veterans Affairs in Golden, CO, you will help ensure today is safe and tomorrow is smarter. Our work depends on Material Coordinator joining our team to coordinate and expedite flow of material, parts, and assemblies within or between departments in accordance with production and shipping schedules or department supervisors' priorities.

HOW A MATERIAL COORDINATOR WILL MAKE AN IMPACT:
• Review production schedules and confers with department supervisors to determine material required or overdue and to locate material, requisitions material and establishes delivery sequences to departments according to job order priorities and anticipated availability of material; arranges for in-plant transfer of materials to meet production schedules, and with department supervisors for repair and assembly of material and its transportation to various departments, and examines material delivered to production departments to verify if type specified
• Monitor and control movement of material and parts along conveyor system, using remote-control panel board, compute amount of material needed for specific job orders, applying knowledge of product and manufacturing processes and using adding machine; compile report of quantity and type of material on hand, move or transport material from one department to another, using hand or industrial truck; may compile perpetual production records in order to locate material in process of production, using manual or computerized system, and maintain employee records
• Work requires regular and recurring physical exertion, such as long periods of standing, walking, bending, stooping, reaching, and similar activities in and around distribution areas on a concrete floor.

WHAT YOU'LL NEED TO SUCCEED:

Education:
• High School Diploma/GED

Required Experience:
• 1+ years of related experience

Required Technical Skills:
• Required to have skills or the ability to be trained to operate various warehouse material handling equipment (MHE) to include, but not be restricted to the following; stock chasers, electric cars, stretch wrapping machines, pallet jacks, rate shop systems/shipping systems, dollies, hand trucks, electrically powered stand up forklifts, order fulfillment systems, mobile scanners.
• NACI Tier 1 Background Investigation (BI).

Location:
• Golden, Colorado

GDIT IS YOUR PLACE:
• 401K with company match
• Comprehensive health and wellness packages
• Internal mobility team dedicated to helping you own your career
• Professional growth opportunities including paid education and certifications
• Cutting-edge technology you can learn from
• Rest and recharge with paid vacation and holidays

Work Requirements
skills: Diploma de escuela secundaria/GED, 1+ años de experiencia relacionada, Requerido para tener habilidades o la capacidad de ser capacitados para operar varios equipos de manejo de materiales de almacén (MHE) para incluir, pero no estar restringidos a lo siguiente; cazadores de stock, automóviles eléctricos, máquinas de envoltura elástica, gatos de paletas, sistemas de talleres/sistemas de envío, muñecas, camiones de mano, montacargas de pie eléctricamente con alimentación eléctrica, sistemas de cumplimiento de pedidos, escáneres móviles, Investigación de antecedentes de nivel 1 NACI (BI), Nuestro trabajo depende del coordinador de materiales que se unan a nuestro equipo para coordinar y acelerar el flujo de material, piezas y ensamblajes dentro o entre departamentos de acuerdo con los horarios de producción y envío o las prioridades de los supervisores del departamento, Revise los horarios de producción y confierte a los supervisores del departamento para determinar el material requerido o vencido y para localizar material, solicitar material y establece secuencias de entrega a los departamentos de acuerdo con las prioridades de orden de trabajo y la disponibilidad anticipada de material; organiza la transferencia de materiales en la planta para cumplir con los horarios de producción, y con los supervisores del departamento para la reparación y el ensamblaje de material y su transporte a varios departamentos, y examina el material entregado a los departamentos de producción para verificar si se especifica el tipo, Monitorear y controlar el movimiento del material y las piezas a lo largo del sistema transportador, utilizando la placa del panel de control remoto, calcule la cantidad de material necesario para pedidos de trabajo específicos, aplicando conocimiento de los procesos de productos y fabricación y utilizando la máquina de agregar; Compilar informe de cantidad y tipo de material a mano, mover o transportar material de un departamento a otro, usando camiones manuales o industriales; puede compilar registros de producción perpetuos para ubicar el material en el proceso de producción, usar un sistema manual o computarizado, y mantener registros de empleados, El trabajo requiere un esfuerzo físico regular y recurrente, como largos períodos de pie, caminar, doblar, agacharse, alcanzar y actividades similares en y alrededor de áreas de distribución en un piso de concreto, Descansa y recarga con vacaciones y vacaciones pagas
description_final: Aproveche su oportunidad de tener un impacto personal como coordinador de material que apoya al Departamento de Veteranos. GDIT es su lugar para hacer contribuciones significativas a proyectos desafiantes y hacer crecer una carrera gratificante. En GDIT, las personas son nuestro diferenciador. Como coordinador de material que apoya al Departamento de Asuntos de Veteranos en Golden, CO, ayudará a asegurarse de que hoy sea seguro y mañana sea más inteligente. Nuestro trabajo depende del coordinador de materiales que se unan a nuestro equipo para coordinar y acelerar el flujo de material, piezas y ensambles dentro o entre departamentos de acuerdo con los horarios de producción y envío o las prioridades de los supervisores del departamento. Cómo un coordinador de material tendrá un impacto: revise los horarios de producción y confiera con los supervisores del departamento para determinar el material requerido o el retraso y para localizar material, solicitudes de material y establece secuencias de entrega a los departamentos de acuerdo con las prioridades de orden de trabajo y la disponibilidad anticipada de material; organiza la transferencia de materiales en la planta para cumplir con los horarios de producción, y con los supervisores del departamento para la reparación y el ensamblaje de material y su transporte a varios departamentos, y examina el material entregado a los departamentos de producción para verificar si el monitor especificado y el movimiento de control de los materiales y las piezas de los procesos de la fabricación y el sistema de transporte, utilizando el panel de control remoto, la cantidad de material necesaria para los órdenes de trabajo específicos, aplicando el conocimiento del producto y la fabricación de procesos y el uso de la máquina de transporte; Compilar informe de cantidad y tipo de material a mano, mover o transportar material de un departamento a otro, usando camiones manuales o industriales; Puede compilar registros de producción perpetuos para ubicar el material en el proceso de producción, usar el sistema manual o computarizado, y mantener el trabajo de los registros de los empleados requiere un esfuerzo físico regular y recurrente, como largos períodos de pie, caminar, doblar, inclinar, colaborar y actividades similares en y alrededor de áreas de distribución en un piso de concreto. Lo que necesitará tener éxito: Educación: Diploma de escuela secundaria/GED Experiencia requerida: 1+ años de experiencia relacionada Requerido Habilidades técnicas: requerido para tener habilidades o la capacidad de ser capacitados para operar varios equipos de manejo de materiales de almacén (MHE) para incluir, pero no estar restringidos a lo siguiente; cazadores de stock, automóviles eléctricos, máquinas de envoltura elástica, gatos de paletas, sistemas de taller/sistemas de envío, muñecas, camiones de mano, montacargas con alimentación eléctrica, sistemas de cumplimiento de pedidos, escáneres móviles. Investigación de antecedentes de nivel 1 NACI (BI). Ubicación: Goldenado, Colorado GDIT es su lugar: 401k con paquetes integrales de salud y bienestar de la empresa.

description:
MOO set out to shake up the world of print back in 2006. And we’ve come a long way since. Today we’re a 400 + strong team (we’re thinking of getting matching jackets) who create print and digital products for companies of all sizes – from Google and AirBnB to the guy who makes those amazing prints you found at a craft fair.

Our global HQ is in London, UK, while we also have premises in Dagenham. In the US, you’ll find us in Boston, MA Denver, CO, and East Providence, RI

We’re making new and exciting things – and we could really do with your help.

MOO is seeking an efficient, driven and organized Material Handler to join the company’s Manufacturing team in Dagenham. This role is a pivotal point for stock control and handling of goods ensuring the team are well stocked in their relevant consumables.

This is an exciting opportunity in ourDagenham location within a fast-paced production environment. This person must be efficient and organized to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines and have the ability to work independently as well as in a team. Can streamline working processes to the role.

Working closely with our small Warehouse Team supporting manufacturing and supply chain, and also in close physical proximity to the manufacturing and supply chain team in Dagenham.

The successful candidate will report to Warehouse Management and work closely with the manufacturing team.

This role is a pivotal point for stock control and handling of goods ensuring the team are well stocked in their relevant consumables.

We’re looking for a detail-oriented, self-motivated team player to join our warehouse operations. Ideally, this candidate can work well with others to meet team goals, but also stay focused and productive when working independently. Accuracy and attention to detail are essential, especially when picking, handling, and tracking materials. You should be able to stay on task without constant supervision and take initiative to keep operations running smoothly.

Responsibilities
• Competent and licensed to drive a Forklift Truck (FLT) to load/unload goods in and out
• To maintain stock levels in warehouse and stores
• Keep accurate records of stock movement in and out of stores
• Inform Supply chain and/or Manufacturing Management of any stock items that need reordering
• Inform Supply chain and/or Manufacturing Management when new stock arrives on site
• Carry out operations for multiple contracts, including inbound/outbound processes, loading/unloading, stock control, stock rotation, and investigations
• Carry out regular stock in intake for MOO (deliveries and put away)
• Ensure that Supermarket, WIP and other stations are loaded with correct levels of stock on a daily basis and input figures into Netsuite on a monthly basis
• Keep store map/plan up to date
• Make sure workspace is kept clean and tidy
• Ensure FLT and racking safety checks are carried out on a daily basis
• Ensure FLT is maintained and charged as required
• To be computer literate enough to carry out your duties
• Ensure non-production based cardboard/waste bins are emptied on a regular basis
• Waste pallets to be stacked neatly in the lumber dumpster
• Match P.O.s on file with incoming goods
• Attach receipt and BOL with PO and receiving documents
• Bring any discrepancies to Warehouse Management and Supply Chain
• Assist with UPS/USPS/DHL outbound pickups only if it’s necessary

The Person We Want
• The person we appoint to this role will be enthusiastic, imaginative, optimistic and keen to work as part of a team. To be considered for the role, you’ll need to show you have:
• Industry experience in a manufacturing stock/material handling role
• Knowledge and experience with computers and relevant systems
• Self-motivated and a team player
• Fanatical about the smallest of details
• Passionate about people - team members
• A keen eye for detail while consistently meeting strict turnaround times
• Keen to improve current processes and offer new idea

Nice To Haves
• Organizational skills are a plus
• Being an active listener

What’s it like to work at MOO?

MOO’s the kind of workplace where you can really be yourself. Dye your hair purple. Hit the sofa with your laptop. Whatever helps you feel comfortable and happy at work. We want to help you grow in your career and set you up for success – while also recognizing the importance of a healthy work/life balance.

That’s why we offer 22 days’ PTO plus Federal holidays, a 401(k) match, MOO stock option program, paid parental leave and we’ll cover 100% of your health, dental and vision care premiums. We’ll also cover you with life insurance and long-term disability insurance, and we offer a wellness program too. Finally, we’ll treat you to breakfast and fresh fruit every day, lunch on Fridays and all the ice cream you can eat (just watch for the brain freeze).

Diversity Statement

We are working hard to create a representative, inclusive and super-friendly team, because we know that different experiences, perspectives and backgrounds make for a better workplace. And that creates a better experience for our customers. MOO doesn’t discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion or belief, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, veteran status or any other protected class

As a design and technology company we have a desire and a responsibility to build a business that represents the world around us. So we strive to create a values-driven, purposeful and highly empowered organisation that we are all proud to work for. And we are committed to continuous investment in building an open and inclusive environment, welcoming a diverse audience of candidates who see themselves working and thriving at MOO. Therefore, we’d like to invite you to complete this optional survey to help us evaluate our inclusion and diversity efforts. Completing this form is entirely voluntary and if you decide not to it won’t in any way affect your job application. We keep the information separate from your application and it is kept secure and confidential, it is only used to better our inclusion and diversity efforts. By submitting this information, you consent to MOO's processing of it for these purposes.

description:
Company Description

With sales of €500m and 2,800 employees worldwide, Nemera is one of the leading global manufacturers of complex drug delivery systems for the pharmaceutical industry, offering to patients a broad product portfolio which includes inhalation devices, injection devices, nasal and dermal pumps and ophthalmic delivery devices. Nemera has built very long lasting, strong relationships with the leading global pharmaceutical companies globally by providing high quality development, industrialization and manufacturing services. Nemera develops and manufactures its own IP product platforms but also offers also fully custom developments and contract manufacturing.

Nemera’s manufacturing sites are located in the US, France, Germany, Brazil and Poland. The headquarters and Innovation Center for early device design and development are located in France (Lyon).

We have big ambitions at Nemera! We are growing our franchises and strengthening our capabilities.

Job Description

Purpose:

The Material Planner ensures that raw materials, packaging, and components are delivered to Nemera production sites to support production needs with optimal efficiency. This role involves understanding Nemera’s supply chain and production operations and being an expert on assigned products or commodities.

The Material Planner deploys inventory strategies, manages product changes and associated material planning implications, resolves exceptions, and drives supplier execution. This role requires daily management of supply and constraints, status reporting and escalation, supplier engagement, and a relentless pursuit of operational excellence and continuous improvement. Cross-functional engagement within Nemera and across the extended supply chain is essential.

Key Responsibilities / Essential Functions:

The Material Planner creates and deploys supply requirements via SAP to achieve production, inventory, and cost objectives. They ensure demand is supported appropriately, including production consumables such as PPE, gloves, and plastic bags. The planner manages safety stock levels, optimizes logistical efficiency by managing EOQs, and handles material planning, demand forecasting, and stock policy.

They gather market trends and qualitative inputs to anticipate shortages, run statistical forecasts and manual inputs from customer requirements, and challenge and integrate supplier forecasts. The role involves defining stock strategy according to criticality and stock level, building and maintaining operational partnerships with assigned suppliers, and acting as the primary interface with suppliers on delivery status, issues, and resolution.

The Material Planner coordinates supplier ramp-up and ramp-down for new product launches, ensuring suppliers deliver shipments needed to support production targets. They manage engineering changes to minimize obsolete inventory and ensure continuous supply, partnering with IT and other business stakeholders on planning process and system improvements.

The planner works in a stabilized environment, coordinates and achieves consensus between different roles and functions, manages supplier orders and market inputs, maintains and reviews reports and KPIs, and addresses data issues, managing setup and cleansing.

Qualifications

Position Requirements:
• A bachelor's degree (business or logistics-related degree is preferred)
• 2+ years of experience in material planning, inventory management, purchasing, or a related position.
• Strong organizational and time management skills.
• Knowledge of manufacturing processes and supply chain management.
• Strong negotiation and forecasting skills
• Good communication skills, both verbal and written.
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office and material management systems.
• Experience with MRP and SAP software
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Additional Information

Why Join Nemera?

At Nemera, we prioritize patients when creating drug delivery devices, understanding that accurate dosing and ergonomics are crucial for treatment adherence. Joining Nemera means becoming part of a team that enjoys working together and consistently delivers on its commitments. We take pride in our work because it improves patients’ lives.

We look forward to receiving your application (resume submitted in English is appreciated). We offer varied jobs job in an international group, if you want to discover more about Nemera, please look at our website www.nemera.net

Know someone at Nemera? We have a Referral Program so, be sure to have them submit you as a referral prior to applying for this position!

PAY RANGE: $75,000 - $95,000 USD Salaried (This is the range that we in good faith believe is the range of possible compensation for this role at the time of this posting. This range may be modified in the future.)

For US Benefits, CLICK HERE.

Nemera is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any person on the basis of race, religion, color, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other protected class indication. This company is required by federal law to hire only persons who can establish they are eligible to work in the United States.

description_final: Descripción de la empresa con ventas de € 500 millones y 2. 800 empleados en todo el mundo, Nemera es uno de los principales fabricantes mundiales de sistemas complejos de administración de fármacos para la industria farmacéutica, ofreciendo a los pacientes una amplia cartera de productos que incluye dispositivos de inhalación, dispositivos de inyección, bombas nasales y dérmicas y dispositivos de suministro óptico. Nemera ha construido relaciones muy duraderas y duraderas con las principales compañías farmacéuticas globales a nivel mundial al proporcionar servicios de desarrollo, industrialización y fabricación de alta calidad. Nemera desarrolla y fabrica sus propias plataformas de productos IP, pero también ofrece desarrollos y fabricación de contratos totalmente personalizados. Los sitios de fabricación de Nemera se encuentran en los Estados Unidos, Francia, Alemania, Brasil y Polonia. La sede y el centro de innovación para el diseño y el desarrollo de dispositivos tempranos se encuentran en Francia (Lyon). ¡Tenemos grandes ambiciones en Nemera! Estamos cultivando nuestras franquicias y fortaleciendo nuestras capacidades. Descripción del trabajo Propósito: El planificador de materiales garantiza que las materias primas, el envasado y los componentes se entreguen a los sitios de producción de Nemera para apoyar las necesidades de producción con una eficiencia óptima. Este rol implica comprender la cadena de suministro y las operaciones de producción de Nemera y ser un experto en productos o productos asignados. El planificador de materiales implementa estrategias de inventario, gestiona los cambios de productos e implicaciones asociadas de planificación material, resuelve excepciones e impulsa la ejecución de los proveedores. Este rol requiere la gestión diaria de la oferta y las limitaciones, los informes de estado y la escalada, la participación de los proveedores y una búsqueda implacable de la excelencia operativa y la mejora continua. El compromiso interfuncional dentro de Nemera y a través de la cadena de suministro extendida es esencial. Responsabilidades clave / funciones esenciales: el planificador de materiales crea e implementa los requisitos de suministro a través de SAP para lograr los objetivos de producción, inventario y costos. Se aseguran de que la demanda sea compatible adecuadamente, incluidos consumibles de producción, como PPE, guantes y bolsas de plástico. El planificador gestiona los niveles de stock de seguridad, optimiza la eficiencia logística mediante la gestión de EOQ y maneja la planificación de materiales, el pronóstico de la demanda y la política de acciones. Recopilan tendencias del mercado y aportes cualitativos para anticipar la escasez, ejecutar pronósticos estadísticos y insumos manuales de los requisitos del cliente y desafiar e integrar las previsiones de los proveedores. El rol implica definir la estrategia de existencias de acuerdo con la criticidad y el nivel de existencias, construir y mantener asociaciones operativas con proveedores asignados, y actuar como la interfaz principal con los proveedores sobre el estado de entrega, los problemas y la resolución. El planificador de materiales coordina el aumento y el aumento de los proveedores para los lanzamientos de nuevos productos, lo que garantiza que los proveedores entreguen envíos necesarios para respaldar los objetivos de producción. Gestionan los cambios de ingeniería para minimizar el inventario obsoleto y garantizar el suministro continuo, asociarse con TI y otras partes interesadas comerciales sobre el proceso de planificación y las mejoras en el sistema. El planificador trabaja en un entorno estabilizado, coordina y logra un consenso entre diferentes roles y funciones, administra pedidos de proveedores e insumos del mercado, mantiene y revisa informes y KPI, y aborda problemas de datos, gestionando la configuración y la limpieza. Requisitos de posición de calificaciones: se prefiere una licenciatura (se prefiere un título relacionado con el negocio o la logística) más de 2 años de experiencia en planificación de materiales, gestión de inventario, compras o un puesto relacionado. Fuertes habilidades organizativas y de gestión del tiempo. Conocimiento de los procesos de fabricación y la gestión de la cadena de suministro. Fuertes habilidades de negociación y pronóstico buenas habilidades de comunicación, tanto verbales como escritas. Competencia en sistemas de gestión de materiales y oficina de Microsoft. Experiencia con las habilidades analíticas y de resolución de problemas fuertes de MRP y SAP Software. Información adicional ¿Por qué unirse a Nemera? En Nemera, priorizamos a los pacientes al crear dispositivos de suministro de fármacos, entendiendo que la dosificación precisa y la ergonomía son cruciales para la adherencia al tratamiento. Unirse a Nemera significa convertirse en parte de un equipo que disfruta trabajar juntos y constantemente ofrece sus compromisos. Nos enorgullecemos de nuestro trabajo porque mejora la vida de los pacientes. Esperamos recibir su solicitud (se agradece el currículum enviado en inglés). Ofrecemos un trabajo de trabajo variado en un grupo internacional, si desea descubrir más sobre Nemera, ¿mire nuestro sitio web conocer a alguien en Nemera? Tenemos un programa de referencia, así que asegúrese de que lo envíen como una referencia antes de solicitar este puesto. Rango de pago: $ 75,000 - $ 95,000 USD Salariado (este es el rango que de buena fe creemos que es el rango de posible compensación para este papel en el momento de esta publicación. Este rango puede modificarse en el futuro). Para nosotros, los beneficios, haga clic aquí. Nemera es un empleador de igualdad de oportunidades y no discrimina a ninguna persona sobre la base de la raza, la religión, el color, el género, la identidad de género, la orientación sexual, la edad, el origen nacional, la discapacidad, el estado veterano o cualquier otra indicación de clase protegida. La ley federal requiere que esta empresa contrate solo a personas que puedan establecer que son elegibles para trabajar en los Estados Unidos.

description:
Responsibilities:
• Set up feeders and reels on the CCA manufacturing line according to production schedules and specifications.
• Perform routine inspections and maintenance of equipment to ensure optimal performance and minimize downtime.
• Conduct inventory reconciliation to ensure accurate tracking and availability of materials.
• Move products and materials within the production area to support various stages of the manufacturing process.
• Document and report any discrepancies or issues related to inventory, equipment, or production processes.

Requirements:
• Ability to work with various tools and equipment for setting up feeders and reels.
• Understanding of machinery operations and maintenance procedures.
• Accuracy in setting up equipment and conducting inventory reconciliation.
• Identifying and addressing discrepancies or issues in production processes.
• Ability to stand, walk, and lift materials up to 28 pounds as required.
• Performing physical tasks related to moving products and setup procedures.
• Years of Experience Required: 1-2 years
• Desired Skill Sets: Proficiency in using CMES and SAP for inventory tracking and reporting.
• Accurate documentation of setup and inventory activities.
• Strong ability to identify and resolve setup or operational issues.

We offer attractive, competitive compensation and benefits including, medical, dental, 401k, short-term disability, AD&D, tuition reimbursement, and more. If you take pride in your work and are committed to personal and professional success, let's talk. Please visit www.zobility.com to learn more.

Zobility is RGBSI's workforce management and staffing division. RGBSI is a multi-national corporation headquartered in Troy, MI with branches throughout the USA, Canada, Germany, and India.

description_final: Responsabilidades: Establezca alimentadores y carretes en la línea de fabricación de CCA de acuerdo con los horarios y especificaciones de producción. Realice inspecciones de rutina y mantenimiento de equipos para garantizar un rendimiento óptimo y minimizar el tiempo de inactividad. Realice la reconciliación de inventario para garantizar un seguimiento preciso y la disponibilidad de materiales. Mueva productos y materiales dentro del área de producción para apoyar varias etapas del proceso de fabricación. Documente e informe cualquier discrepancia o problema relacionado con el inventario, el equipo o los procesos de producción. Requisitos: Capacidad para trabajar con varias herramientas y equipos para configurar alimentadores y carretes. Comprensión de las operaciones de maquinaria y los procedimientos de mantenimiento. Precisión en la configuración de equipos y la realización de la reconciliación de inventario. Identificar y abordar discrepancias o problemas en los procesos de producción. Capacidad para pararse, caminar y levantar materiales hasta 28 libras según sea necesario. Realización de tareas físicas relacionadas con productos en movimiento y procedimientos de configuración. Años de experiencia requeridos: 1-2 años conjuntos de habilidades deseadas: competencia en el uso de CME y SAP para el seguimiento y los informes de inventario. Documentación precisa de las actividades de configuración e inventario. Fuerte capacidad para identificar y resolver problemas de configuración o operativos. Ofrecemos una compensación y beneficios atractivos y competitivos que incluyen, médico, dental, 401k, discapacidad a corto plazo, AD&D, reembolso de matrícula y más. Si se enorgullece de su trabajo y está comprometido con el éxito personal y profesional, hablemos. Visite para obtener más información. Zobility es la división de gestión y personal de la fuerza laboral de RGBSI. RGBSI es una corporación multinacional con sede en Troya, MI con sucursales en todo Estados Unidos, Canadá, Alemania e India.

description:
POSITION PURPOSE

Maintains, ships, and handles aircraft parts and material. Ensures timely location and acquisition of parts/materials for maintenance.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Other duties may be assigned to this position as needed.
• Accurately issues and or delivers parts and materials to various departments. Ensures timely location and acquisition of parts/materials for Maintenance using the computer tracking system and other resources.
• Ensures proper handling of aircraft parts during transactions, shipping, and receiving to avoid damage, flight cancellations or delays.
• Performs accurate and timely computer system transactions including parts/materials issue and returns, warehouse transfers and bin transfers.
• Receives and inspects parts and materials. Logs information in computer.
• Ensures parts/materials are properly stored, identified and comply with Shelf Life programs.
• Expedites past-due repair and purchase orders for critical spare requirements.
• Maintains awareness of Suspected Unapproved Parts (SUP) to prevent entry of SUP into Company inventories.
• Performs shipping functions of both hazardous/non-hazardous material using a variety of options, including creating and delivering counter to counter shipments for air transport.
• Reviews the computer system daily for open requisitions to determine if requested parts/materials are still needed and to cancel/delete outdated requisitions. Conducts inventory cycle counts. Accurately reports discrepancies.
• Works with different departments to ensure maintenance tasks are completed to support the organization.
• Conducts monthly self-audits including shelf life, hazardous shipping files and various FAA audits.
• Maintains tooling needed to perform maintenance tasks.
• Maintains a secure, clean and orderly stockroom per Company policies and procedures and FAA requirements.
• Ensures compliance with hazardous materials/dangerous goods regulations. Follows and complies with all Environmental Protection Agency polices that impact the airline.
• Performs other duties as assigned or required.

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES

The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability necessary to perform this job.

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE.
• High school diploma or equivalent. Must be at least 18 years old.
• Possess and maintain a valid Driver’s License and a clean driving record.
• Able to operate forklifts and other machinery.
• Must be able to pass and remain current on HAZMAT Dangerous Goods Handling course.
• Possess basic computer skills in Microsoft Office and Word.
• Must be willing to travel for training and company needs.
• Must be a self-starter who can provide excellent customer service.

PREFERRED EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE

Previous experience in warehouse, parts, supply chain, etc. is helpful.

LANGUAGE SKILLS

Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos. Ability to write simple correspondence. Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and small group situations to customers, clients, and other employees of the organization. Must be able to properly communicate between departments.

REASONING/PROBLEM SOLVING ABILITY

Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out detailed but uninvolved written or oral instructions. Ability to deal with problems involving a few concrete variables in standardized situations.

DECISION MAKING

Makes limited decisions and determines best methods to solve problems by referring to established precedents and policies. Impact of decisions is moderately low.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an associate to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

Able to focus with clear vision at 20 inches or less (computer screen).

Able to lift or move up to 50 pounds.

WORK ENVIRONMENT

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an associate encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.

Work in outdoor weather conditions within an open air hangar. Exposed to moderate noise.

TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS

Travel up to 10% of the time, including overnight travel.

Able to work a schedule that supports 24 hour operations.

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER, DISABILITY, AND VETERAN ACCOMODATIONS

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

description:
Functional Title: Material Control Specialist II

Pay Range: 37.47 – 51.52 (Depends on experience)

Contract: Long-term ongoing

No relocation offered, No Corp to Corp offered, No 3rd party recruiter candidates accepted.

PTO, Sick Pay, and Holiday Pay Offered

Scope:

Efficiently ensures availability of the right parts in the right quantity, at the right software level (E/E) and at the right time to support the Plant’s production program and Material Supply targets as they align to production goals.

Responsibilities

Performs basic data processing and parameter administration in the Material Control System.

Controls part availability for on-going series production, parts run-in and run-out, and processing of

technical and software changes within the scope for minimization of obsolescence costs.

Monitors internal supply chain processes impacting part availability line side throughout multiple departments including Procurement, Engineering, Assembly and other Logistics Departments.

Maintains and analyzes the monthly Supplier rating and yearly SUMIS (Supplier Management Information

System) rating information. Initiates corrective actions with Supplier and required escalations as delegated by the Section Manager, Pwrtrn, BiW and Exterior Parts.

Monitors the training of new hires.

Controls supplies and stock by timely planning the correct quantity at the correct software level of parts,

while at the same time optimizing the stock on hand.

Performs interrogation of multiple data sources (GPS/TAIS/SAP) to ensure information integrity.

Ensures adequate information flow to keep management informed concerning E/E issues, following proper escalation procedures.

Overall, on-time execution of internal and external delivery requirements.

Coordinates efforts with internal and external customers to maintain parts supply to productions. Interfaces

with Procurement, Engineering, Physical Logistics, Assembly and Manufacturing technologies to achieve the implementation of new software levels.

Ensures the availability of materials for future requirements at the correct software level.

Coordinates the economical transportation with freight companies to ensure timely pickup and delivery of

materials with our Lead Logistic Provider (LLP) or Physical Logistics Group.

Previews inventories of parts on the floor and in the warehouse and makes computer adjustments as

necessary to ensure accurate releases.

Coordinates internally with all departments and vendors during build outs, design changes and software

level changes to provide accurate data to eliminate excess overages and shortages.

Runs Material Requirements Planning (MRP) reports, supplier releases and delivery schedules to ensure material availability.

Coordinates flash campaigns with Assembly, Engineering, Physical Logistics and contractors including line feed situations.

Determines flash locations (internal, external).

Coordinates mode of transportation changes.

Coordinates the hardware breaks and changes within the E/EAdvanced = knowledge of computer skills including Microsoft Office, SAP, TAIS (preferred) Advanced = communication skills both verbal and written Advanced = German or Spanish language skills (preferred) Advanced = leadership skills team.

Reports to the management on the current situation, cost savings, obsolescence and other E/E issues.

Implements process improvements and cost savings.

Serves as a core member of the E/E coordination meetings (weekly CCB, CoC and SIT).

Coordinates I-Stufen implementation meetings for series and flash campaign meetings.

Performs other duties as assigned by the Operations supervisor.

Experience:

4+ years of related experience in Material Planning including Material Requirements Planning

(MRP)

Advanced = knowledge of computer skills including Microsoft Office, SAP, TAIS (preferred)

Advanced = communication skills both verbal and written

Advanced = German or Spanish language skills (preferred)

Advanced = leadership skills

Education

BA/BS degree in Logistics, Business Administration, International Business or 4 years equivalent

professional experience in Material Planning including Material Requirements Planning (MRP).

description:
Adecco is recruiting for an important industry, to join a team in Hillsboro, OR. The position is a Material Handler

Shift 5: (6:15am – 6:30pm) Sunday thru Tuesday and every other Wednesday***

PayRate: $19.75 / Hr

What you’ll do on a typical day:
• Load and unload material within a warehouse or storage facility
• Perform duties that may include picking, packing, scanning, kitting or counting products
• Adhere to the 7S program and maintain a clean environment at all times
• Use a barcode scanner and warehouse management system
• Work in a safe manner that protects you and your team members

What you need to succeed:
At a minimum, you’ll need:
• Experience operating material handling equipment
This job requires the ability to:
• Lift up to 50 lbs.
• Stand, sit or walk for long periods of time
• Lift objects of various shapes, sizes and weights
• Bend, stoop, squat, twist, push and pull
• Use hands and fingers to handle or feel tools or equipment
• Tolerate hot or cold warehouse environments

It’d be great if you also have:
• Basic knowledge of computers
• Receiving database background
• Attention to detail
• Availability to work a flexible schedule, with possible overtime when needed
• 1 year of experience in a warehouse environment
• Experience using a handheld scanner
• Positive attitude and the ability to work on a team to achieve goals and objectives
• High school diploma or equivalent

Pay Details: $19.75 per hour

Benefit offerings available for our associates include medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short-term disability, additional voluntary benefits, EAP program, commuter benefits and a 401K plan. Our benefit offerings provide employees the flexibility to choose the type of coverage that meets their individual needs. In addition, our associates may be eligible for paid leave including Paid Sick Leave or any other paid leave required by Federal, State, or local law, as well as Holiday pay where applicable.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled

To read our Candidate Privacy Information Statement, which explains how we will use your information, please navigate to https://www.adecco.com/en-us/candidate-privacy

The Company will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accordance with federal, state, and local laws and/or security clearance requirements, including, as applicable:
• The California Fair Chance Act
• Los Angeles City Fair Chance Ordinance
• Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers
• San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance

description:
Our Vision

A world where no resource is wasted.

Our Mission

To ensure that no resource goes to waste by empowering people to redeem every container easily, efficiently, and effectively.

Our Values

We are loyal, resilient, trustworthy, creative, competent, and engaged.

Summary
The Material Handler operates a variety of equipment designed to sort, count, compact or move empty beverage containers for the purpose of recycling. The Material Handler will process and record container counts accurately while meeting established productivity standards. They will identify, troubleshoot and report maintenance items in addition to maintaining a clean and well-organized work and loading area. The Material Handler must be dependable with punctual attendance.

Primary Duties & Responsibilities
• Adhere to OSHA Safety Standards and OBRC policies including but not limited to Personal Protective Equipment and Lock Out Tag Out
• Clean and maintain work area and equipment to ensure a safe work environment
• Operate a manual and electric pallet jack and/or tote stacker
• Safely load/unload trailer with totes and pallets and other items as needed
• Load, unload, push and maneuver full and empty bag racks of product
• Lift and empty bags of beverage containers from rack into sorting or compactor equipment
• Efficiently and accurately complete all data entry requirements and the processing of beverage containers to include receiving and processing of green bags
• Safely operate, maintain and troubleshoot equipment and Redemption Center tools
• Escalate repair issues when necessary
• Other job duties as assigned

Education/Experience
• High school diploma or equivalent education is required
• Work experience in a warehouse or production environment is preferred

Requirements – Skills, Job Knowledge & Abilities
• Possess the ability to work in a physical, fast-paced environment
• Ability to work well in a team environment

Supervisory Responsibility
• None

Travel
• None

Working Conditions/Physical Requirements

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms. The position involves sitting, walking and lifting up to 50 pounds for long periods of time throughout the day.

description:
About the position

The Material Specialist position at the University of Texas at El Paso involves maintaining inventory of property, preparing requisitions, and purchasing complex stock. Under general supervision, the specialist will allocate parts, tools, equipment, and supplies, as well as manage inventory across various storage locations including warehouses, stockrooms, and yards. The role requires evaluating recurring material needs, placing and verifying orders to ensure adequate stock levels, and providing service to customers by meeting their demands for parts and supplies. The specialist will take work orders for parts, issue parts as needed, and receive supply and service requests from departmental customers on a daily basis. Responsibilities include reviewing inventory records, determining stock levels, and maintaining accurate stock records. The position also involves conferring with mechanics to identify necessary parts, inspecting and storing fuels, lubricants, and oils, and working with approved vendors to assess price, quality, availability, and shipment dates. Additionally, the Material Specialist will prepare and maintain files of the inventory database system, monitor supply and materials costs, and perform routine accounting and budget tracking functions. The role requires generating various reports related to inventory and maintenance, conducting physical audits, and ensuring the cleanliness and safety of storage facilities. The specialist will also assist in training new employees and perform other duties as assigned, all while maintaining accountability for the inventory and supplies under their care.

Responsibilities
• Maintain inventory of property and prepare requisitions for complex stock.
,
• Allocate parts, tools, equipment, and supplies as needed.
,
• Manage inventory in warehouses, stockrooms, and yards.
,
• Evaluate recurring material needs and place orders to maintain stock levels.
,
• Provide service to customers by meeting demands for parts and supplies.
,
• Take work orders for parts and issue them as needed.
,
• Receive supply and service requests from departmental customers daily.
,
• Review inventory records and determine stock levels.
,
• Prepare, update, and maintain stock records accurately.
,
• Confer with mechanics to identify parts needed for repairs.
,
• Receive, inspect, store, and issue fuels, lubricants, and oils.
,
• Contact and work with approved vendors to identify price, quality, availability, and shipment dates.
,
• Order and reorder stock items to ensure minimum acceptable quantities are maintained.
,
• Deliver or direct issuance and delivery of stock items.
,
• Utilize technical manuals and computer programs to identify parts.
,
• Prepare required purchasing documentation and record expenditures.
,
• Monitor supply and materials costs and perform budget tracking functions.
,
• Generate re-order, receiving, inventory, and maintenance repair reports.
,
• Perform random physical audits and prepare analysis of inventory.
,
• Inspect goods delivered or returned for shipping or usage damage.
,
• Compile and analyze stock usage and shipping times.
,
• Keep warehouse, store, tools, equipment, and work area orderly and clean.

Requirements
• High School Diploma or GED required.
,
• Three (3) years of related experience and/or training, or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Nice-to-haves

Benefits
